review_body: This was our second stay at Hotel Ryumeikan. This time we had a standard double room no view. For 3 nights it was fine. Not masses of space but enough for 2 of us. Small tatami area at the end of the bed where you can sit at a small table. The room had everything you could possibly need (except a bottle opener which we were able to borrow). There is everything else though. Slippers, shoe trees for your shoes, yakatas and Japanese nightshirts as well as all manner of toiletries. The shower was great - didn’t want to ever come out. We didn’t eat at the hotel but there is an Excelsior cafe almost next door where you can have breakfast and many nearby restaurants for dinner as well as many restaurants in the station. As others have said the hotel is very close to the station ( but not noisy) so you can easily get from the airport on the Narita express and you can easily get around Tokyo on the local trains ( if you have a JR pass) or on the metro. You just have to find the Yaesu north entrance. This is challenging when you first arrive but Yaesu south or central are also ok. You just have to walk along the side of the station to the north end. We found the hotel good value for money. The staff were friendly and helpful. Though we didn’t see much of them as the rooms are on floors below reception. I would highly recommend this hotel for tourists or business travellers.

The hotel is extremely well located to Tokyo station and also the metro lines, very convenient walk and you can get virtually any were. Rooms are very well equipped and compactly made, but they still function well and serve the purpose. The hotel is clean, well organized, efficient and quiet. I had a tatami room which suited all my needs. We had breakfast included and enjoyed it every morning, mainly Japanese cuisine, but that didn't bother us one bit - food was very good and there was enough variation. Excellent place to stay for business.

Small hotel, very close to Tokyo station and metro [Nihambashi]. We stayed for 2 nights on our way to snow. Our room was very small but very well set up. We did not try the restaurant. I definitely stay there again.

Centrally located with many restaurants nearby as well as the train station. Very helpful staff, clean rooms, quiet and very good free wi-fi. Only had tea in their restaurant and the service and light snack was very good.

It is very convenient since near from Tokyo station.Room is enough space and very quiet. Breakfast is amazing. It’s worth of staying the hotel.Actually, price is not cheap. However, you can get more comfortable time with adding few thousands JPY per night.東京駅から近いのでとても便利です。 部屋は十分なスペースと非常に静かです。 朝食は素晴らしく、この一点に於いてもホテルに泊まる価値はあります。 価格は安くはありません。ただし、1泊あたり数千円を追加することで、得られる快適な時間は変え難いものがあります。
user_name:
tangoOscar94
New York City, New York

review_body: We stayed at the Hotel Ryumeikan Tokyo for only 1 night before we headed to the airport for our flight home. We chose it specifically for it's proximity to Tokyo Station and price point. It was easy to locate the hotel and get to/from the station. There is also a subway line right around the corner (which we didn't end up using for the short time we stayed). The hotel is beautifully decorated with a small gift shop and a restaurant on the 15th floor where reception is. We selected the Forus Double Room hoping it would provide a little extra space (Tokyo hotel rooms are known to be rather small). Our room was a perfect size for the two of us. It had a double bed with a sitting mat attached to the end of it. The hotel provided water, snacks, and even a cell phone to take out with you in our room (we did not use the phone so I don't know how well it worked, but thought this was a nice option). The bathroom had a phenomenal shower (ALL THE JETS) and I truly enjoyed that the toilet seats were automatic! All of the staff we encountered was extremely pleasant. The hotel held our bags after checkout so we could do one last activity before heading to the airport. I would absolutely stay at this hotel again and would recommend it to others visiting Tokyo.

Stayed in Forus Room. Was impressed with the cleanliness and amenities - aromatic shampoo, conditioner, body wash, convenient All-in-one wash, comfortable slippers, etc... the shower with 3 options was great with right pressure... The room was small but was alright for me with only a luggage and a backpack. It was also just a 5 min walk to Tokyo Station. I would use the hotel again for my next trip.

We stayed in a small semi western/semi Japanese corner room at the hotel for four nights over two stays. The room was very clean and practically laid out for two people. The location was excellent as it was close to Tokyo station was well as good options. We found the rate to be good value compared to other similar options such as the Courtyard Marriott. We will be back.

It was our first time to stay at Hotel Ryumeikan and in this part of Tokyo. Here's a rundown of the stuff that like or not like about the hotel:LIKES:1. Transportation scene. The hotel is just across the Tokyo Station hub and a walk away from the Ginza line so it's very easy to go anywhere by train or Metro. You can also take the airport bus to and from the airport because the terminal is just across the street.2. Food scene. There's a Family Mart convenience store next to the hotel so your basic necessities are covered. A few blocks away and you have restaurants and cafes, some are even open 24 hours. You can also explore the wondrous restaurants in the Tokyo Station plus the food stalls at the basement floor of Daimaru.3. Sleeping. Although the bed is really small (Part of my dislikes), for some reason I slept well in this hotel. It was also relatively quiet. I thought we can hear the noise coming from the street, but we didn't get that at all.4. Toiletries. They have luxurious toiletries! Although I'm not familiar with the brand, their shampoo, conditioner, and body soap smell really good!NOT LIKE:1. Small room. We booked the Standard Semi-Double from Agoda so this is expected. There are bigger rooms in this hotel, but we're not prepared to shell out for some extra space.2. Small bed. It's not a double but a SEMI-DOUBLE, so it's expected as well. This is acceptable for couples, but I can't imagine having the same sharing set-up with a business colleague.That's about it! I'd probably consider staying here again the next time we visit Tokyo.

Great location to Tokyo station, Room amenities are amazing !!! Anything you need they provided,Super clean and quiet, Close to many restaurants, a little high price but it's worthLove this place and will definitely come back for sure !

This was the 4th or 5th time I have stayed here. Love the location (right opposite Tokyo Station), and the very professional and prompt service of the counter staff. Everytime during check-in, they will prepare hot towels for you. Cleanliness is excellent, and the housekeeping staff are very polite too.The size of the room is what I would expect for a city center hotel, hence it doesn't bother me, as I stayed here for its location. Lobby is simple but very clean. The toilet at the lobby is very clean too.

This is my first time staying in this hotel as recommended by my friends, stayed for two nights here. It's great location close to big department stores of Daimaru and Takashimaya, also close to limousine bus stops for Narita airport. Staff are polite and hotel is newly decorated and clean.

Stayed for 9 nights in November 2019.My room was on the 14th floor and had a 50/50 view of a building and the street below. The room is small but the amenities probably exceed that of most mid-range hotels: comfortable bed, fantastic shower, extensive bathroom amenities, a 'Handy' smartphone, and free bottled water. The windows are sound-proof and also include blackout curtains which was also a very welcomed bonus.As highlighted in a previous review, the layout of the hotel is fairly unique. The lobby is on the 15th floor, but all the rooms are on floor 14 and below. Therefore, you will never interact with or even see any of the hotel staff unless you are checking in or out. This is the first time I've experienced something like this while on holiday. Nonetheless, on the very few times I did interact with staff, everyone was very nice and helpful. Cleaning seems to occur after 10am and was always completed to a high standard.In regards to location, it's definitely super convenient for getting around as both the JR Tokyo and Nihombashi stations are only a minute or two walk away. However, this area is considerably 'quieter' by Tokyo standards and lacks the bright lights + chaos of Shinjuku and Shibuya (either a positive or negative, depending on what you're after).Highly recommended, especially for the price.

I stayed at Ryumeikan Hotel Tokyo in 2018 for about 7 nights. Its a Michelin Star hotel with too many amenities in bathroom. It is very cosy and homely feel. No ghost haunting room worry too. But the pricing is overly high, which deters me from repeat visit.

A lovely hotel right across from Tokyo station and the airport limousine stop. A decent size room (for central Tokyo) at a reasonable price. Staff were very friendly and helpful. I would happily stay here again if I was back in Japan.

Awesome hotel, location excellent, service of staff has been great. Would absolutely stay here again ... kudos to the staff and the nice amenities and touches that make u think they really did care about making you comfortable ..Would recommend this to family and friends

Stayed at this smaller, boutique-ish hotel for a week The pluses: location, showerLess so: be sure you avoid the standard room which is tiny, the restaurant on the upper lobby floor is limited so the good location gives you lots of options within a short walkThis hotel is a mix of traditional Japanese hotels and a few western comforts The shower is fab, kind of unusual to mention and given I’m quite tall, I fit and there’s plenty of hot water. Needless to say, my needs are quite simple Will I stay here again? Probably, now that I have better knowledge

I wanted to stay at a good hotel close to Tokyo Station. This place was perfect. Right across the street from the station and was around $300 per night (mid-range for Tokyo). The room was 5 star quality. The toilet was 6 star. There is a great English pub/ restaurant next door, and I could walk to the McDonalds for breakfast in the morning. The staff are curteous and speak English.

We were not sure of what we were quite getting but once up to reception we knew that this was going to be a great stay. The location was close to Tokyo station, the Imperial Pslace, the local business district and loads of shopping and eating.Room was very clean and nice, with unique traditional Japanese feel blended with modern amenities. Bathroom was fantastic and loved the shower. No view out the window but that was not a concern.They also have a smartphone that is provide free of charge to use to navigate around the city and make calls if required which was a bonus we didn’t expect.Staff were friendly and gracious.Definitely somewhere we would come and stay again.Highly recommend it.

This was a great hotel for our first visit to Tokyo. The rooms and lobby area are very nice. The staff was helpful, providing directions and maps to help us get around. And the location is perfect. It’s a five minute walk to Tokyo Station (and even less to another subway station). It’s an easy walk to hundreds of restaurants, including many in the Ginza area. And, if you’re coming from Narita Airport, the Keisei bus stops less than a block from the hotel entrance. Highly recommended!

Hotel is conveniently located at the interchange opposite the Tokyo station, Yaesu North entrance. Right downstairs is the express bus stop to Narita Airport whilst opposite is the Tekko building, whereby one could take the direct bus to Haneda Airport. Hotel reception located on the 15th floor. Warm welcome. Room modest size, modern. Stayed in the family room, fun there's a tatami seating area below the bed. Easily accommodate a family of 4. Deco is infused with the new and old charm. Round window beside bed partitioning the bathroom like a ship's deck window. Amenities provided are good quality. Dolce coffee maker with variety of coffee for selection. Nice feeling after return to room. A little more to spend, it's a nice hotel.

This hotel has everything a traveler might need: besides the free internet, they provide a handy with 4G that we used during our wanderings during the day and evening, bottled water, refrigerator, delicious rice cracker snacks, bathrobes, kimonos, slippers, etc... The only thing missing was a safe deposit box. The room we had was small but they made a really good use of every inch of the room. We loved the shower cabin and the bath products were of good quality. Great neighborhood just a few steps from the Tokyo station.

Nice 3 day stay. The Airport Limo stop was so close ---we saw many people using it. You can also catch the Narita Express from the station across the street.The hotel is very close to Tokyo station; about a 15 minute walk to Din Tai Fung inside the Takashimaya department store, and an Excelsior Caffe almost next door, for breakfast --it opens at 7am! Nice. Very convenient location.The hotel had pajamas and kimonos for you to wear ---so beautiful and a coffee/tea set up. I've included some pictures.

Had a 5-day stay in this hotel for business. Awesome location, a couple of minutes walk from Tokyo station - you can get Shinkansen here to go to other prefectures, such as Kyoto, etc. The room is beautiful, with cultural touch (had a small Tatami floor seating area and Kendama toys). Sure, there was no view, but I'm not claustrophobic so I don't mind. And, Airport Limousine stops just across the hotel and Narita Express stop is also outside the hotel, so it's easy transfer from the hotel. Highly recommend! :)

Stayed here a few years ago (unfortunately only for 1 night). The lobby was very nice. As I approached the room, I felt like I was in a luxury hotel.Excellent location near Daimaru and Tokyo station. Nice glass elevator going up.Overall about a 4.5 star hotel. Only reason for not 5 is that the view was quite ordinary (just a wall from memory), and the room a bit small (although good size for Tokyo).

We love this hotel. It is conveniently located diagonally across Daimaru Tokyo station. It was easy to get here from Narita Express - we didn’t research and took the Keisei Skyliner from Narita; had to change from Ueno to a subway. Would probably have been more direct if we took the Narita Express, albeit longer. Do search for return tickets, usually cheaper.Food was everywhere around this hotel. So convenient. Many food stalls that locals frequent after work surrounding the area in the various alley - there was ramen, Yakitori etc. Not to mention the large variety in Takashimaya at Nihonbashi and Daimaru Tokyo station.We liked the location as it was easily accessible to most of the tourist attractions - more central and slightly quieter than Shinjuku area. Hotel staff were very welcoming. Hotel was modern, clean and provided things like toothbrush, bath salt, shaver, bath slippers etc. The room was a decent size, typical of the usual hotel in Tokyo, not too claustrophobic but not very big too. There’s a bath tub too. Would strongly recommend this hotel for its price given the location. Tokyo station and Nihonbashi station exit A7 was jus a stone throw away.

This hotel is 15 steps away from Kaisei bus stop (Kaisei bus from Narita only cost approx ¥1000) and across the road from Airport Limousine bus stop (this bus to Haneda, only cost ¥930). 100m away from huge underground shopping which is linked to main Tokyo station. How better can u get with this location!Very clean and comprehensive amenities. Reasonably large room for Tokyo standard, and the staff are helpful. The maps they offer are also very useful. But I must make mention the Handy phone that the hotel offers in every room. Free International calls and Google map and Internet functions to navigate your way around Tokyo! Excellent tool for all tourists! Only drawback is, its price. At ¥38,000 for a deluxe twin room. Maybe that's why the experience is so superb! Highly recommend!

This is the best boutique hotel in Tokyo. There are lots of amenities, free bottled water, free Wi-Fi, free mobile phone to use while staying, robe, Ukata, free slippers, almost free washing machine (¥100) and dryer (¥200) on every other floor. All toiletries, such as hair care products, toothpaste, toothbrush and skincare supplies, plus shoe cleaning kit and so on.You could just stay at this hotel without bringing anything except your own clothes.My room was small but unlike my friends, a couple, I was alone so it was adequate for one person.We didn’t eat breakfast at this hotel because we were leaving very early every morning. But we had once dinner at their dining room which was excellent. They really have a real Japanese chef in the kitchen. Overall, I highly recommend this hotel.

This is a comfortable hotel near the main railway station. We had a double room which was of a good size but I gather the single rooms are much smaller. The bed was large and comfortable and I thought the bathroom was very good, with a walk in shower as well as a bath. Also has a self-opening and self-flushing toilet. Reception and dining area are up on Level 15 while our room was on Level 8. A plus for this hotel is an affordable laundry for guests. The breakfast has a range of Japanese and Western options. I found the staff helpful and the Wi-Fi good. There is a British-style pub next door then a convenience store and a café next to that. The Daimaru food hall is almost opposite. Lots of restaurants near by.

We booked here for 4 nights and ended up staying for 5, thanks to JETSTAR cancelling our flight home (that's another review). The staff were so helpful, so polite and friendly, they arranged for us to stay another night and even gave us a discount on the additional night's accommodation. The hotel is incredibly clean, very well located near the Tokyo train station. The bathroom ammenities are very thoughtfully provided. The room itself was very small and not much storage space. The beds were comfortable enough. This wasn't a cheap place to stay but I would spend the money and stay here again because I liked everything about our stay. Just don't book flights with Jetstar!

This is our fav hotel in Tokyo.Really good welcome people. Facilities best. Even have a laundry convenient when stay longer or travel often.Breakfast can’t be beaten, a wide spread & tip up often. I had sashimi every day. Both western & Japanese. Location can’t b beaten when factor in price. It’s opposite the Tokyo station so convenient to all day reach parts of japan even for day to Hiroshima. Lots of restaurants nearby in back lanes & in Tokyo station. What u don’t get locally the trains opposite will take u there. We even got to idabashi-kuroketi soba by train.Housekeeping spotless. Beds it’s so comfortable, u don’t want to wake up. Very quiet rooms. Aircon quiet & really effective.Shishedo toiletries provided not to b missed. Toilet seats are heated.Thought we share this with u to make u Tokyo visit memorable.

It is so convenient with only a few minute walk from Tokyo station. A four star hotel with an affordable price. A very good base to travel anywhere especially if using JR train. The hotel is small as normal Japanese hotels but the room is super clean. And the setup of the room doesn't make it too cramped. They also offer 4-star amenities. Will definitely return if coming back to Tokyo again.

Stayed for a week in this hotel.You name it and they have whatever you need in the room. Even much more than what you may require.They have thought of everything. Even a phone which you can take with you while you are there. The bed is super comfortable with pillows of different kinds and room is absolutely sound proof ensuring a good night's sleep. The housekeeping service is excellent.They do a thorough job of cleaning your room everyday.There is a washer(200 yen) dryer (100 yen) which is so useful too.The best part- The location-Across Tokyo station and just next door to the bus that comes from Narita(Keisei bus.1000 yen only)So it makes sense not to use the JR pass from the airport and can save up a day on the pass if you wish. Also makes it very easy if you have heavy bags to carry. A cafe and family mart next door is an added benefit.Highly recommended

We just returned from a double stay, at the beginning of our first trip to Japan and as we came back to Tokyo after an excursion. The reception was formal but helpful, and the rooms are exceptionally well appointed. On the return trip, we booked the breakfast, which was more elaborate than the "B&B experience" I expected. Since it's pricey, I would suggest travelers buy just one day of the buffet, which is very special and worth lingering over to appreciate. The location is super - right across from Tokyo station and a short walk to the great jogging/walking perimeter of the Imperial Palace Grounds.

Myself, my sister and our friend stayed at Hotel Ryumeikan in a triple room. The room was extremely spacious and we all loved how deep the bath tub was!The hotel is located across the road from Tokyo Station and there are several underground subway train stations nearby. We had breakfast included which I would recommended including in your rate - the breakfast has a mix of Western and Traditional Japanese Food. The hotel is in a great area and I was really happy with the selection of restaurants that do surround the hotel. The staff were also very friendly especially with the language barrier. I will definitely stay at the Hotel Ryumeikan again!

Let me first say that I've travelled to Japan over half a dozen times and have stayed at this hotel at least five times. Each time, I found the basic customer service to be lacking but, because of the hotel's location, I put up with it. This last stay was the last straw. First of all, the people at the front desk are unfriendly, to the point of rudeness (highly unusual in Japan). This time when I checked in, after a long flight from New York, I dealt with Miss [-] and Miss [-], both unsmiling. But I noticed later that Miss [-] was actually very friendly to Japanese guests and to a white man (I am American of Asian descent), so perhaps it's just good old-fashioned racism at work? Who knows. I had booked a room that said on the booking site that it had a window but actually faces a wall. I asked for another room and was shown a smaller rand cheaper room with a window. I chose that one for the window, but because it was around 2000 yen cheaper per night--I had prepaid for two nights so that was a 4000 yen difference (and I had also prepaid for another two nights at the end of my Japan trip)--I asked if they could throw in the breakfast and I would pay the 500 yen/breakfast remaining difference (around $4.50). The breakfast buffet was 2500 yen--but costs the hotel much less, of course--and I had already prepaid most of that cost per night. Miss [-] refused. Still unsmiling. I reminded her that I would be staying at their hotel again for two more nights at the end of my Japan trip and that I was a repeat customer. She remained inflexible and unsmiling. I requested to speak to the manager but because he was not yet coming in for another hour, I asked that he call me in my room.Of course, the manager did not call me so I had to call and ask for him. He, Mr. [-], came to my room with Miss [-] at his side. I explained the situation (I also wanted to tell him about the customer service at the front desk but couldn't because Miss [-] was right there). Mr. [-] was not particularly friendly but he reluctantly agreed to give me ONE night's breakfast as a comp. Then he proceeded to tell me that this was a "gift" and that I could not ask for another breakfast later. He repeated this point more than once and made me feel like I was a criminal and was trying to rip them off, even though what I had prepaid covered the costs of two breakfasts. The whole encounter left a bad taste in my mouth. Not the way to treat a repeat customer or any customer--especially since the cost to them was almost nothing.  Nonetheless, I tried to ignore what had happened and enjoy exploring Tokyo for the remaining day and a half I was there. On the last day before I was to check out, I asked the front desk person--a Miss [-], also unsmiling--if she could make me a lunch reservation at a sushi place the next day since I don't speak Japanese. This seemed like a basic concierge request that could not go wrong, right? Wrong. Miss [-] said, "No" she could not make me a lunch reservation since check-out was at 11 a.m. and that the lunch would be at noon. I was incredulous. She insisted this was hotel policy. I told her that the restaurant did not charge a no-show fee or anything. She asked her male colleague. Both insisted they could not help me. No genuine apology, no attempt to help, no smile. Nothing. The reason for going to a hotel over an Airbnb is because of the convenience of concierge service. But this stay at Hotel Ryumeikan left a terrible feeling. I absolutely dreaded going to the front desk each time I needed something. I knew I would be greeted by unfriendly faces and a "No" to whatever I asked. My hunch is that the management at the hotel is doing something wrong to produce such terrible customer service (the front desk people look miserable most of the time).Let me end by saying that there were two exceptions to the terrible customer service I received during my stay: one a young man with spiky hair who helped me with my bags (he did not work the front desk) and a woman who worked the night shift--they were both friendly and helpful. Their attitude made a world of difference. Those two people should be promoted and working the day shift at the front desk!I will not be returning to this hotel. They lost me as a customer forever.
user_name:
lola
New York City, New York

review_body: Hotel Rumeikan Tokyo was very close to Tokyo station which was nice after a long flight into Tokyo (Narita) and the 50min train ride on the express train. Greeted warmly in English for the non Japanese speaker (me) and easy check in with polite staff. The room was clean and the bathroom was much larger/nicer than typical Tokyo hotel rooms that I have stayed in. The walk in shower was nice and the granite counter tops gave it a nicer feel. The free hotel WiFi was a bit intermittent at times which can be frustrating. The breakfast buffet was very fresh and tasty although primarily Japanese food which I enjoy; if you are looking for a western breakfast buffet this is not for you. Ate at the hotel restaurant one night- delicious! Also no exercise room/equipment. available.

Fantastic location near Tokyo station and really beautiful hotel. Clean, lovely decor, had bar fridge. Ice machine, washing machine and dryer on our floor really handy, Very comfortable bed. We were in the standard Double Room with Small Double Bed - No View. We thought the bed was bigger than a double (seemed like a queen bed to us) Still had a window which let light in which was good. Room exceeded our expectations as we thought it would be tiny but was fine for us. Only space to hang a few things but bags fit in hall fine. My in-laws stayed in Standard Queen Room which was larger (as they needed room for moving around in wheel chair) and great for them. The correspondence with the hotel on booking was exceptional (best of all places I booked). This was important as I needed to check the rooms and bathrooms would work for my father in law who is mostly in a wheel chair. Both rooms had walk in showers (rather than over bath). Hotel was really quite. Could not hear other guests at all. Lifts were quick to come. Reception on top floor. Great hotel for those with limited mobility and wheelchairs

Very stylish clean and super modern hotel 3 - 5 minute walk from the station, stores and restaurants. No need for a taxi on arrival even with luggage as they can be easily rolled to the hotel. Even though the station is very big, signage is excellent, people helpful and it is possible to study the station map before arrival. Walking distance to the imperial palace and gardens. This is the one of the best locations in the city. The other option being the Shinjuku and Shibuya area. Great connections to the yamanote circle line, to Narita on the Narita express and to the whole of Japan by Shinkansen.The hotel’s bathroom facilities are exemplary and the in room coffee and teas were excellent and so was the bed. Our room was big but the view was a regular city view. The hotel also has a coin laundry which was very useful for us. This is one of the most modern hotels anywhere.

The hotel is just two blocks from one of the exits from Tokyo Station. It's on two busy streets, but the rooms are near-silent. The rooms are small, but that's normal for Tokyo. The service was great, and the lobby area (which is on the top floor) is comfortable and inviting.

Stayed 4 nights in semi double room. Booked 2 rooms for whole family and was happy that the rooms can be arranged next to each other. Room is very small, and best for solo traveller but has no problem accommodating 2 persons. There is no wardrobe and only a few clothes hangars are given. Somehow, there is enough space to squeeze in the usual amenities e.g. mini fridge, electric kettle and safe. There is also an Android phone that comes with unlimited local data that you can take it out of the room. The in-room wifi is strong and quick. Bathroom is also small but has a bathtub. I am amazed by the huge variety of toiletries and the quality of the products. The hotel also arranged for kids-sized slippers and toothbrush set if you travel with kids. The only let down is the bed and pillow. The pillow is too soft for my liking and I could not sleep well. Location of the hotel is about a 5 min walk from Tokyo station. Nearby is a family mart and a few restaurants/cafes. Overall I think that the hotel offers good value and is a safe choice for most. If sleep quality is very important, perhaps prepare your own traveller pillow!

The location of this hotel is absolutely amazing just 5 minutes from Tokio station to take the shinkansen and the Narita express. Rooms are small as all in Tokio but really clean and comfortable. Service is excellent, they provide support to send luggage to the next location and also provide maps for attractions, the breakfast is really good with japanese and occidental options, fruit and an excellent coffee. We have stayed here in 2 different trips to Japan and we definitely recommend it. Coin laundry and ice machines available.

We stayed in this hotel for three nights in December 2018. We wanted to stay as close to the Tokyo Station as possible, but the hotel inside the station,Tokyo Station Hotel, was too expensive for us (we needed two rooms), so I picked Hotel Ryumeikan. The hotel is just a few minutes walk from the Yaesu North entrance of the Tokyo Station ( you can also go through the underground shopping area and come out just two buildings south of the hotel). The area is full of restaurants, but good luck finding a seat during dinner time. We had to take all our meals inside Tokyo Station. You take the elevator from the first floor to the 15th floor for the lobby. Our rooms were on the 11th floor. The rooms were very small, typical size of all Tokyo hotels. The people at reception were very courteous and helpful. There was nothing special about the hotel but I will stay here if I visit Tokyo again. I left my CPAP machine in my room. The from desk call me when I was on a train to Kyoto. I picked up the CPAP on our way back three days later.One tip: do not exchange your money inside Tokyo Station. The rates are much better at exchanges out side the station.

Location and cleanliness are a feature. The shower room was brilliant. The whole room was the shower ( had a bath in it as well) Located only 3 doors from the Keisei bus terminal and the free supply of an android phone with tourist information , google maps and free international calls was an unexpected and valuable bonus. Staff were helpful and arranged our taxi to the cruise terminal and verified the pricing for us.No down side but it would have been helpful if Keisei bus terminal location / service was on the hotel website. We caught limousine bus from Narita which stopped 400 metres from the hotel and not near a taxi rank where as Keisei bus stopped almost at the front door. 400 metres is a long way to walk in a strange town at night particularly if you have a lot of baggage and are getting on a bit in age. We were saved by a helpful taxi driver that saw our plight.You can hail taxis on the street which was also helpful

Hotel Ryumeikan is located right next to Tokyo station, with plenty of shopping and dining options nearby. The hotel is modern and very comfortable with spacious rooms. Great bathrooms and comfy beds. Highly recommended.

Booked this hotel direct over the internet and paid in advance via timed hotel link with no problems, very easy to communicate via email for booking and all other pre stay queries. Check in efficient and fast. Reception carried out queries quickly and effectively. Good standard of English and able to answer nearly every query and especially helpful with transport issues as we found Japan a directional challenge from start to finish. Great option for access to Shinkansen Tokyo station and JR lines, very short distance to metro subway lines as well. Easy to spot from the street, well signed. 10 minute walk to Keiyo line for direct JR train to Maihama to Disneyland and Disney Sea.We booked a twin room which was very roomy compared to other Japanese hotels we had stayed in. Room air conditioning was not easy to control and we found it very hot inside even though it was around zero degrees celcius, we circumvented this by opening the window a crack. Amenities comprehensive as previously mentioned in other reviews. Beds comfy. Clean.Happy to exchange currency but there are better conversion rates offered at other places.Entire malls of shopping and food options at Tokyo malls, only challenge is finding your way home. Restaurant on ground floor very convenient if you do not want to go outside, foodmart next door and cafe connections nearby with extensive hours for breakfast on the go if you need it or late night option (coffee quite good but found Tully's coffee across the road in Tekko building below ground level better). Would definitely stay again because of all this if we come back to Tokyo.The only real thing we did not like was the phone call we received from reception asking if we wanted a room service when we had left the do not disturbed sign out to signify this and housekeeping had already contacted us by phone to ask as well. We were trying to rest for our very earl start for our homeward journey so were in fact disturbed twice.

Stayed 5 nights, $202.78 per night. booked thru Priceline, had no view, staff would not change our room. Get a room with a view. Double bed, but we fit just fine. Layout was fine, inroom nespresso coffee, staff will provide pods to your liking. Toto toilets, wow just great.Shower always had hot water. Washer/Dryer on our floor, inexpensive. We brought fresh sushi, sake from Daimaru basement department store almost every night, huge selection, 3 minute walk. They do have a resturant on top floor, but food is all around and more Michelin restaurants in Tokyo then anywhere in the world. Breakfast was usually at Nakau dinner, little hole in the wall attached to Tokyo Station, espresso and good prices. We walked or took train system. This place is a great location and the price was right. Would stay again. Bus from Narita airport Dropped us off 3 blocks from Hotel. We took train and monorail to Haneda airport, quick , much cheeper that Bus , drops you off in airport terminal.

The hotel is located close to Tokyo central station making it easy to get to major attractions in Tokyo. Daimaru department store is few minutes away where you can get all the takeaway foods such as Sushi,Tempura and so on. The hotel also provide laundry machines on every floor and this is useful if you stayed longer and travel with limited clothes. The breakfast spread is good and love the deep fried tempura and oyster.

Clean and extremely convenient hotel. Some nice touches eg toothbrush and bedroom slippers for kids, hot towels on arrival, huge array of toiletries. Staff was lovely. I didn't find the room to be exceptionally small. Will stay here again.

Central location, very clean, with helpful staff and reasonable price. Somewhat pricey breakfast, so we went to the nearby coffee 'bar'. They happily changed our larger Japanese bills for smaller ones. (If you travel with an ATM card, it's the cheapest way to obtain foreign currency, world wide. I think that they only use brand new bills in Japan.

No complaints about this hotel! Very close to Tokyo station, which worked out perfectly for us. There are all sorts of restaurants and shops nearby, and I also loved that we could actually open the hotel room window! Excellent service at the hotel and standard fantastic hotel room amenities toiletries, etc). We had an issue with our room not being completely clean when we arrived, but told the front desk and they dealt with it immediately. Rooms are pretty standard size for Tokyo so if you do have larger suitcases you may want to store them at the front desk. We didn't do breakfast at the hotel as there's a coffee shop just down the street, so I can't comment on that. I would definitely stay here again!

There are no faults with the hotel lots of toiletries on offer but not much diff between this hotel and a 3 star in Shinjuku for half the price. Shinjuku is a much better location for transport links etc. But if you need to stay in Tokyo central it’s a good choice. Note Narita Express bus for ¥1,000 is almost next to the hotel vs ¥2,800 on Narita express train which is a hassle to get to in the station.

Central location, helpful staff, immaculate room, and clean bathroom. They give you 4 free bottled water and 8 free Nespresso pods each day (although I'm not sure if this goes for all rooms). The staff are accommodating and speak good English. On more than one occasion I asked them to help make restaurant reservations and they are happy to do it.There is a Family Mart convenience store adjacent to the hotel, and as most everyone here mentioned, the hotel is only a few steps away from the Tokyo Station. Just keep in mind the once you exit the station via the Yaesu North exit, turn left and you will see the Hotel Ryumeikan building across the road.

I was pleasantly surprised by this hotel. Since this was my first time in Tokyo and I do not speak Japanese, I needed a central hotel that is easy to get to after arriving at night by train. The reception staff were welcoming, polite,and spoke good English. The room was immaculately clean and equipped with all kinds of small accessories, and the breakfast was excellent. (It was included in the rate I got; if it isn't it costs over $20, so there are cheaper places to eat). The hotel was very quiet and the sitting area near the reception is tranquil and has a good view. The single room I had was small but manageable. If you're used to hotels near railway stations in the USA or Europe, this is very different. The area is completely safe at night, the hotel building is modern, and I heard no sirens the whole time I was there. If you arrive by train, be aware that Tokyo station is large and has many different lines running through it. To get to the Yaesu North exit, you need to walk through the central hall for quite a way, in a not completely straight line. If you feel lost, look at one of the maps of the station, and you'll see where you are relative to the exit you need. When you come out of the Yaesu North exit, there will be a wide (eight lane) road directly in front of you with a broad pedestrian crossing. Look to your left and you'll see a 20 story building with the name of the hotel in big letters in English at the top. Cross the road, turn left, and it's 200 yards down. Go into the lobby, take the elevator to the 15th floor, and you are there.

You just can’t beat this location if you’re going to be using rail travel from Tokyo. Very convenient, maybe a 3 minute walk from Tokyo station. Plenty of restaurants around as well. We were here only two nights and did a full day trip to Nagano. Perfect location, quick check in and checkout and nice clean rooms.

This hotel is located 5 mins from the Tokyo Station and you can get almost any type of Japanese cuisine at the station. It’s a small boutique hotel with good English speaking reception staff. Rooms are a little small and travellers with super big suitcases might find it problematic. However, they try to make up for this by furnishing their rooms with every need you can think of ie toiletries, shoe treatments etc. as we have to travel to the mountains for our Onsen stay, they were able to help organise for suitcase transfer to our next hotel. Some flexibility would have been better in executing the bag transfer procedure as I had to plead with them to organise this the night before as it was very time consuming. Reluctantly they did and we were able to leave the hotel on time for our train journey to Akita.

Very near the train station and easy to find. Though the room is small, it is clean and well-maintained. Amenities provided in the room are also of above average quality. The reception is on the 15th floor. At the corner of the 15th floor, there is a place where one can relax and drink some wonderful hot tea. Highly recommended to rest and relax there.

I was really looking forward to staying at this last hotel on my Japan trip. Room size and amenities were exactly as website photos. Loved the coffee machine in the room. Reception and restaurant area is on the 15th floor, guests rooms on 8th~14th floor. Which means you don't really see the hotel staff or hear them greeting you except during check-in and check-out time or if eat breakfast/dinner at their restaurant. That brings me to the disappointed part: during check-in the reception staff will offer to guest a hot 'welcome' towel. I booked a Twin room and presented 2 passports for check-in so obviously there are 2 guests but they only give me 1 hot towel. I passed the hot towel to my mum waiting at the sitting area, but there was no 2nd towel for me. For me, this hotel reception staff definitely missed the mark of service perfection with a human touch.

Literally a stone’s throw away from Tokyo Station. Extremely convenient if you are looking for a place to stay for a few nights in Tokyo before catching the Shinkansen to another location. Hotel reception located on 15th floor and hotel is next to a family mart for any last minute purchases. Suggest trying the cremia ice cream from the coffee joint a few doors down (very nice!)Room is small and cramped - was unable to open the luggage fully flat but convenience makes up for this. Toiletries set also very good and high quality. Appreciate all the thought they put into ensuring all the necessities are provided.

Arriving at Tokyo Station late at night, I chose this hotel for convenience. It is just opposite the JR side of Tokyo Station so super convenient. However, navigating Tokyo Station is not for the faint-hearted and I realised I had not asked which exit I should use. It took me almost half an hour of walking to eventually get to a hotel that should have been less than 10. For the remainder of my stay I found using Nihonbashi station around the corner much easier and convenient. On arrival I was most impressed with staff and room. My floor had a laundry which was very reasonable considering other hotels I have stayed in. Reception is on 15th floor, along with the restaurant so its a lovely outlook. Its also very handy for Keisei Airport bus terminal only a few doors away. Made it super easy to get out to Narita and way cheaper than Airport Limousine, and faster. Highly recommend this hotel. Its great value and rooms, while not huge, are reasonable. Free bottled water was also very nice.

Book this hotel 5 months prior to our trip, hoping we’ve made the right choice. It was the best choice ever. Hotel is close to Tokyo station and handy to other subway.Hotel staff are friendly and helpful, even emailed us prior requesting for names of guests so that we will have a quick check in upon arrival.Hotel room is clean with a huge range of amenities provided. Would definitely come back to stay in this hotel if ever going back to Tokyo.

This was our second stay in this hotel. The location a very short walk to Tokyo station is unbeatable. The standard size rooms are small, but typical of many hotel rooms in Japan. The service is friendly and polite. The area is very safe and quiet, like most of Japan. Even the occasional drunk salaryman on his way home in the evening will apologise if he stumbles into your path.

We chose this hotel as a convenient location near Tokyo station. Rooms are smallish, but well equipped with a comfortable bed and excellent stand alone rain shower. Staff were exceptional, friendly and professional and a model other hotels should follow.A very good choice for this part of Tokyo.
user_name:
AlantheTrekker
Isle of Skye, United Kingdom

review_body: We chose this hotel for our first 3 nights in Tokyo and thought it served as a great base to explore the city. Our "double" room was spacious, quiet, very comfortable & provided with all amenities.While more expensive than some, we felt it was good value for money given the level of accomodation and the location.It is just across the street from the massive Tokyo station (connections to everywhere and every dining/shopping option imaginable), but you might want to consider taking the Keisei bus if you are coming from Narita airport. It takes a bit longer than the train connections but the bus stop is about 200 meters from the hotel door. If you arrive in Tokyo station it may take you 30 minutes (or more) just to find the right exit!

Location excellent just across from Tokyo Station and near Ginza. 24-hour Family Mart and coffee shop next to hotel, Daimaru dept. store across the street. In addition to full stock of toiletries, there are shoe cleaning material, refrigerator, and a safe. Maybe the only drawback is a single/standard room is very small so while it may be good for a short-stay one person business trip, upgrading to a larger room may be better for a couple and definitely family. Two floors also ice and vending machines as well as a clothes washer and dryer for those wanting to do laundry themselves and not use the hotel's laundry service.

The location of Hotel Ryumeikan Tokyo is perfect for easy access to Tokyo Central Station (metro, local trains, and bullet train). The hotel is also stylish and comfortable. Best of all was the high level of service. Both the front desk and the restaurant team were highly professional and competent. The quality of service added much to the experience, and I felt the service exceeded the price paid. Breakfast was also very good with plenty of delicious options to start your day. The Ryumeikan Collection clearly holds itself to a high standard, and I would certainly return.

<Location>Very near Tokyo station (Yaesu North Exit). 3-4 mins walk. Note: Tokyo station is huge. Getting the correct exit helps but even if you get to a different exit, it is not that much farther to walk. There are multiple ways to get to Tokyo station from Narita airport. I opted to take the express bus. 1 hr ride. Super convenient. Taking the bus is the best choice since the drop off point at Tokyo station is just a 2 minute walk to the hotel. Tokyo station connects you to EVERYWHERE.<Check in>Super fast and easy. You pay for your stay at check in. <Room>I booked a standard room. OK sized for Japanese standard. Nicely laid out. Toilet and bath are super clean. All toiletries are provided. Comes with free WiFi. Easy to connect. Speed is good. No complaints. All rooms are smoke-free. <Breakfast>Excellent buffet style spread! Spoilt for choice if you like Japanese food. If you are there on a national holiday, breakfast time is from 7am-1pm! I kid you not.

Traveller from Malaysia here. Hotel Ryumeikan Tokyo is located strategically near Metro Stations which is just 2 mins walk. Also, there is a Family Mart right at the lobby entrance which was a plus for me since i usually get hungry after a day of walking. The hotel breakfast setting was authentic, you could dine in japanese rooms with closed doors. Really cool!Hotel rooms were big and the hotel lobby had an excellent street view (picture attached to this review). Would recommend this hotel to influencers if they wanted this shot.Overall, the hotel was great and i look forward to my next stay at Hotel Ryumeikan Tokyo!

Spent four nights in a standard room here in August - while the room was quite small (typical to the area), it was clean, comfortable, and well-priced. The staff were helpful and spoke great English, and the breakfast buffet was outstanding. Highly recommended for anyone staying in Chuo. Walk to the Tokyo station is less than 10 minutes, and the nearest Metro station is equally close.

this hotel is close to tokyo station and nihonbashi station, and shuttle bus to narita airport is right downstairs. Daimaru, Concept labi electronics store and restaurants are also within walking distance. Room is small, but is clean and qhiet, and has a nice street view. there is pola toner, lotion, and bath salt.

Extremely convenient place to stay at a good price near Tokyo Main Station. Easy to/from airport via Limo Bus, Narita Express Train, and other shuttles (5-7min walk). Lots of streets to explore and good access to ramen and food street within the tokyo station. Room extremely comfortable (Expect Japan sizes) with this cool technology to help put you to sleep and wake you up.

I stayed here for three nights and really enjoyed it. We were traveling for 3 weeks and had a lot of stuff (which made the space in the room even tighter), but as a home base, it was amazing! The closeness to Tokyo Station and a couple of other metro lines makes this a PERFECT place to stay.

We stayed in this hotel for four nights when we arrived in Tokyo, and then we went to other cities and got back here for two more nights.It was one of the best hotel stays of my life anywhere in the world. The service is impeccable, the cleanliness is perfect, and the staff know what you need before you ask for it. The location of the hotel is great as well, it's only a 5-minute walk from Tokyo Station that is one of the most central stations in the city.If I ever return to Tokyo I'm sure I'll stay in Ryumeikan.

We stayed just for one night before leaving for Hiroshima and found the location and hotel to be perfect. The rooms maybe small for some but we are travelling light and found this not to be an issue. There are lots of eating and drinking places nearby and a great coffee shop right next door to the hotel. It is a great option for Tokyo station, just be sure to pick the correct exit - Yaesu north exit.

Very comfortable hotel just a few mins walk Tokyo station. I had an early flight home so it was ideal to enable me to get the early Narita Express. Note that the breakfast is 2,500 Y if not included in proom price.

We have stayed at this hotel this time for 5 nights, after having stayed here previously, some four years ago.The hotel is at the upper floors of a building, very close to Tokyo station. Our room was very comfortable, very well equipped, top quality amenities. The staff was very polite and efficient. On the 15th floor, there is a good and reasonably priced restaurant.In the hotel there is a coin operated laundrette and a vending machine.The location is perfect for access to the railway station, the metro, and... the fabulous food hall of Daimaru.Highly recommended !

After doing lots of research here on TripAdvisor, picked this property. Good choice! Two adults and grown child so we requested a room with an extra bed. The room was all set up and waiting for us after check in. It was actually 3 beds in the room so it worked well. The room had a fridge, nespresso machine (yum) and was larger for Japan. We chose a plan that included breakfast and did enjoy the large selection to choose from, although most of it was foreign to us and no one working the breakfast shift seemed to speak English to assist us, so we just tried things. There was fruit and cereal so some things familiar, however we opted to try other things. The restaurant has tatami rooms so you can get the full experience. Our morning, the regular tables were all full so we were offered to wait or sit in a tatami room. We went ahead and with moions and hand signals learned we take our shoes off on the floor, use the slippers, back up to the room and leave the slippers outside. They were very kind and we were very awkward. :-). A fun experience though. The hotel is right by the Tokyo Station for subway, train and bus. There’s a whole underground world with shops and lots of restaurants. We found our way to ‘ramen alley’ and had an exceptional lunch of ramen. The hotel was very comfortable and the beds typical to the other hotels we experienced around Asia, a bit harder than we’re accustomed to, however, fine. Very kind and helpful front desk, and clean well appointed room. We went to restaurants in the area and there were so many quaint side streets/alleys so we checked online reviews or just decided to go where there were lines or lots of action. All were good. Highly recommend this hotel and it’s location!

Had one night here before catching the bullet train. It is only a 5 minute walk from the North Yaesu station entrance. The room was very nice and a good size for Japan. The only reason it did not achieve 5 stars is because we thought the breakfast selection was a bit limited and felt as though we were being rushed, as the waiters kept fussing when we were going to the buffet . It was small point and otherwise we would happily recommend this hotel.

This hotel was such a great find. It's located across from Tokyo Station, which makes it really convenient. Just down the block, there is a stairway/entrance to Tokyo station, so you can make your using the underground tunnel and minimize exposure to the rain (which is what we experienced). The hotel lobby isn't very big, but there's sufficient space to sit and relax for a bit. We did not try the restaurant.The room was compact, as expected, but we thought they made very good use of the space. It was well designed and efficient. It didn't feel overly cramped or claustrophobic. I also liked having the nespresso machine and fridge. I like having my coffee shortly after waking and I kept bringing snacks back from various shops in Tokyo Station, so the fridge was handy.The bathroom is very nice. I spent a lot of time trying to find a similar toilet on Amazon afterwards. Room, bathroom, all of it very clean and modern. I also enjoyed the mood lighting.

Stayed in the junior suite as a splurge with our family of three. Extra living room is tatami style and had an outside patio on 8th floor Extra bed was futon with an extra pad for comfort. . Spacious bathroom with shower bathtub room and separated toilet room. Great tea and Nespresso supplied. Bathrobes,, pjs, and light Japanese robe also. Coin operated washing machine with good dryer available pClose to subways at Tokyo and Nihonbashi stations, the Shinkansen lines and the 1000 yen airport bus are all easily walkable. Glad we stayed there!
user_name:
Perry P
New York, New York

review_body: A family of two adults and one toddler spent one night here. We stayed in the "Standard Queen Room" which was large enough for several suit cases and my daughter's travel crib. The hotel is located right at Tokyo Station, using the Yaesu North Exit (feel free to ask the information desk or a police officer to show you as if you're coming from the metro/subway, you might not know which direction to go). It's also a block from the Narita bus stop for those not feeling like hauling their bags to thru the station. This was the best stay we had in all of Japan. The hotel staff were very nice and accomodating. The room itself was large and so clean. I mean, so, so clean!! Two pillows and pajamas provided. Nepresso in the room. Black out curtains making it perfect for that early Japanese sunrise. If you are looking for your first destination when you arrive and need a good place to begin your Japan adventures, this is the place. Oh the AC worked well.We had the breakfast at the hotel which was expensive but a good value. Theres a coffee shop on the main street if you don't feel like a heavy breakfast but I would go back just for the breakfast. :) Free hot water/filtered water in the lobby, along with lobby serving fresh tea.

This hotel was good quality for the money. It's not a luxury hotel, but the location is ideal and the price is right. I stayed here with a group for a business meeting, and I was a little concerned it wouldn't be nice because it was affordable. I was so wrong! Lovely reception area on the 15th floor where you can get some tea and watch the world go by. Highly recommend if you need to stay in this area.
user_name:
Jenny D
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: This is a very pleasant place but I was dismayed to discover that my room (a regular double --not cheap!) faced a wall. I arrived in the evening when the drapes were closed so I had no idea until the morning that my 14th floor aspect was zilch. When I inquired about it at the desk, I was informed that a room that didn't face a wall would cost more. Similarly, when I asked about printing my boarding pass, I was told there's a computer near the desk. Then I discovered that you had to pay to use it. This is petty in an attractive. upscale hotel.

Ryumeikan's perfect location is well documented so I'll just confirm that. We stayed in a superior double with no view at a very reasonable rate for 3 nights. The room size was above average with plenty of room to unpack, or live out of 2 large suitcases for any length of stay. Ryumeikan's provision for in room amenities was outstanding. Water, very nice coffee/tea service, toiletries, robes,,,everything your need is provided at no additional cost...and it was all quality stuff. The bathroom had a great shower stall, which I preferred, but deep tub options more common in Japan were available in other room types if you prefer a tub option. The toilet was the most modern we experienced in Japan, which says a lot. I'm looking to purchase the very same model for my home now. Water pressure was adequate. Towels were typical for Japan (skinny), but of good quality. Toiletries were through the roof...all very nice. Pajamas, robes and slippers were provided. Room was cleaned and re-supplied daily. Currency exchange at the desk was provided and the rate quite acceptable. Staff spoke English and were courteous and helpful. Having no view did not deter from the experience at all. Vistas are available everywhere in Tokyo so not having one in the room really didn't matter. Tokyo Station has hundreds of dining and shopping options, but is quiet compared to other popular areas of Tokyo...which we found to be highly desirable. There is a restaurant in the hotel, but we dined off site exclusively.The only reason Ryumeikan did not receive 5 stars from us is there was no spa (steam/sauna/pool), but we had a very positive experience and will not hesitate in re-booking a stay there for our next visit to Tokyo.

Hotel Ryumeikan is located right next to Tokyo station - the railway epicentre, which makes for excellent connectivity. My wife, toddler, and I stayed here May'18. The room we stayed in was compact (this is Tokyo after all), but well designed. The knick-knacks that the hotel provided were delightful! The breakfast options were good. Overall, a great place to stay in Tokyo!

It is just located besides Tokyo Station (both "Yaesu Exit" and "Nihonbashi Exit" are very close to the hotel).The room is decent in the standard of business hotel in Tokyo. The breakfast is one of the things you will feel wonderful when you stay at this hotel.

The hotel is conveniently located next to Tokyo Station, which means getting around the city (and to Narita/the rest of Japan) a joy, My single room was extremely clean and outfitted with every amenity imaginable (bath salts, conditioner, etc). Would absolutely recommend, especially to those on short visits for whom proximity to transportation is key.
user_name:
chiek2013
New York City, New York

review_body: I stayed for 6 nights in a economy room with no view. The comfort of the room makes up for the lack of view. Despite the small room size , I do not feel that room is cramp as everything is arranged thoughtfully to maximize the use of the room space . The room has a sleeping system which has soothing music if turned on during nighttime. There is a Nespresso machine and a fridge . The wardrobe is an open style with no doors . Full complete set of Toiletries are provided. Great shower system too. Although situated near traffic junction, the room is extremely quiet and it is also very clean. The hotel staff are extremely helpful, courteous and efficient with full of initiative. During my stay, every of my requests were attended to promptly. Great service! The hotel is near Tokyo station and nihombashi station. Both are within short walking distance . The airport limousine bus and Keisei bus are both nearby with the latter just next door. For arrival via airport limousine bus, once arrived walk following the flow of traffic and cross at the junction. The hotel is just across the junction. For arrival via Kiesei bus, walk to your right against the flow of traffic and the hotel is a few doors from Excelsior Cafe. Hotel surrounded by many cafes, restaurants and shops . Will definitely stay there again. Thank you Hotel Ryumeikan for making my stay enjoyable !

The hotel is located around the Tokyo Station north exit. It was our second time in the hotel and we perceived that they moved forward their quality. The hotel has a long and realistic history. Our room was perfect and the equipments were engineered and designed for our comfort. I liked the design of Yukata’s. The bathroom is fully equipped and was perfect. The hotels restaurant at the lobby is very nice. Hanagoyomi serves brunch weekends and it is perfect. The staff is very kind and professional every single point of the hotel is clean and wonderful. We will rebook Ryumeikan Tokyo in our next Tokyo visits.

I stayed here for 3 nights on a business trip on Tokyo. Location is excellent - just across the road from Tokyo Station. Follow the instructions on the hotel website and its very very easy to find. I had one of the smaller double bed rooms - which had everything i needed - Nespresso Coffee machine, fully stocked bathroom, TV, great WiFi, comfortable bed. Process of booking in on the website was very easy. Staff were very efficient and polite when I arrived and at checkout. Rooms were kept immaculately clean. Best of all was the price (which included breakfast) - really excellent value for Tokyo. Will definitely return.

We stayed 4 nights at the end of our Japan trip and found this hotel such a haven and wonderful experience! We have travelled quite widely and can safely say this hotel will stand out in our minds and we would not consider staying elsewhere in Tokyo again!Specifically the staff were wonderful. We have no useable Japanese language and felt that no barrier whatsoever here. The staff ALL took so very much time and effort to help us ( well above the usual beautiful Japanese hospitality!). They helped to seek restaurant experiences and book them ( and navigate the trickier concepts of menu navigation and directions _ they actually printed itineraries and photos from google maps to try and help guide us). This was so of all staff, they were exceptional!Secondly the room we had was stunning. We chose the Japanese style room and slept the best we have in ages. It was beautifully appointed and little touches such as nespresso machine and free pods continually restocked, some complimentary drinks and seamless service was amazing, The bathroom needs special mention! Wonderful Japanese bath ( and shower) made it hard for us to actually consider leaving the room at all!Small but lovely little library with some cookbooks and gardening books that were good to leaf through.Must also say the laundry with free wash dry was perfect for the end of trip.So please do yourself a favour and stay here if you can, it is in the financial district (which always works for us as we like to see the beating heart of a city and to have quiet at night) and I cannot rate it highly enough. These lovely people have the perfect model for accommodation! Can’t wait to return!!!

I stayed here on business in April 2018, this hotel is professional and understated with excellent rooms ( with a nice bath ) and a Japanese breakfast. The views are good and the location is very close to the Tokyo central station, airport busses and the imperial palace.'business hotel' can be code for drab and boring. This hotel is the best version of a busines hotel, professional and unobtrusive staff, excellent rooms and a convenient location.

This is my second stay at the hotel. I had a wonderful first stay and found this round to be not as great. When I booked this hotel I didn't get an option to pick bigger rooms as I wanted to to accommodate 2 adults and 1 kid. Upon check in staff on hand wasn't so friendly and didn't provide an option to upgrade either. Apart from that, the room was a little small but well appointed. Otherwise location is excellent

I stayed here one night. The check-in process was quick and modern. They used ipad for registered instead of signing in the paper like other hotel.The room is nice and clean but they don't provide even 1 complimentary bottle of water in the room. Anyway, they provide the machine in every floor. You can get water anytime you want.Location is excellent. Only 5-6 minutes walk to Tokyo Station.

First class accommodation and hospitality! Upon check-in I was greeted by a friendly and professional concierge who spoke excellent English. The room was quiet and clean, small by North American standards, but much larger than I was expecting based on what I had heard about the size of hotel rooms in Japan. It had a comfortable queen bed, a small desk, a dresser, and separate bathroom with toiler and shower. Free bottled water, tea and coffee-maker, and a small fridge. Upon check out, the concierge happily stored my bags so that I could explore the city all day before my evening flight. Overall excellent location, a few blocks away from the central Tokyo Station trains/metro/subway, and walking distance to the nearby Ginza shopping district and Imperial Palace. A great hotel that I would definitely recommend to any friends or family visiting Tokyo in the future.

Clean room with comfortable albeit small bed. Room size Possibly not much larger than other Tokyo hotels in the same category. Provides all the usual room amenities inlcuding the use of a smart kimono.Cosy small lobby lounge with a view over the Nihombashi streets. Airport shuttle stop is just next to the hotel. Excellent access to subway lines, as well as the JR Line. Location possibly more suited to business travellers but we found the central location perfect for our purposes and getting around the city.Nice restaurants and bars under Tokyo Station nearby and the surrounding neighbourhood. Staff generally fluent in English.

Fabulous hotel. We were in Tokyo for a very short visit and I booked this hotel mostly for price and proximity to Tokyo Station. Expectations weren’t high but I have to say we were so very satisfied with everything. Very clean with tons of amenities. Extremely comfortable beds. We needed to take the bus shuttle to Narita Airport early in the morning and realized the bus stop is literally out the front door of the hotel! I will definitely book this hotel when I return for a longer visit to Tokyo!

I travelled all around Honshu and had two separate stays in Tokyo at either end of the trip. Our stay at Hotel Ryumeikan came at the end of our trip and was just what we needed. The hotel was very nice, very clean and had all the in-room amenities. On our last day they held our uggage after checkout, so we could continue to tour til the end of the day. We had a great stay before heading back to the States and wished we could've stayed longer at this luxurious hotel.

chose this hotel for its proximity to Tolyo station.Small room with no view.very comfortable small bed.alot of amenities given_ room slippers, toothbrushes, hair essences, tea bags, snacks. nice coffee machine.Oh! must mention the shower massage. see photo enclosed.Heated toilet seat_ did not have this in the ryokans in the rural areas.very helpful reception staff who helped me checkin MAS flight on our last day.

This is the third local hotel I have tried close to Tokyo station, for the purpose of one night transfer between airport and Shinkansen. I have to say I am very impressed with this hotel.1) Size of room is fairly big compared to other hotel rooms of same price point in Tokyo2) Bathroom has every amenities you can think of in travel size packets3) New decor, with great TV, lightings, and power points4) Includes high quality bath robes and slippers5) Good English speaking receptionists6) Quick check-in and check-out7) Free coffee and tea in the quiet lobby areaA true gem!
user_name:
Sharka
New York City, New York

review_body: I seldom come across a hotel who think of all possible needs of its guests. Instead of the standard toothbrush, maybe a comb and standard shampoo and bath foam, this hotel filled its baskets ( 2!) with:1. Hair wax ( it is as if they knew I'm was coming! Omg!)2.ageing cream lotion ( totally needed this)3.A hair band ( pretty handy )4.2 types of flower essence healing bath powder ( how spoilt can one be?)5. ageing care oil clear face wash6.a pack of 4 tiny bottles of Shiseido consisting of makeup cleaning gel,lifting moisture lotion,lifting moisture emulsion, cleansing foam.7.cuticle coat for smooth and silky hair8. Cotton buds9. Cotton set10. Hair brush11. tooth brush12. Razor13. body towel14 shower cap15.a bottle of shave guard/ foam16. green tea hand and body lotionOn top of that, their bedroom slippers are thick and in a cotton bag. Sealed! Next to them are toe pads in similiar cotton sealed bags with instruction of their use. They added that the slippers are to be taken home and can be used in the airplanes. What a lot of thought the team must have gone through. I give them 5 stars. Excellent. Check in was smooth with the staff speaking adequate English. The location is also brilliant as it is just opposite Tokyo train station. Use the Yuesu north exit. When u come out of the door turn left and walk about 5 mins. Towards Shangri-la hotel direction. Very easy to find. The room is beautifully decorated and they even gave a yukata to wear, in addition to their nightwear. Splendid!Love it!

Hotel Ryumeikan is situated in the most convenient spot in Tokyo - near the station, mall, restaurants, airport bus stop, etc. The Hotel was clean, and it had the modern Japan amenities. the concierge/check-in is situated on the upper floor which is a first for me, but not an issue. Will definitely stay here again.

i went there based on TA reviews and the fact it was close to tokyo station and the narita express, as i was a first timer in tokyo and didn't want to have to struggle with luggage on their complicated metro/train system. the hotel is a 5-min walk from tokyo station / yaesu exit (north is best, but central or south work too, u just walk a few meters more). the room as already mentioned by others was quite small, but it had everything i needed and was very clean .. as i was out all day visiting, all i wanted was a comfy double bed and a bathroom (with bath tub), which i had and on top i also got a good street view and the sun poured in the window. my room also offered a kettle + coffee/tea, complimentary snacks and water (it's in the fridge) every day, plus free wifi and my fave .. the heated toilet seat LOL .. i stayed 4 nights for about USD 120 p.n. for 1p. and would definitely stay there again .. the area is more like a financial district and not super animated at night (which suited me fine) but there are still plenty of restaurants and it is also close to other metro/bus/train stations.i didn't have breakfast at the hotel nor did i go to their in-house restaurant. definitely recommend this hotel !

The room is small. However, the bed is comfortable. I enjoyed my sleep in this room after a night flight and checking in only at 1:00 p.m. The hotel is very near to the Tokyo Station. Hence, there are many options for meals. It is also very convenient to reach the hotel from airport. There is bus from airport to Tokyo Station. The staffs are helpful. English is not an issue. I would return to this hotel.

When I first arrived at the hotel, I was a bit disappointed because our room was quite small, the bed was small and we had no view (therefore, no light). However, the room turned out to be very comfortable. It has a sound system to help you go to sleep and to wake you up which I loved! The bed was very comfortable and it was very quite. We did not hear a single noise during our 4 nights. So despite the fact that it was small and had no light, we felt very relaxed in our room and in the end, we loved it. The hotel is extremely clean and it smells good. Staff was not very helpful when it came to recommendations. For example, we asked them to recommend a place for New Year's eve and they said they did not know. Location is ok, right across the Tokyo station. I would definitely go back to this hotel.
user_name:
Sofia Z
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: We chose to stay here because we had an early morning flight out of Narita and didn’t want to stay out at the airport. Narita is in the middle of no where with nothing to do around it.The hotel is across the road from Tokyo station where you can access the Narita express train and most other JR and subway lines. Due to the size of Tokyo station, the Narita express line is still a 15 min walk away as it’s on the opposite side of the station to where the hotel is. All other lines are 5 to 10 mins walk from the hotel. We used Narita express as we had JR rail passes so it was free for us. If you don’t have a rail pass, you can get a bus from right out the front of the hotel and takes the same amount of time as Narita express to get to the airport. The hotel has great facilities and is very comfortable. Reception is on 15th floor and rooms are all below. Highly recommend if you need easy access to Narita. Ginza is 15 mins walk away

Located within easy walking distance to Tokyo Station and Nihonbashi Sattion on Ginza line made it super convenient for a few days in Tokyo. There’s an entire food and shopping hub within Tokyo station. The hotel is great and we stayed as a family of 4 in a Japanese Suite B and the kids had futon beds on tatami. Minibar and snacks were complimentary during our 3 days. This hotel has the most comprehensive collection of bathroom or room amenities of any international hotel. Beds were super comfortable but firm. To make matters even better it was the most competitively priced hotel around the New Year period of any other 4 star hotels in Tokyo.

Wonderful stay for 3 nights in Tokyo. As others reviewers have pointed out, very clean, very quiet, and extremely great service. Please try their in-room sleeping system, guaranteed to put you to sleep in a flash. The hotel is very close to Tokyo station, if you take the Narita express, go up to the main level. There you will have two exit choices Yaesu or Marunouchi. Go to the Yaesu, regardless of north, central, or south. Once outside take a left, till you get to the Damiaru store, cross the street and you will see the Hotel Ryumeikan sign. Go up to the 15th floor for check in and restaurant. Definitely one of the best hotels I stayed at in a while.

Stayed here for 4 nights for a meeting in Otemachi area. The hotel was just tangentially across the road from Tokyo Station, Yaesu side. Our room on 13th floor afforded terrific view of the modern side of the station. Lobby was on 15th floor and the room card was required to access the guest floors.The economy double room was small, as most Tokyo hotels are. Decoration was elegant, with good materials. Pillow menu included hypoallergenic and firm ones. However, there was no wardrobe or closet.Bathroom was large for Japanese standard. Great powerful and hot shower. Lots of amenities which were refilled each day. Drip coffee and tea sachets (house brand) were provided with kettle. Two complimentary bottles of mineral water were provided in the fridge per night. Two packets of traditional Japanese crackers were also provided each day.

QUIETNESSAs I am an extremely light sleeper, my top priority in hotel selection is the quietness. And Hotel Ryumeikan Tokyo is EXTREMELY quiet!I hardly heard any sound in my one-week stay, though many rooms were occupied (only saw other customers at lobby and restaurant). As the hotel is located near the intersection of two major roads, I did hear siren a few times. But the sound is so reduced that it didn't bother me at all.LOCATIONAnd speaking of location ... it's great! We took Narita Express from Narita Airport to Tokyo Station, and it took five minutes to walk (slowly) to the hotel.One thing to note is that when I viewed hotel's website on mobile, it only mentions distance. But desktop version provides full direction with photos.The hotel is also about 2-3 minutes' walk from Nihombashi subway station. But do note that depending on which line you take, you may need to walk many more minutes inside the station.SERVICEVery good! Period.Will definitely stay there again if I go to Tokyo in the future!

-near totokyo station .all the lines pass from there.a big shoping area..you can buy fantastic shushi fro there,cosmetics tax free and candies-fantastic cleaning of the room. the most clean room with details.- the take care with a small snack and 2 small bottle of waters or coffee or tea. clean towels and sheets the only negative the size of the room

I stayed at the corner deluxe twin room which is large enough for two.Nice view outside with bright light.I like the bathroom with a deep bathtub so you can have a good relaxation. and I also like amenities they supply.it's only 3 minutes from the Tokyo station, very convenient location.

Located across the street from Tokyo Station and minutes away by foot to a myriad of restaurants, pubs, and shopping. Rooms are on the smaller side but full of amenities in the bedroom and bathroom. The breakfast buffet not only has dishes for all tastes but the quality and creativity of the food is outstanding.

As I write this, I am struggling with adding up more positives to this review on the Hotel Ryumeikan.
