The convenience of the train station was excellent.

Clean and well equipped hotel, near Tokyo station (for JR and subways) and Nihombashi station (for subways). The room is cleaned. Easy to find (find Yaesu exit from Tokyo station, and you are not far from them).

It took me sometime to choose a hotel for a leisure trip to Tokyo with my wife. Very near the Tokyo station and a stones throw away from a subway station. Loved this small hotel. The room was very clean and comfortable. The staff was fantastic. They were very helpful and friendly. Would love to stay here again but it is always fully-booked.

We stayed just over a week at Hotel Ryumeikan Tokyo as we made quite a lot of trips to nearby areas and cities. The 3 minutes walk to the Tokyo station and 1 minute walk to the Nihombashi metro station is very appealing. We got to stay in both the standard single and Forus-A rooms. Both had very comfortable beds. Between the two, we much preferred the Forus room because of much more space, bigger bed and more amenities, despite the downsides of facing the wall of the next building and lack of a bathtub. There is free wifi throughout the hotel. We liked the coin operated laundry on 10th and 12th floors. The hotel's restaurant was good despite the limited menu. Ryumeikan also has excellent service, with the staff endeavoring to fulfill our requests such as baggage storage, helping us move our baggage to cab and helping make restaurant reservations.

Business hotel in the top floors of a 15 storeys building located nearby the Tokyo station. Walking distance from all major shopping streets and malls. The towers of all majors Japanese trading houses are all around.

Hotel Ryumeikan Tokyo's Suite A stands out as one of the unique hotel-stay that we have experienced. Bearing in mind that this is a suite, it still serves as a useful benchmark to compare experiences of other hotels' rooms with.We took with us the zen-like experience of the Tatami mat room, the polished floor of the western room, and the well-appointed suite bathroom with its warm Toto toilet that anticipated our arrival.Outstanding!

*great value*excellent location. Across from Tokyo station *very clean, great service, modern decor*great shower * Nespresso in room with stock replenished nightly *very small rooms, but not a breaker
user_name:
maxb00009
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: We stayed in this hotel for five nights and had two rooms. We loved the hotel. The location was so convenient being right by Tokyo station. We found it easily after arriving from the airport on the Narita express thanks to previous reviews mentioning the Yaesu north exit of the station. Though the station is huge once you get the hang of the various exits it is easy to negotiate. There are lots of restaurants in the station and also in the streets around the hotel. There is a cafe a few doors along where we would have a bagel and a coffee for breakfast. The rooms were well appointed and our 20 year old daughter felt safe in a room on her own (as she did throughout Japan). The hotel were very accommodating in giving us rooms relatively close together and were very apologetic because we could not have adjoining rooms as the rooms were of different types. I have never seen such an extensive array of toiletries etc in a hotel room. We also liked the Yukatas which were comfortable to wear. The beds were comfortable and the shower powerful. The room was also very quiet. We could not hear other guests at all. The free wifi worked fine. We would definitely stay again at this hotel.

Was there for holiday and the location is great. Several delicious restaurants nearby and the subway and Tokyo station are just around the corner. In the night it is very quiet as well daily, so no worries if one need quietness for jet lag sleep. There are tea for free at the reception. As usual, very clean and friendly personal!

Clean and comfortable stay at this hotel. Near the Tokyo mrt stain station with many eateries around that area. Staff are friendly and always willing to help. Will come back again to this hotel. Stayed only 1 night here en route to Kyoto.

Convenient location, the hotel is just 5 min walk from the Tokyo station, friendly staff, clean rooms, wish our room be a bit bigger, very nice choice of body soap/shampoo, great Japanese buffet breakfast, overall very good experience!

The hotel situation a short 5 mins from Tokyo Station is spacious. Our room on the 11th floor was very comfortable for our traveling party of 3 persons, each with a wide single bed. The area is quiet but easily accessible to restaurants and cafe. The family mart is right next door.

For those who want to stay around the busy and bustling Tokyo Station or need to stay only for a day or two in Tokyo, this hotel is the one. It is only 3 minutes walking from Tokyo Station North Yaesu exit, a convenient walk from the station. If you are only staying for a day or two, you do not need to stay in Shinjuku or Shibuya as Tokyo Station is the central area where almost all train and shinkansen stop, not to mention the shopping area around it is huge as well as it is close to Marunouchi and the Imperial Palace, all within walking distance. There are a lot of food catering facilities nearby, they open till late with a good variety (from fast food, ramen shop to western/Italian, etc). The hotel itself is quite modern and clean, with comfortable bed. The room size is the standard business hotel room in Japan (don't expect it to be spacious like staying in western style hotels, but for those who have been to Japan before and stay at business hotels, you know what I mean). It has free wi-fi, not super fast but you can live with it. The lobby is on Level 12 and the hotel itself also has a good restaurant, apparently quite well known. Would not mind coming back and stay at this hotel again next time I am in Tokyo.

Enjoyed our stay at this superbly located hotel. Tokyo Station was a mere 5 minute walk and the amenities of this hotel were second to none. The size of the semi-double bed was more than adequate and the lack of storage was the only negative. We expected this given that we had selected the hotel's cosiest offering. The staff were excellent and we wouldn't hesitate to stay here again.

This hotel is just in front of Tokyo Station, Yaesu side. It is very easy to access and connect to everywhere in Tokyo. Service is very good. Room space is adequate. Bathroom is big though. Asking for station view, you can take photo of the station and lighting during sunset.

I stayed extra after a business trip and used the Ryumeikan Hotel as a base for sightseeing. Not even a 5 minute walk from the North East (Yaesu North) exit from Tokyo Station. Coffee shop and restaurants right next door. I stayed in an economy double room which was nicely appointed though small. It was aptly named. No view but I was looking for value. Desk staff was very nice, friendly, and helpful in dealing with my English only communication.I would stay there again as it was a good value and great location for exploring Tokyo.

We had great online support from Shiori and Atsuko via email even before we arrived. They patiently dealt with the many questions we had in our first visit to Tokyo and booked restaurants for us.The hotel is well-situated - 5-10min from Tokyo and Nhombashi stations. The Asakusa/Keikyu line stops at the latter with direct access to Haneda airport, but the mostly underground walk is about half a km from the train to the hotel door. The hotel does not have a front porch for cabs and guests with heavy luggage will have difficulties in the rain. There is a convenience store downstairs. The lobby and hotel restaurant are on the highest/15th floor. There is easy walking access to the Daimaru and Coredo department stores as well.We stayed twice here, using both the Forus B and C rooms. A Large TV with English channels is available.There is video-on-demand with a card purchasable from vending room on each floor. There were good toiletries in large bottles, purchasable if desired.The hotel gave nice complementary snacks and lots of free bottled water - 2 in fridge and 2 outside that we used tfor the free Nespresso machine. Both Western pajamas and yukatas were available for use. The Forus B/smaller room featured a bed with soothing music and vibration to encourage sleep - quite special! WiFi was free in room, with good signal strength.The hotel breakfast on Sunday stretched till lunchtime. It is possible to sit there and wait for the buffet menu to change. We were well-satisfied with the quality and range of food available. If there weren't so many great places to eat around the hotel I would not have minded eating there every day. Would return if back in Tokyo!

We stayed in the hotel for 3 nights in Oct 2015 and we were very impressed with everything from the comfy room, room equipment & amenities, cleanliness, services as well as the staff performance. We would love to be back there again for our next Tokyo trip. Love it!!!

We stayed for 3 nights in October 2015+ Location and access to public transporation+ Small but well equipped and very clean rooms + Very good sleep quality (good mattress, silent air conditioning, sound proof windows)+ Friendly staffn/a We did not eat at the hotel restaurantWould book again.

Firstly the negatives...it took me ages to find this hotel, but partly to blame was my jet lag and a relatively confusing central station if you don't know which exit you are looking for and the restaurant staff kept getting our order wrong. Now the positives: friendly staff, really nice room (albeit a bit small but for one night only it did the job), great bathroom with an overabundent supply of great products. The location is actually perfect if you want central Tokyo. Central station is over the road, some nice areas close by. As for the restaurant, the food was lovely and the staff were very friendly even if we got the wrong order a couple of times. I would happily stay here again.

This is my favourite hotel. We stayed here on our first visit to Japan and were fortunate to spend another two nights here this trip. I had a one night booking in which the only room available at the time of booking was a standard (I had stayed in a FORUS A previously) and then had a cancelled flight led us to spend an extra night in Tokyo. The room we booked for that night was the FORUS B. The rooms of this hotel, both standard and FORUS are exceptional. The FORUS B is spacious and luxurious. The beds are comfortable and bathroom facilities and toiletry range exceptional. The best thing about this hotel is the staff. They went our of their way to help us with our changed holiday plans (caused by a typhoon). Our Japanese language is limited so the staff called our next hotel and explained we would be a day late in arriving.The location of this hotel is fantastic. Across the road from Tokyo JR station with the airport bus stop outside of the hotel. I would not hesitate to recommend Hotel Ryumeikan and hope to stay here again.

The check in time is 3pm, and I arrived at 2:55pm,and was made to wait until exactly 3pm.Is this a little too STIFF?The hotel is well located, but getting a little bit warn out by time.Re-decoration is absolutely necessary.

I stay 4 nights.good location near airport limo bus stop, family mart , JR Tokyo Station, nihombashi and Tokyo subway station , Daimarusmall room( only 17.5 sq.m ) ,clean and comfortable room , nice stafffree Wi-Fi

This was our first stop off on our 2 week holiday in Japan and our first of 2 hotels in Tokyo. We had a Forus A Discovery room and it was small but had everything that you need.The location was excellent - we came straight out of Tokyo station from the airport and had no trouble finding the hotel. The staff were very friendly - we arrived before our check in time and they kept our bags for us. They were a bit strict about check in time of 2:00 but we found everywhere in Japan was like that. The room was very nice and modern. My husband loved the nespresso machine and the shower was definitely the best we had all holiday! The alarm system is a bit interesting, we didn't end up using it but we enjoyed playing around with it! The yukatas were also very nice and the room was lovely and clean.We would definitely recommend this anyone in Tokyo - the area is quite businessy which was fine for us. For our second stay in Tokyo we stayed in Shinjuku which was very different so a nice balance. It was handy to be able to go to Tokyo station if we couldn't be bothered to walk far for some food etc.

Pros: Walking distance to Tokyo station, great transport links to both Narita and Haneda airports, lots of shops and restaurants nearby. Staff speak good English, very helpful.I had a Forus A single room for 3 nights in Oct 2015. Room is spacious by Tokyo standards. The sleeping system is an interesting idea and I quite like it. Coffee machine a bonus. Cons: like most Japanese hotels, duvet is very warm (I had to get a blanket from reception) and mattress super firm. There were 5 pillows in the room but none of them very good...if not for the bedding I'd give it 5 stars.

The hotel room is quite small (about 20sq meters), which was expected for a tokyo hotel i think. That's pretty much the only negative thing i can say about this hotel.Check-in was fast and efficient. Lobby was located on the top floor so you dont get to see front desk daily. But everytime i needed something, they seem very friendly and helpful. Normally I would only ask for maps of a certain prefecture. But once I was having a hard time booking our Mt fuji trip, they were very helpful in assisting me. They called the company and help me book. They even got the reference number just to be sure that everything goes well with my booking.The location was great. About 5 minutes away from tokyo station. Plenty of shops, restos and stores around the area. Of course, being near tokyo station, very accessible for travel.The room was small but it has everything that you need for travelling. There's nespresso for my coffee fix. The toiletries were abundant. They even have facial cleansers for me and my wife. Bed was very comfortable. Wifi was great! not much english channels though which wasnt much of a problem.Overall, very good hotel. Value for money.
user_name:
Alvin S
San Fernando La Union, Philippines

review_body: Situated a couple of blocks across from Tokyo station, Hotel Ryumeikan offers a wonderfully comfortable nest for easy traveling in and around Tokyo. My one-person efficiency room was a beauty and way more spacious than I had expected (could easily sleep two tbh). The room offered pod coffees and even had some cracker snacks which came in handy when I was hungry but too tired/lazy to go out and hunt for food late at night. The best thing though, is the immaculate service. The staff is quite fabulous at attending to your every needs. Great experience staying here, and I would definitely return (which, for someone who likes to always try out new places, says a lot!).
user_name:
MeteorLight
New York City, New York

review_body: I have stayed in a number of mid-range business hotels in Tokyo and other Japanese cities ranging from fairly good to quite bad but this was by far the best of them. It's normal room rates are higher than many lesser business hotels but they have two good plans for 30% or 20% discount for payment in advance that bring them down to an affordable level.The location of the hotel is excellent, very close to Tokyo station and two Metro stations in an excellent area for shopping and dining. Despite this location, it is an oasis of quiet and calm. The rooms are a good size for Tokyo hotels, scrupulously clean, comfortable and well equipped. The staff are helpful and the hotel's own restaurant is a great place for a Japanese breakfast.To get a better hotel in Tokyo would cost much more and I would highly recommend this one.

I stayed for 2 nights. Although the size of the hotel room is small but the hotel is among the best that I have stayed in Tokyo. Location is superb as this is only 3 to 4 mins walk from Tokyo station and travelling to Haneda airport is seamless with the JR Line and monorail. There is a bus stop outside the hotel that brings the visitors from Narita airport too. Plenty of food options in the vicinity plus a Family Mart store to offer convenient grocery items and food as well. The reception staff speaks English, toilet amenities are generous and there are complimentary coffee/tea and free postcards and origami paper. The hotel pricing is attractive and I would certainly come back again.

Your hotel was recommended by the French Elle magazine and it is what I expected: a clean, quiet hôtel, well located by Tokyo station. The rooms are very well equiped and modern. The staff is friendly and helpful. A very good point of departure hile visiting Tokyo and Japan.

Hotel Ryumeikan Tokyo is one of the best hotel I've ever stayed in Tokyo, the location is superb, just a few steps from hotel to Keisei Expressway Bus to Narita airport. Metro and JR is at the door step so you can go every where you want in Tokyo. Room is clean, staff service is excellent and soundproof system is great.

We stayed here one night after arriving in Tokyo late at night, with plans to take the train to Osaka the next morning. The hotel is a convenient, short walk from Tokyo Station and well priced. The room was very clean and the bed was very comfortable. The hotel staff was polite and helpful. The rooms are small, but I think that is typical of most hotel rooms in large cities. There is a small 24 hour convenience store next to the hotel which was great for buying bottles of water and a late night snack. I highly recommend this hotel.

The primary reason we stayed here was due to proximity to Tokyo Station. We flew in late at night and were catching the train early the next morning. The station is a leisurely 5-10 minute stroll away. The rooms are pretty compact but very functional with no details spared. Our room had the usual touches for Japan such as impeccable cleanliness, fancy toilet and an awesome hair dryer. The parts that were unique included origami paper with some instructions for making cranes, postcard which the hotel will mail out for you for free, above and beyond amount of toiletries (anti-aging cream, shaving cream, aftershave etc) even for Japanese standards. Some free snacks and water were provided in each room. We also enjoyed the comfy and stylish yukata. Overall, a short and sweet stay!

This is my forth time to stay in Ryumeikan. Location is good, just 5 minutes walking distance to Tokyo Station. Room is clean with multi function shower, bed and pillows are comfortable. Small room size of Standard type, prefer to stay “Forus” type with bigger room size. Hanger stand area is not big enough even in summer season. Highly recommend if you are looking for hotels in this location.

Situated bang opposite the Tokyo station, it is a good place to use as a base for a business trip. The Reception is situated at the top floor and the Hotel has 8 of the top floors in the building. The rooms are very spacious by Tokyo standards. The bus from the airport drops you right at the gate of the hotel, which is one of the biggest advantages when you come from the airport. All in all, a very convenient place to stay in.

My family (2 adults & 2 kids under 10) was fortunate to stay here for 9 nights in a Suite room, which had two rooms plus a large bathroom. The kids slept in a tatami mat room on very comfortable futons and we had two separate single beds in the main room. The room was spotless and we felt extremely comfortable as soon as we opened the door. We rarely saw any other guests or staff - needless to say the room was very quiet and a good nights sleep was had by all every night. As other reviewers have noted the extras such as the Nespresso machine and daily water supplies were appreciated. Location was great as well. Only negative was the lack of natural light and view of the building next door but this is Tokyo. We highly recommended this place.

I love this hotel! It's so easy to get to from JR rail station. It's nice and fancy. I wanted to comeback after I tour Hokkaido but they are sold out . The reception are friendly and they spoke English well. I will definitely come back here. Highly recommend. Stay here and you will love it too.

There is an incredible ninja experience with seeing how much functionality can be jammed into a Japanese sized room. Great staff who are willing to help with reservations. This hotel is close to Tokyo station and I've visited a number of times.

This was not a big hotel. But, the management and service were just great. The double bed room we had was spacious in Japanese standard. The room was clean and decorations were modern. The bed was comfortable. An remarkable thing was the water closet in the washroom was a real state of art and high technology. This was the first fully automatic water closet that I had ever encountered from automatically raising the toilet cover, flushing and closed the cover after one had finished.The hotel was just beside the Tokyo Central Railway Station and the Airport Bus Stop was just 1 minute walk from the hotel. Therefore, its location was super convenient.The Japanese style buffet brunch offered by the hotel restaurant was just great in taste, variety and value for money.

Great hotel! I have been to Tokyo for 3 times, every time different hotel but this is the best. Have an espresso machine in the room, free mini bar and daily drinks, tibits and even Japanese green tea for you to brew! But breakfast could be improved by having international breakfast. The current breakfast is only Japanese breakfast. Could also change the variety of the breakfast as well instead of having the same breakfast.

The hotel is well located and provides very good value for the price. The room was a little small, but not bad at all for Tokyo! The service was very nice. We didn't use the restaurant - too many choices nearby around Tokyo station, but it looked nice as well.

We only stayed there for a night before catching our flight home, but it was great. The only downside of the hotel was snobby reception manager, which looked us down as we had bagpacks and made us very unwelcome. Other than that everything was great, good location, clean room.

This hotel is ideally located near Tokyo Station and has many great food and drink locations nearby. The staff is excellent and rooms are right sized for the region and offer a great space to work and relax. I would highly recommend one of the Focus rooms as they offer the ability to innovate and discover. I will stay again in my next visit to the region.

I must say this hotel has been great in many different things: from the staff (absolutely friendly and available) to the position, to the room that has been on average dimension as Japanese hotel, but with BIG bad (finally) and really really clean!! I would put 4 stars instead of 5 just cause I saw on Internet that in every room there was a Nespresso coffee machine (and I was desperately looking for a good coffee in the morning) but in ours it didn't...For all the rest, it deserves 5 star!

Good location, about 3 minutes to Narita Bus Express, 7 minutes to Tokyo Station & Daimaru. 24 hour family mart next door, lots of eateries nearby. Walking distance to Palace East Garden. Staff speak English. Clean & nice hotel. Highly recommended.

I have stayed at this hotel at least a handful of times now -- obviously it is pleasant enough to keep coming back!When you come to the check in, they greet you with a cold hand towel when it's hot out, and hot hand towel when it's cold out. This pleasant greeting is the indicator of the positive stay in store. The rooms are quite small, but you won't be spending much time in the room. The Forus A rooms have these fantastic massage sprays, plus a rain shower head and a regular shower head. The other rooms have standard showers. At the end of long days, the massage showers are a true relief. The rooms are very clean and you hear very little from the outside or people in the hallways.The closest subway stop is Nihonbashi -- literally right around the corner, but also just down the street from the Yaesu North exit out of Tokyo Station. (Go through the two Daimaru stores at street level, cross the street in the crosswalk, stay on the street the station is on, and the building will be on your right side at the end of the street, just past the Family Mart. The location is very convenient if you'll be using your rail pass, and taking day trips on the trains.During the summer when it's hot, it's also convenient that there's a washing machine on two floors. I never had difficulty accessing it on the multiple stays there, and at a cheaper rate than other hotels. Another convenience is the free Wi-Fi in the rooms -- helpful for keeping in touch with loved ones at home, and for looking up information for the next day.The staff really make an effort to communicate in English, which is appreciated. They even have a free English newspaper available in the mornings, except on Sunday. The staff are very pleasant and try to accommodate any request. Highly recommend!

This hotel is so high tech! 1) music system2) Nescafé coffee machine3) Fully button controlled toilet bowl. Auto flush, auto lift of cover etc... I especially love the rain shower! No bathtub is awesome! A 5 mins walk with luggage to Tokyo station. 2 mins walk to Metro station. Excellent location. Totally love the experience. Will definitely return and highly recommend to all!

This is the hotel I always stay whenever I am in Tokyo. It's a few min walk from Tokyo station. Hotel staff is very friendly, room is clean and modern, has everything one needs. Although the one person room maybe a bit small, but hey this is Tokyo, real estate is expensive. For a moderate price, it's good value for the money.

Stayed here for a night to start a week-long trip through Japan. Took the Narita Express into Tokyo station and this hotel was just a 5 minute walk from there. Hotel staff was very friendly and helpful and spoke fluent English. Room was big (had a corner twin) and was quiet with very comfortable beds. Bathroom came with a lot of amenities too. Hotel is also located very close to 3 metro spots making it easy to get to where all the action is in Tokyo as this is in the business district. After a 13-hour flight in from NYC, this was a relaxing way to start off a trip.

Great place to stay for a short visit, modern and clean. Near the railway station. Beds are comfortable and bathroom perfect. Near the hotel 24/7 supermarkt. Take a bigger room to make your stay more comfortable. Big enough and all you need to visit Tokyo

For first-timers in Tokyo, this location can't be beat. We took the Keisi bus from Narita and that literally could not be easier. You can see your hotel from the bus stop -- and it's cheaper than all other transport options. We had two side by side rooms (for a family of 4) and they were, as expected, very small. But quiet and genuinely smoke free. I actually opted for the FORUS rooms, thinking the technology aspects would be cool, but in hindsight, definitely not worth forgoing some sunlight from the window (our room faced a wall, about 4 or 5 feet away.) Wished for more English language cable channels - and hated the fact that anytime you went into the bathroom (even in middle of night) the light came on and louds sounds accompanied (automatic flushing, for example). No way to do that quietly and not wake a sleeping partner. But the beds were firm, the air conditioned good, and the service very easy -- everything you need in the room (and free water and nibbles), front desk helpfull reserved bus tickets for us on the way back, and location very easy as a base. You won't be in the happening area of town (it's basically a business district, I think) but we found it a good and easy base.

I was looking for a good hotel close to Tokyo station for a 6 night stay. Having done a lot of research, I settled for this one. I could not make a booking 6 months in advance. Availability grid on the hotel website shows no availability that far ahead. This was also not easily bookable on expedia. I simply wrote an email to the hotel and they confirmed the booking very promptly without asking me any questions. No credit card required! After some time, I wanted to add another day to my stay and once again very prompt reply to my email confirming the same. The hotel website describes several room types in great detail. One must read this carefully to decide what type of room is required. We selected Forus type A- Discovery room. This was just enough for two of us. The room and the facilities provided are exactly as described -one hundred percent. Having stayed in several big cities- this is the best hotel I have stayed at. Booking, check in, staff and room facilities score ten out of ten. Location is brilliant- about 3-4 min walk from Yaesu north exit. Arriving on Narita Express, the walk inside Tokyo station is probably longer than outside! A Family Mart next door and a 7/11 shop in the side lane were useful.Reception desk is on the top floor-15F. Staff speak only working English. Everyone is extremely polite and very helpful. The mini fridge in the room was empty and very useful to keep drinks, yogurt, fruits etc. 4 bottles of mineral water every day in the room almost met our daily needs. Tap water is also of very good quality. Tokyo was really hot- 33 degrees and the ice machine on our floor was also very useful. We did not use the washing machine and dryer but I have seen it in use regularly. Rooms were exceptionally clean. Very regular provision of all toiletries and coffee machine supplies. My wife is now a fan of the Nespresso machine. Wi-fi was very good for connection and speed. We could comfortably use Skype, Facetime and whatapp calling in addition to usual Internet use. They had a good selection of award winning post cards in the room which they posted free for us!Very good toilet. Shower is the best I have seen anywhere. A bit amused by the electronic WC! We travelled a lot on Yamanote line and Shinkansen using JR pass and found the proximity of this place to the station very useful even during heavy rain.There were no problems in the form of – room key card not working, poor quality air conditioning, wifi not connecting, weak shower, inadequate lighting in the room, billing mistakes etc- at least one of these problems I have come across every hotel in the world- but this place is just perfect. Overall a brilliant hotel for location, staff, room, amenities and cost. Can not fault them for anything and really surprised as to how they keep everything perfect every day with courtesy and smile! Would happily stay again.

This is my second time choosing Hotel Ryumeikan Tokyo.The location of the hotel is great and convenient, just one minute walk to the nihombashi metro staion. This station has three metro lines which can bring you to most of the attractionsThe hotel is also opposite to JR Tokyo station where you can find Daimaru and many shopping malls there~JR Tokyo Station is one of the stop of the Narita Express, the hotel suits those who visit Tokyo for their first time as it can be easily found.Besides, the staff are friendly and can communicate in English. They also helped me to book some famous local restaurants 1.5 month before~ Great~Price, of course so reasonable and with good quality~No doubt in my top priority when i visit Tokyo again next time~

I stayed at the Ryumeikan for four nights in July on business. Booked in advance, so paid 30% less (see their website). Had a room with a view - of a wall! But that cannot be helped (even at the Marriott in Ginza, there are rooms like that). Room amenities and quality were top notch. Unbeatable location next to Tokyo station and all the trains there, and Nihonbashi subway. Will definitely stay here again.

We really can't say enough nice things about this hotel. We loved everything about it... well maybe we didn't love the "potty porthole" but that was an epic thing to send photos home about.If you are looking for excellent service, a centrally located home base in Tokyo, and a comfortable room, then this is the place for you!Everything was very modern and very clean. The room, as is typical in Japan, was very small. If you have a ton of luggage, you are going to need to store it and we were told you can ask the front desk how to do this. We only had 2 medium bags and these fit well in the room. There are tons of places to eat, places to shop, and every single mode of transportation in Tokyo within a 5 minutes walk of this place.THIS INCLUDES THE EXPRESS BUS TO NARITA AIRPORT! The Tokyo Station bus stop is a few hundred feet from the front door. Don't bother paying more for the JR Train to Narita if you stay here. This was faster and more convenient, unless you just prefer trains there is no reason to spend more for less.The front desk staff were extremely good at their jobs. They made an instant friend in me when we arrived on an extremely hot day and they noticed I was sweating. They got me an ice-cold towel and a dry one to wipe off with. Check-in and check-out were smooth.We stayed here on both ends of our trip to Tokyo. Both experiences were superior.We requested a second set of pillows (they have multiple kinds of pillows to choose from) be delivered to our room on the first night of the first visit and when we arrived for our second visit, the person checking us in mentioned to us that they had taken the liberty of putting 2 extra pillows (the type we had chosen the first time) in our room already. THAT is a perfect example of rock star service. It was a tiny thing that meant nothing, but also meant a great deal to us.They had slippers you were allowed to take with you and some biscuit/cookie things. There was a mini fridge and complimentary water each day. The room was cool and everything was in perfect working order. The restroom was large enough, the shower was excellent with solid water pressure, and they provided at least 2 dozen different toiletries for your use.We were so glad we chose this hotel... twice.The potty porthole is something you have to see for yourself, though. That was weird.

This is a very well run place - and superbly located for rail connections - as its right by Tokyo station - and the stop for the bus to Narita. As you'd expect the rooms are not large and mine looked straight out on to a wall but they're not too bad either, and they are scrupulously clean, quiet and well equipped. Breakfast mainly Japanese, which may not suit all, but it's good. The location means no gym or pool, so depends on your priorities. But overall very pleasant and reasonable and great for a short stop.

Location across Tokyo station. Shiny clean and very nice place to stay. Everything is about comfort. We have spent out last night in Japan there and it was very pleasant final touch. Plenty of restaurants around, shopping area, next to subway station. I enjoyed sating there.

We stayed at Ryumeikan for 4 nights in early July. The location is good, about 5-10 minutes of walking from Tokyo station. I would suggest taking the exit of "Japan Bridge 日本橋", rather than "Yaseu 八重洲", especially when carrying a lot of luggage because it is much easier to walk inside the building.It was a wonderful experience. The room (suite ジュニアスイートA) is ideal and pleasant for a small family (2 adults and 2 kids). It was fully cleaned everyday. The staff were friendly and helpful. We appreciated that they took care of our luggage when we left for Karuizawa. The self-serve laundry was great for family trip.The breakfasts were awesome; all the foods are fresh and healthy. It was also very nice that all the drinks in the fridge and movie channel are free of charge. The wifi speed is fast and reliable.Overall, no wonder Ryumeikan is number 1 in the area. We look forward to coming back.

Would definately stay here again. Really appreciated the helpful and very professional staff. Check in and check out went smoothly and they were very helpful with all my questions.The room was on the small side but so am I so had plenty of space. Everything was clean and well laid out. Shower was very good (though small) and the bathroom was nice and clean.The bed was comfortable but smallish so two large adults might need to upgrade to a larger room.Very close to Tokyo station so easily accessable and convenient.
user_name:
MaikKubo
New York City, New York

review_body: We stayed just one night but wished we could have stayed longer. Smooth check-in with lovely staff. Close to Tokyo station (we had an early train the next morning).Bathroom was very nice and loaded with amenities. The bed was firm but comfortable though a bit on the small side. Good TV.Overall the small space of the rooms is well used so comfortable. The place is very clean and the staff are extremely polite and helpful so we highly recommend this hotel at this price point.

Cheap is best how to describe this hotel. Prices are low. Good to sleep an move. If you rely on additional Service, it is non existing: no gym, no bar, no in room mini bar, no room service, no English TV channels (yes Bbc and cnn). Brekkie is sober.

The location of the hotel is great and convineance (near Tokyo station). There is a shuttle bus directly travelling to/ from Narita Airport in about 1 hour and 15mins. Also, the service is excellence and I feel comfortable to stay in this hotel. I choose to live in this hotel every time when I go to Tokyo.

On my last day of the trip to Japan, I picked this hotel for the convenience of location. However, I was pleasantly surprised with the facility and amazing quality of customer services. They are very fast at replying my request email to make it very easy to communicate with them as a foreigner who do not speak any Japanese! I would love to specially deliver my appreciation to Ms. Tabazou(sorry if I spelled it wrong). She has gone extra miles to assist me with my boarding to the airport shuttle and made sure the shuttle staff could accept me and my luggages. Her thoughtfulness was extraordinary to made me feel like VIP to differentiate the outstanding service of this hundred years history hotel compare to any other awesome hotels in Tokyo!

We stayed in Hotel Ryumeikan Tokyo for 7 nights in June 2015 while exploring Tokyo and surroundings. It was the perfect place to stay: 5 minutes walking from Tokyo Station,nice and very clean rooms, good customer service.I recommend booking twin, not double room if you travel with a partner.For 1-2 nights double room can be fine though. The bed is something like our Quinn size.If you stay longer, it's better to get a bigger room. We didn't eat breakfast there thinking $25 per person was a bit pricey. There are a lot of choices to eat in the area, including Tokyo Station itself. Strongly recommend it for anybody and any occasion.

The location is very convenient. The staff were helpful, the check-in process is speedy and concise. The room is extremely spacious (and it is rare considered the location), which consists both Japanese and Western style.

We stayed here at the end of our trip for one night, and we wished we had stayed longer. We arrived a little early, but the hotel stored our luggage until check in time. When we arrived back to the hotel, the staff had already taken our bags up to our room and set everything up for us! The staff was very patient and helpful, and even helped us mail off a few things.We booked the standard twin room, and loved it. It was big by Tokyo standard (at least from our experience), and came will all needed amenities. There was plenty of room for both of us to open our bags and go through all of our belongings. There was a large closet with enough room to store everything, a large desk, and a mini fridge. The only issue I think we had was that it took us a bit to find a plug in to charge our phones. The location was super convenient, just down the street from Tokyo Station, which made it really easy to get around Tokyo. We had no trouble at all finding the location. There is a convenience store and coffee shop on the same block, so we didn't have to go far if we needed a quick snack.I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone who wants a nice convenient place to stay. I know that we will be staying there again in the future!

So closed to the main Tokyo station. Wonderful oasis in a full on Japanese experience. We loved our three days here, the room may gave been reasonably small with not a great view but we have Never had so much included as standard! Staff were genuinely very helpful.

The room is small. But the desk / couch/ facilities are well designed equipped. The round curved desk is smooth for me to access the bed freely with bothering my significant other. We enjoyed the soothing music and the waving foot massaging.Very artistic nearby area information/map pamphlet.A lovely experience.

There are already many good comments given to this hotel. I just want to give a clearer direction to others as we had some problems finding the hotel following those tips given in the previous reviews. Key point : The hotel is on the left side of Daimaru across the street. From Tokyo Train Station, always get out by Yaesu North Exit and walk towards Daimaru then walk out from the building and cross the street. Turn left and the hotel is about 100m away.

Probably my 4th-5th time staying here, always a great experience. Rooms are clean, well equipped, modern and comfortable - a little small but that's normal for Tokyo. Staff are friendly and very helpful. Location is just opposite the Tokyo Station. I always return to Ryumeikan for my Tokyo stays!

This is our new favourite Tokyo hotel, after staying at about 5 or 6 hotels in Tokyo (all TripAdvisor ones so all pretty good). But this one comes out on top, in terms of value, location, and the comfort. We booked their Forus A one, which was adequate space and perfect for 2 people (with 2 suitcases). The Nespresso machine and the cool wake-you-up-with-music bed were pretty cool. The toilet has all the bells and whistles you would expect from a good Japanese hotel. We never heard any noise while in our room either - amazing noise proof rooms! We booked via their website directly and the 30% off if you book 30 days in advance would give you a really good deal. The location is unbeatable. Given our trip involved use of the shinkansen (Bullet train), we simply love being near the Tokyo Station. As many other reviewers have said, getting to and from airport was also a breeze, be it that you use the Narita Express, or even easier if you use the Narita Highway bus which has a bus stop basically 10-20 metres out of the hotel door (right outside Excelsior the cafe). We arrived by Narita Express and left via the highway bus, as the highway was not only super handy if you have a bit of luggage (Tokyo Station is still a 5 minute walk), it's also super cheap at 1000 Yen. It took us 50 minutes from memory to get to Narita, which was very comparable to Narita Express. You would also find yourself always near lots of food and shop. We went to the First Avenue mall at the basement level of Daimaru Department Store a lot. We like the Tokyo Ramen Street there - about 6-7 different stalls offering ramen from various regions in Japan. Also lots of souvenir stores to get toys for kids - Hello Kitty, Star Wars, Disney - you name it. You are also about 15 minutes' walk from Ginza, where you would have endless shopping option like the magnificent 11 floor Uniqlo, Muji, Ginza hands (better than the Tokyo Hands at Daimuru), Zara, GAP...This is really a gem.

We transferred from another hotel to this one. I was told by the staff of the former hotel that all hotels in Tokyo are small. Knowing that some photos online can be deceiving in how big and modern the room actually is, I took the risk to book Hotel Ryumeikan Tokyo last minute anyway. I was blown away with the facilities, the room size, and the cleanliness; not to mention the friendly and helpful staff! Thumbs up is an understatement. I cannot say enough of the comfort level - there is more than enough room for two persons to relax comfortably, even after placing our luggages down.We totally enjoyed our 2N stay here. The location is great - just opposite Tokyo train staion, and a min walk to take airport shuttle bus.Thank you, Hotel Ryumeikan Tokyo!

Stayed here for 3 nights in June. Wonderful location, as it took me only about an hour to travel from Narita Airport. NEX + 5 minute walk from Tokyo Station. The reception is on 15/F. Staff very friendly and nice, with good English. The Japanese restaurant on 15/F serves good food, too. I tried buffet breakfast, buffet lunch and dinner. Value for money.One of the features of this hotel is their "forus"-type of rooms. After you set your wake up alarm, the lighting dims automatically while some very nice music starts. Guess the idea is to give you a very nice sleeping environment. It was quite interesting.A not so good thing was that my room was facing the blank facade of a neighbouring building. Literally like 1-2 metres away?! So, basically, no views at all. I just kept the curtain closed all the time.

Location 5 star for tripping around tokyo and the area is interesting in its own right. A nice 20 min walk to Ginza. Rooms are small but I believe these prob have a bit more room than most in Tokyo. Shower and bathroom were great. We had a Nespresso machine and tabs in the room which was great. Other amenities all looked after. Request for iron brought up right away and they left it with us for the rest of the trip. The staff were nice and professional. I asked for help printing out a booking for a show for my girlfriends birthday, when we got back there was a little bag of sweets and a note for her in the room. Nice touch! Was a joy to come back to this hotel after long days sightseeing.Easy to find out of the yebisu side of tokyo station. Ales than 10 min walk with bags.

This is more of a business hotel, so concierge service is largely absent, although the front desk personnel try to be helpful. No western breakfast on the premises, but there is a refrigerator and coffeemaker in the room. The rooms are comfortable, attractive, well-equipped and not cramped -- the one I had was quiet too. Located almost directly across from Tokyo station. Excellent value at 14,000 yen per night (advance booking discount) for a Forus Single-A Discovery room.

This hotel is located 5 minutes from the Yeasu entrance of the station. The reception is on the 15th floor. The room was very clean, it had a desk, nice bed (one side against the wall), but plenty of room. There is no closet. Every day we were given origami papers, postcards, nuts. There is also a lot of toiletteries.In the neighbourhood we couldn't find a lot of good restaurants..try the Italian place just outside...the spaghetti with shabu shabu pork is excellent.

Fairly standard business style hotel for Japan with smallish rooms, and modular bathroom. There was nothing wrong with it, but equally nothing exceptional either. We were able to drop our bag off at the hotel in the morning (as we were moving from another hotel in the Tokyo area to this one), going for a day trip on the train outside of the city to stay here for the night before getting a train to another part of the Japan the following day. So proximety to the station was our main criteria when choosing this place. There are a number of local eateries in the area, but many are salary-men focussed although we did find some places that were not focussed upon being a smkoing and drinking den.

We had a very pleasant stay in Ryumeikan hotel. It has an excellent location only three minutes walk to Otemachi metro station and from Tokyo Central Station (Yaesu). The room was very comfortable, clean with all kind of items including nespreso machine, tea and free bottles of water every day.No doubt we will come back.

Location is excellent--right across from Tokyo Station. We had a couple of nights in this hotel and it was fun. There are lovely Yukatas for each guest and we had some fun with that! We had a suite for three--mom and two daughters. It was small with two beds and one tatami, but it was clean and comfortable, good bathroom. We had an outdoor patio, a fridge stocked with soft drinks included (nice in the hot weather), and a dining (or tea with yukatas) area. Staff was very helpful with airport arrangements and the Keisei and limousine bus stops are very close.

this wasn't our first choice of hotel in tokyo but it turned out to be pretty good. Smart hotel, good value (at least on our deal) and while we had some doubts about the location, it wasn't bad. Ginza is walkable or a short subway ride away, and tokyo station is literally on your doorstep. Only thing I was unhappy with was total lack of storage space. This is not uncommon in japanese hotels, and it might vary depending on the type of room you book, but still...

A very modern, smart and very comfortable accommodation. The rooms are a reasonable size with every modern gadget that you can wish for - including a bed which gently vibrates whilst soft music plays to lull you to sleep! (but you can turn it off if it feels funny - I must admit, I did).Staff are very efficient and helpful.The hotel is almost opposite Tokyo Station (Yaesu North Exit/Entrance). From here you can take the express train to and from Narita airport...or even nearer is the Express Bus to Narita (Reception staff will point out how close it is).There are many restaurants, bars, cafes, mini supermarkets and other shops very close to the hotel. This is a really nice, comfortable place to stay.

Chose this hotel because of its proximity to Tokyo station. If you're travelling by Shinkansen it doesn't get any more convenient than this, plus you have easy access to loads of food options in the station. Ginza is also within walking distance.The room was standard-sized for Japan (ie small) but clean. My only complaint, and this is very personal, was that the mattress was a bit hard, while the pillows had some weird bean bag type balls in it. Please note that if you take one of their cheaper rooms, your view is likely to be an adjacent wall 4 metres away from the window. Our travelling companions had a corner room and that was definitely a step up in terms of size, view and amenities (nespresso machine!)

Convenient and high quality in central Tokyo where being nextto the train station is a major plus. Our room came with anespresso maker which was a real treat! The staff were veryhelpful in making restaurant reservations, writing out directionsfor taxi drivers, and printing airline boarding passes. They evenresponded quickly to requests by email. Location was 20 to 30minutes walking to some major sights and excellent restaurants.

This excellent small hotel is an oasis with nicely appointed, quiet rooms containing everything you could need. The staff was very helpful when my airline suddenly made an error with my return flight. I recommend this hotel.

The hotel was easy to find only 3 minutes walking from Tokyo Station (I forget the best exit but if u ask at the information booth they will direct you). The Airport bus service is directly outside hotel and costs 1,000yen to Narita. Nihombashi subway stop is a 2 minute walk around the corner and can be used to get around Tokyo. Check in is on the 15th floor as is the hotel restaurant. There is a Family Mart directly next door which is open 24hours. Many other restaurants in the area and in the station as well. The rooms are tiny, as is standard in Japan. There is shared laundry and vending machines outside the rooms. Toiletries are provided as is a kettle. The room was clean. New towels provided daily. Breakfast was not included in our stay so I cannot comment on the food but there are plenty of options nearby.The room had a quirky porthole from the bedroom to the bathroom that added some character to the place. The bed was a bit hard and the pillows very flat, we didn't ask for any extras so not sure if they can be provided. The reception staff were friendly and spoke English. We were able to leave our luggage on our last day and picked up before heading to the airport.I would recommend this hotel for a central stay in Tokyo.

I booked a FORUS-A "Discovery room and it was really good. It was just me in the room but it would also suit two adults. This room has a "higher dimension of functionality and design, in order to lift your physical and spiritual potential to a higher place" so their website says and it was good. The shower was the best in all of Tokyo with 5 outlets of water on it. A good back massage with the water jets was possible. The room had a sleep button which saw soothing music play softly, the bed vibrate in time with the music and lights dim (as does the music and vibrating) while you drift off to sleep. Sounds funny but it was really nice and seem to work as I never heard the music end as I was asleep.3min walk to Tokyo station was great for exploring, 2 stops to Akihabara, 4 stops to Ueno, 15min walk to Imperal Palace East Gardens and 15min walk to Ginza. Lots of places to eat by or around the hotel, 7/11 type store next to hotel, very new and modern rooms and reception on 15th floor has great views. Go there at night for some photos.Will use this hotel on next stay to Tokyo. Oh, wifi was great speed too.

Location: It is a 5-minute walk to the JR Tokyo station, and 2-minute walk to the Nihombashi metro station. You will be spoilt for choice on the restaurants surrounding the area. There is a Family Mart convenience store just around the corner, so if you want a quick and cheap snack, then you can go here 24/7.Getting here: You have a choice of taking the bus limousine or the express trains from Narita airport. If you are carrying a large luggage, it would be easier to take the bus, even though it willtake a longer time due to traffic congestions. The Keisei airport bus (blue and white bus) stop is a few steps away from the hotel. The stop is "Tokyo Station Yaesu Gate". The Airport Bus Limousine (orange bus) stop is a bit farther, about 300meters. The stop is "Tokyo station, Yaesu South Gate". If you prefer to take the JR Narita Express, then you exit the JR Tokyo station through the Yaesu North Exit, and cross the street to reach the hotel, which is about 100meters away. However, be warned that the Tokyo station is huge and if you are very bad with maps and directions, it might not be the best option for you. The hotel reception is at the 15th floor, so at the entrance all you would see is the lift on your left and another entrance to offices.Rooms: as with any other Japanese accomodations, most of the rooms in the hotel are small. You can check their website to have an idea. I opted to book the Double Room to have a bigger space, but because it is limited, they only have the smoking room available. However, they were nice enough to "sanitize the room" and got rid of any residual smell. I wouldn't have known it was a smoking room if they had not told me beforehand. The bed is firm, and there are two types of pillows, soft and firm. I love that the toilet is separated from the bath. You do not need to worry about toiletries because they have a generous supply of bath/shower gel, shampoo and conditioner, make-up cleanser and facial wash and moisturizer (all Shisheido), facial wash and hair wax for men, razor and shaving foam, toothbrush and toothpaste, brush and comb, and a disposable towel for scrubbing yourself. They have a deodorizer for the shoes and clothes that you will keep in the closet. The double room also comes with Nespresso and free capsule refills, japanese crackers, and tea. Complimentary wifi is stable and fast.Facilities: There is a coin operated washer and dryer on the 10th floor, and an ice machine and vending machine for drinks. Breakfast: The buffet breakfast is mainly Japanese style. Their bread and cereal selection is very limited. If you don't prefer this, then you can choose to go to Starbucks nearby or to the Tokyo station underground for other choices.Service: The hotel staff have limited English skills but understandable. The reception is well-stocked with vicinity maps and are very helpful if you need directions going somewhere. You can also ask them to write the destination in Japanese, so if you want to take a taxi, then you can just show the destination written by the hotel staff for you.Value: Tokyo hotels are expensive in general, but for the location, service and amenities, I believe it is money well spent.

Location is perfect - 5 mins from Tokyo Station, and Airport bus service directly outside hotel.Staff were very helpful, rooms were well equipped clean and quiet. Good bars in walking distance Would highly recommend and stay again

Great location, clean and quiet rooms. If staying for more than 1 night, take a larger room as economy has only bed and no wardrobe. Right across from Tokyo train station. Close to malls, restaurants, taxi. Very pleasant staff, decent beds.

We stayed at 3 different hotels in Tokyo. This was my favorite. The room size was good. Bed and ammenities were very comfortable. The hotel seems new - everything was fresh looking and clean. I appreciated all the additional perks like the nespresso machine with 8 different pods provided. This really satisfied my coffee craving. Most other hotels just provide a single drip coffee filter or no coffee at all.The location was very convenient for the Tokyo station - about a 3 minute walk away.Price was very fair for the location and quality of the rooms. The TV had 2 English channels - CNN and BBC.

The Ryumeikan Hotel is a nice, modern hotel conveniently located close to Tokyo station and almost directly in front of an airport bus stop. The rooms are small as you would expect in Japan, however they have a little bit more space to move around in than say your Chisun Inns or Hotel Mystays, also with a much nicer bathroom. One side of the bed is up against the wall and there is no cupboard for your clothes, just coat hangers on the wall.The reception is on the 15th floor, as is the Japanese restaurant. There are vending machines on every level, with some levels also selling alcoholic drinks. Each day you receive complimentary snacks and water. Behind the hotel are several streets with plenty of restaurants and there are plenty of cafes close by for coffee and breakfast.Free wifi is available.

I couldn't fault Hotel Rymumeikan. Quick, efficient check in and out. Spacious, quiet, clean rooms. A few minutes walk to Tokyo station. Thoughtful touches such as a Nespresso machine and bottled water made the stay even better.

We stayed at Hotel Ryumeikan for 3 nights during our stay in Tokyo. I wish we had stayed there for our entire Tokyo trip.Things I liked:- Convenient location: Close to Tokyo Station, which is important if you are taking Narita Express of Shinkansen. It is also around the corner from the Nihonbashi station, which we used often- Clean and modern decor: The hotel looked fairly new and well maintained. Rooms were small (normal for Tokyo) but bright and modern- Complementary drinks and toiletries: There was an Nespresso machine in the room, complementary water and snacks, and really nice Shiseido products- Easy Check-in and check-out: The staff were efficient and the process was painless- Complementary postcard with paid postage: Small thing but a nice touchThings I didn't like:- Our window faced the wall of another building. Absolutely no view- A little bit pricey, but I think it's worth it given the things they do well

This was my third time staying in Ryumeikan. This time, i stayed at slightly different room which is Forus C "Create", which is the larger room of their "Forus" Business traveller range of rooms.Ryumeikan, is located outside of Tokyo Station (Just a few mins walk). This makes it a great location to explore tokyo and Outside of Tokyo (Shinkansen station in Tokyo Station).The room itself is around 27sqm (fairly big in Tokyo). Ryumeikan often got the early booking promotion which provide substantial discount for booking and paying earlier.During the Nov-15 stay, The front desk also assisted me in reserving some of the top sushi restaurants in Tokyo.I would stay in Ryumeikan the next time i visit Tokyo.

With a location less than five minutes from the Tokyo central train station and next to the entrance to the subway, and reasonable prices for comfortable, clean, quiet, and practical lodging (i.e. no fancy lobby or excess space or luxury in the rooms), this hotel is an ideal place to stay. You will love the Toto washlet once you get used to it. The staff went out of their way to be helpful, even having a staff member put our bags on a trolley and push them two blocks to another location where we met our transfer to the airport. The lobby is on the 15th floor and the rooms are on the floors below. The restaurant, adjacent to the lobby, features authentic Japanese cuisine, even for the breakfast buffet.

My husband and I stayed at the Hotel Ryumeikan Tokyo for four nights in April in a double room facing Tokyo Station. Here's what we liked:* Great location (literally 3 min walk from Tokyo Station, easy to find)* Friendly and helpful staff (helped me make multiple dinner reservations, mailed out their complimentary post cards free of charge)* Modern bathroom facilities (Perhaps I'm behind on the times but the toilet was completely hands-free, amazing rain-shower head type shower, and great Shiseido toiletries provided)* Really comfy bed - Japanese (and Asian in general) beds are known to be hard, but we slept like babies* On-site coin operated self service laundry facilities - we try to travel light so this was really helpful for us to clean all our dirty clothes and travel fresh!* Delicious buffet breakfast with pretty decent varieties.Only thing I'd note is some of their rooms face the wall of the adjacent building. Make sure you ask at the time of your booking if you want a view.I'd definitely come and stay again if we're ever back in Tokyo.

I've stayed at Ryumeikan Tokyo for two separate nights. The location is very good, just take 3-4 mins to walk to JR Station. All the staffs are very helpful and proactive.The rooms are also clean and comfortable.

Hotel is conveniently located near Tokyo station, and best of all, Daimaru's exit. If you're taking the train and carrying heavy luggage, do come up the escalator at Daimaru and cross the road from there. The nearest exit to the hotel (Yaesu exit numer 16) doesn't have escalator/lifts and you will need to take the stairs. Just look for Yaesu exit. There will be a signage for Daimaru. Room is clean and nice, and comes with a Nespresso machine. One complain though, is that room is quite small though, and we couldn't open our luggage fully.

Hotel Ryumeikan Tokyo is ideally situated across from Tokyo Station. I stayed five nights at the end of March. My room - on the 12th floor - was was spotlessly-clean, well-appointed, pretty small, and was extremely quiet despite the busy location. Lobby/reception is on 15th floor with room floors below: just few steps into the building lobby, into the elevator, and direct to room floor; very nice! I found lots of excellent dining and shopping options in the neighborhood. In addition to all its comforts and its proximity to trains/subways, this hotel is a terrific value.

We stayed at Hotel Ryumeikan with our 9 month old during our recent stay in Tokyo. It's situated in a great location, walking distance from Tokyo Central Station. Hotel is very well kept, staff are so helpful and very friendly. Very comfortable stay!

I have been staying at this hotel during my three visits to Tokyo in the last two years.Very good location, just across Tokyo station. Fantastic rooms with useful amenities. Very helpful staff. Only thing missing is breakfast for non Japanese.

We stayed at this hotel early April during our regular family trip to Japan to view the cherry blossoms. We chose the junior suite which provided the space that we wanted. Room was as advertised, nothing more, nothing less. Bonus was the coin-op washing machine on couple of their floors. Best feature of their suite was the bathroom which was spacious, and their tub was sublime. Best way to soak off the whole day of walking around Tokyo while carrying our 1 year old. One small complaint. In the images that advertised the Suite, there was supposed to be a small terrace, but there was none when we got to our suite. Otherwise, great hotel, and I would recommend to my circle.Location is perfect, less than 5 minutes to Tokyo Station West Yaesu exit. Another plus point is the Airport Limousine Bus stop just several steps away from the hotel building entrance. Also, there is a convenience store located right beside the hotel building which we use regularly.Highly recommended.

The hotel is within 3 minutes walk from the JR Tokyo station. Despite of this, it remains quiet at night, is there is no worries for any noise issue. We have stayed in both the Forus room and ordinary double room. The Forus type room is clearly superior, so remember to book a Forus room if you can. (A-)

The location of this hotel is just perfect for travelers. Right across from Tokyo Station with tons of great shopping. The bus for Narita stops practically in front of the hotel and for the I can't live without it Starbucks addicts there is one right around the corner. The property itself is very clean, modern and the staff polite and helpful.The only food options on the property is Japanese food. Since there is are plenty of other options in the neighborhood as well as the International Food pavilion at the train station it's not a big problem, but it would be nice to have a western option for breakfast in the hotel. The rooms are a bit tight, but very clean and comfortable with clever uses of the small space. The hotel pumps an aroma of incense throughout the hotel. Maybe pleasant for some, I found it too cloying.

As others have mentioned, the hotel is in a great location. It is a relatively short walk to Tokyo Station, which is great for travel, eating and shopping. Tokyo station is home to many shops including many great ramen places. It's a great central station that allows to you easily travel. In addition, the Narita express stops here which makes for easy travel when coming in from Narita.Location aside, the hotel was amazing for us. I e-mailed them a few weeks prior to our stay to ask for restaurant reservations. They were able to secure reservations for us at two places that are tough to book. I mentioned in my email that the dinner reservations were to celebrate our engagement. They remembered this small detail in the email and surprised us with a small engagement gift. It was gestures like this that made the hotel stay special. In addition, they were quick to respond when we had an issue with one of our overseas electronic appliance. The hotel itself provides a ton of amenities and supplies (toothbrushes, hairbrushes, shaving cream etc). The hotel itself is on the upper levels of a building with the lobby being on the 15th floor. Our room was on the 12th floor, which means when entering the building, you rarely ever need to re-visit the lobby until checkout. A keycard gives you access to only your floor. However, the lobby does provide a computer and a place to print things if you need to. Each floor of the hotel has a small room with an ice machine, vending machines, and coin operated washer/dryer. For a few hundred yen you could wash a decent amount of your clothing. It was convenient if Tokyo is a part of a longer trip. The rooms were small but then again this is Asia. The beds were great and comfortable. We appreciated the many outlets in the room and the cleanliness. The showers were also the best hotel showers I've ever experienced. They pressure was almost too strong.Long story short, the staff here are incredible and helpful. The hotel is clean and comfortable. The location is great. Highly recommended!
user_name:
Nadim225
New York City, New York

review_body: We stayed at this hotel for a week on our trip to Tokyo. This room was clean and small, but that is what we expected. Our room had a sleep comfort bed with audio controls and sleep mode that plays music for you to sleep.They provide all the toiletries and refill each day if necessary. What we loved most about this hotel was the location. It is literally a 2-3 minute walk to Tokyo Station which served to be VERY useful. I would definitely stay at this hotel again!+Free wifi+LOCATION

Here goes my review. I will do my best to keep it objective.The good:- LOCATION. The bus from the airport leaves you right at the front. Tokyo main train station is one block away. From there you can go everywhere in Japan. Main bus station is also at walking distance. Restaurants, pubs convenience stores and a good coffee shop with with coffee two doors away.- It is quiet. I did not hear the city noise.- They have a coin washing machine and dryer (as well as laundry service) The washing machine a cheap and convenient option. - One thing I personally like, what is is the room you can eat or drink without extra charge.- The bathroom is well stocked. Even nice bath salts. The toilet seats are amazing!- The bath is nice- The rooms are very clean- Check in and out is simple. And they provide assistance in english- The WiFi works wellThe bad:- The pillows are hard- The rooms are small - but this is standard in Japan.- There is a window in the bathroom that looks into the bedroom. This could be awkward for families.For you to decide:- It is in a business district. It is a safe area. - I can't make much comment on the service. Because I like my privacy when I travel and this hotel was really good at respecting mine. If you decide to stay here and you like sweets go to Daimaru across the road. They have a huge variety of desserts. Even just to watch the attention to detail in them is worth crossing the street. There is a lot to see just around the hotel.

This is an excellent hotel situated just a few minutes walk from JR Tokyo station. Simply leave the station by either Yaesu North or Yaesu Central, (the north exit is marginally better), cross the road by means of the pedestrian crossing, and the hotel will be in sight on your left. The hotel accommodation starts quite a few floors above street level, so on entering the hotel building, turn left through the double glass doors and take the lift to reception, it really is that easy and you really do not need a taxi unless you have a lot of luggage.Our room for 5 nights was excellent, it had been thoroughly cleaned and we had no complaints whatsoever. A simple call to reception brought any items that you were in need of.Tokyo JR station is a stop on all the Shinkansen lines and is also a stop for express, local and underground trains.We had room only (without a meal option) as the breakfast for 2 people amounted to £28 ($US 42) per day and there is a convenience store just a few steps from the hotels entrance. Tokyo JR Station, literally a 5 minute walk away contains a multitude of shops and restaurants in its basement floors so there is no need to go hungry or thirsty.All the staff we spoke to had a good or reasonable command of English, the Wi-Fi was very good (in room) and the decor and cleanliness assured you that you were staying in a quality establishment.If we return to Tokyo again, this hotel would be my first choice.

This was our third visit to the Ryumeikan and without doubt it remains our favourite Tokyo hotel. Location remains such a plus for this hotel, as all the reviews reinforce you are literally only 3 minutes walk from Tokyo station. Leaving or arriving from Haneda or Narita is a breeze, orientate yourself to the giant Daimaru department store and Ryumeikan is only across the road and barely a 200m walk. The hotel is very clean and modern and there is a huge attention to detail, from the Nespresso coffee machines to the Shishedo cosmetics in the bathrooms they have thought of everything. The service while unintrusive is outstanding and staff go out of their way to ensure you enjoy your stay. We will be back again next year...

The Hotel Ryumeikan is located almost directly across from Tokyo Station, making it ideal for travelers just arriving in the city. It's not part of a big chain, but is a unique hotel and the quality and care shows. We had a semi-double room which was modern, clean, and a really nice, quiet place to stay. Every single toiletry and amenity you could want was included in the room, and then some (foot massager!). Even the robes included to wear in the room were nicer than those at any other hotel. The room was a little small, but that's to be expected in Japan and the bed was comfortable which is more important. This really is an excellent place to stay and I would recommend it to anyone wanting to stay in the area.

I love everything about the hotel. The location is perfect. Customer service is fantastice. The room facilities are the highlight. Bed and pillows are comfortable. The shower is awesome with all toiletries you might need. I got everything I need. The complimentary coffee and snack are bonus. Thank you for a great experience. We will come back.

This was our first hotel we stayed in during our holiday. By comparison with others in Tokyo it was roomy. We loved the take on the traditional ryokan with a nod to creativity and artists. Staff were friendly and helpful. Location is perfect - across the road from the train station yet with many lovely restaurants in the neighbourhood.

Great location, sufficient amenities, ample room space, and above all, wonderful staff! They helped me out generously even before my trip began! Perfect service made me already feel like home when taking off. I wish I could stay here every time I visit Tokyo! And thank you Ryumeikan staff, you all make a brilliant sakura journey for me! Love you all!!!

We stayed here four nights, in a "Forus B" room.The location, room, amenities, sound-proofness of the room, they were everything we'd hoped for and more. There's only one element we'd have loved to see a little bit better.Location: 2 minute walk to Tokyo Central Station Yaesu entrances. Also only a 5 minute walk to get into the middle of Ginza, where you can do nice sightseeing stuff and go shopping.Room:Some may find hotel rooms in Tokyo small, but not the Forus B room, in our opinion. They're not particularly big, but very nicely and practically arranged and furnished. The bed "experience" is fun and relaxing, having a wake up system with light, music and vibrations. The shower area is very nice, spacious, luxurious (waterfall shower), and pretty much sound proof. There's no bath, but we prefer showers in hotel rooms anyway, so it was perfect for us. The photos on the hotel website give a good impression of the Forus rooms.Amenities:The Nespresso coffee maker is such a nice extra, as is the melodious water cooker ;) There's also a small refrigerator. Every day four 500ml water bottles were made available, and tea bags and coffee cups were restocked. While we were there, every day a postcard from an art collection was made available which the hotel staff posted for us at no cost for postage. The only thing we would have liked in the room would be a safe to store stuff while we went out. We loved the Japanese pyjamas and kimono, which we wore every day when we got "home" and were replaced every morning when the room was done. We would have been just as happy to have used the same set all days of our stay, but it did indeed feel very luxurious to have clean ones every day. The free wifi was fast.Soundproof:As the hotel website states, the Forus B rooms are sound proof. Ours was indeed, we were very pleasantly surprised by it. To be in the middle of such a hectic city with the traffic and all, it was very quiet. We also did not hear anything from other hotel guests at any point. Perfection.OK, so one little point of improvement we think would have made our stay more perfect than perfect: if all of the staff at the reception desk would speak a decent amount of English. Some did, but some could hardly put a sentence in English together and that is something we would have expected at a hotel we think receives many international guests.Other wise, if you wish to be near the train station and also near shops and touristy things and you like the feeling of being pampered: this really is the place to go!

the staff so helpful.. so many restaurants around RYU.. tokyo station just ten minutes walked.. or from nihombashi station just five minutes walked.. convenient! so lucky i can see the sakura blossom just next steps of ryu :)

We used the Narita Express to and from Narita Airport/JR Tokyo Station to reach Hotel Ryumeikan. Return fares for each adult is 4,000Yen. Journey is approximately 55-min each direction - it's very punctual and travellers do not need to worry about traffic jams as compared to taking Airport Limousine Buses (about 90-min journey). At JR Tokyo Station, look out for the Yaesu North Exit (where DAIMARU is). Walk through this exit on ground floor and you will come to a main road with pedestrian crossing. Cross the road and turn left, you will see a bus-stop and a Family Mart. Hotel Ryumeikan is only steps ahead. Total walking time from Narita Express train platform to hotel is slightly below 15 mins with luggages. Signages in JR Tokyo Station is very good, hence fairly easy to nagivate. When you reach the building, go to Level 15 Reception for check-in. Room is very nice, clean, with lots of toiletries and a superb rain shower. Staff are polite and efficient. Stay here if you can as it is near to everything.

ProsVery Nice hotel close to tokyo station. Very quiet and clean room with all the amenities. Contact with the desk office very efficient.KEISEI shuttle bus for narita airport at 50m of the hotel for just 900yens with reservation.Convenience store and restaurants near the hotel.ConsSaturday Brunch breakfast a bit expensive and mostly japanese dishes.Need translation in english of the dishes and more choice of continental plates.Overall, i strongly recommend this hotel for its proximity of the means of transport.

I picked the a hotel ba based on others TripAdvisor reviews and I was not disappointed. The room was probably the best thaI have in during five visits to Tokyo. Staff were efficient and friendly and the facilities were excellent.

I'll be honest: I arrived in time to check-in at 8pm and dipped out early in the morning for Kyoto. However, having said that, this hotel has nice rooms with every amenity you could think of, including free FAST wifi! There is also a washer/dryer next to vending machines! Conveniently located 2 blocks from JR TOKYO Station. Definitely worth a look if you wanna a cheap, nice hotel.
user_name:
OnePieceRick
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: Easy to access from Tokyo Cental Station. Room was comfortable and quiet. Generous size room and clean of course, this being Japan. Service at front desk polite as expected.Nespresso machine in room is a nice touch.

We knew we were flying into Tokyo late and needed w hotel that was easy to get to. Directly across from Tokyo central JR train station, this was a breeze to find. Staff were happy and helpful. Room was large and very well equipped. Will definitely stay again.
