We stayed at the Ryumeikan in period between Christmas and New Year. The best thing about the hotel was the location: it is more or less opposite Tokyo Station, which made it very convenient for a variety of different travel purposes, including arrival from Narita when you are really tired. The room was quite generous for Japan, and very nicely fitted out. The bed was comfortable, and had a clever console for controlling lights and other stuff. The bathroom was neat and clean, with everything you expect at a good Japanese hotel. There are two downsides. It is true that outside the window, about a metre away, was a concrete wall. There is no point in opening the curtains to look out, as there is literally nothing to see but some concrete. But, for the quality of the room and the price, we thought that was OK. Who wants to stay all day in their room anyway. The other odd thing is that the reception and restaurant is at the top of the building, and the rooms below. That meant that after we checked in, we didn't go to the reception again until we left to check out, four days later. So there isn't much 'hotel' atmosphere. You could be anywhere. However, you are actually in Tokyo, and the hotel is very well located for some delicious dinners. We ate very well in the Daimaru restaurant floors, almost opposite the hotel in Tokyo Station, and also at a range of great places in Coredo Muromachi, about five minutes away, including a great intestines restaurant called Hakata Motsunabe Yamaya in Coredo 2. All the shops and restauramts of Ginza are walkable from here too (we had a great dinner at Birdland, and a great martini in the Secret Bar at Dover Street Market).

Booked in the Forus room and i've enjoyed my stay here. it was very clean, and the service was good. The room is small but that was expected. The bed was abit hard for my preference, but after a long day touring by the end of the day, still slept like a baby. The hotel is just less than 5 min walk to Tokyo Station. very convenient area. The only downside i have with the room we had was the view - had none it was facing another building wall. Other than that i was very happy with the choice.Definite recommend to anyone who is looking to stay in this area.

Really love this place. It may not be so popular and be wonderful place to shop, if compare it to Shinjuku, but it's a nice and clam place to stay, if you prefer a comfortable and peaceful hotel. The room is not big, but the service is nice. Its location is near Tokyo station( only five minutes on foot from the station), so it's convenient for the travelers who use JR very often. And it's very easy for us to go Disney. Consider to stay here next time:) Btw if u really need to shop, Daimaru is right beside the Tokyo station, and nearby the Tokyo station there is also one H&M.

I've traveled to many countries and this is near the top of my list of all the hotels. As others have said the location is fantastic near the Tokyo station and subway stations. Ate at a Yakiniku restaurant just down the street. Very delicious with marbled meats. Never had Kobe beef so can not compare, but would stay again at Ryumeikan just to be near this restaurant. Shower stall had seat, overhead shower head, flex hose spray and 3 nozzle sprays. Wifi worked very well and plenty of power outlets. Coffee was good with 4 different premium flavors for individual cup maker. Had both conventional western robe and Japanese Yukata kimono. Nice slippers that you can take home. Room a little small with double size bed.

I have stayed at this hotel both times I have been to Japan. It has a brilliant location, Tokyo station is a 5 minute walk away, and Nihonbashi tube station a 2 minute walk which has easy connection to Ginza and other major areas. You can also walk to the Imperial palace and maranouchi shopping centres within ten minutes. There is a good restaurant in the hotel, a British pub on the ground floor, and a 7/11 next door. The hotel itself is modern and is very clean, with great rooms and amenities. The staff on reception are extremely helpful, and gave a range of maps and information to help find places. I would definitely recommend this hotel most highly.

My daughter and I stayed at the Hotel Ryumeikan Tokyo in early March from March 7-11 in Room 1203. It was our first visit to Japan and we were traveling on our own without the help of a guide or organized group. I had researched locations to stay in Tokyo and wanted a central location. Tokyo Station was absolutely perfect and it was such a relief at the end of a long day of sightseeing to just walk across the street from the train station and arrive at our hotel!We stayed in a corner twin and couldn't have been happier! What impressed us the most were the surprises in the room. The Nespresso coffee machine that helped us get our mornings off to a great start was wonderful. The amenities provided in the bathroom were unbelievable. We're used to the standard offerings but the additional items like hairbrushes, toothbrushes, combs, headbands, Shiseido facial products, large containers of shampoo and conditioner, etc. were a welcome treat! Even the toilet with the heated seat and automatic sensor was fun. And we loved the special touch of kimonos in the room. The beds were extremely comfortable and we barely heard any outside traffic because were were on the 12th floor.The staff at the Hotel Ryumeikan excels in customer service and was so patient in answering our questions prior to arrival. It was a breeze making reservations through the website and also directly through the hotel. Be sure to take advantage of the promotions offered through the website for advance bookings!We are extremely grateful for the care we were given during our stay! Thank you to everyone who helped make our first visit to Japan one to remember. The Hotel Ryumeikan should definitely be your #1 choice for accommodations while visiting Tokyo!!!
user_name:
dc10away
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: Location: easy accesso to/from airports and shinkansen. Bus to Narita right in front. Close to 3 train stations, Tokyo (Yaesu North exit), Nihombashi (A3 exit), Mitsukoshimae (B3 exit). I should have written down the exits numbers, because it's easy to get lost in the stations. Plenty of restaurant and antenna shops (prefecture shops that sell local specialties) near Tokyo Station and towards Ginza. Tokyu Hands and major department stores in the area (Takashimaya, Mitsukoshi, Daimaru, etc), though the most useful shops are in the basement of Tokyo Station (pharmacy, souvenirs, liquor shop, etc).Service: friendly staff promptly arranged anything I asked. Be it a knife to cut fruits, missing yukata, luggage storage until check-in or after check-out, shipping luggage to the next destination ("Kuro neko"), delivering an umbrella I forgot during my previous stay etc. Communication was not a problem when I spoke in English or when attempted to use my limited, broken down Japanese.Room faced the back of the building, so I didn't hear any noise during my sleep. The bench near the room entrance was really useful for holding a large suitcase open. Water pressure from shower was very good. Book in advance for greater discount.For the location, price and service, the hotel is a great choice.

We stayed 2 nights in a corner double room in January and then 1 night in February in a corner deluxe twin room. Both rooms were superb - very comfortable bed, excellent bathroom facilities with separate toilet. Both Rooms were spacious, well designed and very quiet. Free WIFI is included as well as Nespresso coffee machine and bottled water. Love the Shiseido products, the decent hairdryer and the laundry available to guests. Staff were very helpful and spoke great English. We were warmly greeted both times with warm towels on arrival. You can't beat the location - just a short walk from Tokyo station. We have stayed in this hotel several times before and will definitely return here on our next holiday in Japan as each time it has been absolutely superb. Highly recommended.

We stayed here on the first and last day of our trip and proved to be a v good choice. Hotel is newer than many of the other chain hotel and is well maintained. Room seems bigger too. We stayed in a semi double room as other bigger rooms were fully booked, and there's enough room to put two luggages and walking space. We loved that the hotel is only a minute away from the bus stop (Tokyo station), to and from Narita airport. It is also just 5 mins walk to the subway station. Staff are conversant in English, polite and helpful. All in all, I would definitely consider staying here again when I'm visiting Tokyo.

- this hotel is right across the street from tokyo train station making it super convenient. - there is a little mart right next door, a 7 eleven with international atm just down the road and easy access to taxis any time of day or night- the bed has a super cool wake up function which slowly increases the light in the room, plays birds and relaxing music and then slightly vibrates your feet. You have to have patience to figure out how to set it up.- I liked that they also slipped a note saying for each day I didnt have housekeeping make up my room via the do not disturb sign, they would donate some amount of money to a green program

This is a nice hotel in a great location! Just across from the Tokyo station! Easy to jump on the train. Especially for travelers to Disney or to have trips in countryside. Meanwhile, there is a department store near by,it's very convenient to have everything you need.

It deserves all the fantastic reviews. We had a deluxe room on the 13th floor with innovative wakeup technology. You have to be there to enjoy. Restaurant on the top floor but several places to eat nearby. Five minutes to the Tokyo Station which will send you anywhere within the city or country.

Great hotel located near Tokyo station as well as Nihombashi and Otemachi metro stations. It is a bit small but I think average for Tokyo standards - we were able to manage with the space as a young couple. Very friendly staff and a pretty good breakfast option (remember to download their hotel app to get a discount). Would definitely stay here again for any future Tokyo trips.

This hotel is conveniently located a few blocks from Tokyo station. Our room was tiny, immaculate, and had a modern Japanese aesthetic (such as "mood" lighting around the bed, sound machine integrated in the bed frame, and toilet with all the bells and whistles). The bed is proportionately tiny which made for a cozy night sleep. A yukata and slippers are provided. The small window immediately faced a brick wall and let in very little light. The room was extremely quiet. The room was great for sleeping and bathing but, given its size, not someplace to lounge in for long periods of time. Staff at check-in and check-out were efficient, friendly, and spoke English well enough (I do not speak Japanese).

We highly recommend this hotel as it is not only a lovely hotel with very helpful staff but also a great location. Just across from the main Tokyo station and the JR lines with great restaurants close by - so easy to get around from here. After two weeks of skiing we loved the beautiful beds and pillows...it felt like luxury!! We will definitely stay here again when we go back to Tokyo.

My husband and I stayed here with our 8 month old baby for only one night in early February 2015. What a shame we were only here for one evening! This hotel is the best Japanese hotel I've ever stayed in and since returning home, I am desperate to import one of their gorgeous Forus System beds! Everything about this hotel was thoughtful - from the Nespresso coffee pods we sorely missed while away, the one-of-a-kind yukatas (which we ended up buying), the Shiseido bathroom toiletries, the art-space whiteboard in our room to the extremely friendly staff who tolerated my sometimes poor Japanese...thank you for everything. The location is wonderful, only a few minutes from the JR Tokyo Station and not far from the Imperial Palace. We hope the next time we visit Tokyo that we can stay at Hotel Ryumeikan. Thank you to all the staff for such a welcoming, comfortable and overall lovely stay.

Although, I had specifically asked for an early check-in, because we caught the red-eye from Kuala Lumpur, this was impossible. We tried everything, having only one room, not check in now (around 10 h), but at 12h, just being able to shower. Nothing was possible. Very poor English spoken at reception, but "no" was a word well learned. There is only Japanese breakfast. For Western breakfast there is a cafe just two doors furthers towards Tokio Station. Location is conveniently close to Tokio Station at walking distance. Around the corner there are some restaurants (Pizza).

I stayed at Hotel Ryumeikan Tokyo for 3 nights last summer. The room type we stayed was Japanese Suite. It is at 8F, but the room is big and has a small garden. Our kids love this hotel very much. The staff is friendly. The room is comfortable and clean. We will choose this hotel to stay again next time.

The room we stayed in is small, but clean and well maintained. Check in was fast. Hotel staff speaks good English and accommodating. The hotel location is excellent. It is near Tokyo Station and there is an airport express shuttle in front of the hotel (which is 50% cheaper than taking the Narita Express to the airport from Tokyo Station).

The facilities are new. I slept well with their bed and pillow. Service is good as well. It near Tokyo Station and bus stop. You can walk to Tokyo Station in 5 mins. and take bus down stairs. Familymart is down stair. It's very convenient for travellers. Pretty good hotel.

This hotel has by far the best buffet breakfast of any hotel in Tokyo (or perhaps anywhere in the world). I have stayed at dozens of different hotels in Tokyo - the Palace, the Imperial, the Okura, the Daiichi, the Marunouchi - but none of them come close to the excellence of the breakfast buffet here. What is so impressive about the food is that it's totally fresh, healthy & authentically Japanese. They have a fresh vegetable shabu shabu, make-your-own ochazuke with fresh dashi, even a bowl of tororo on the side. The day I ate, they had exquisitely simmered nisshin, renkon dusted with tobiko, a seasonal bowl of tara (cod) with shirako. In other words, if you're looking for cornflakes or bacon & french fries for breakfast, don't come here. But if you want to experience the real Japanese "omotenashi", this is the greatest hotel breakfast in town. I often complain that the business traveler can't get a meal on the road that features sufficient fresh vegetables. This place is balm to the soul & body.

This was my third time at this hotel, and as usual, I was not disappointed. The rooms were always clean, well-maintained and equipped; in all three rooms I have stayed, there was an electric kettle with coffee and tea that housekeeping replaces everyday, an air conditioning system that you can actually control, a desk with easily accessible plugs to charge your devices, a small fridge, but no iron or ironing board (I bet all you have to do is ask the front desk). Another nice feature of the room is the fact that you can actually open the window a little. There's not much of a view depending on the room you stay, but the fresh air is certainly welcome. The staff at Ryumeikan is very friendly and won't hesitate to help you, whether you speak Japanese or not. During my second stay in the hotel, I forgot a phone charger in my room. A week or so later, when I went back the hotel for my third stay, I asked about the charger, and it was delivered to my room. A very nice service and commitment to the guest, considering they kept the charger for more than a week without me requesting them to do so.The location is ideal for people coming to Tokyo for both business and leisure. At the backside of the hotel, as you walk towards Ginza, you will find bars, restaurants, shopping malls, and convenience stores (there's one next to the hotel as well). Tokyo Station itself became a huge shopping mall. You'll find restaurants, gift shops, drugstores and all kinds of retailers for any kind of emergency. Needles to say that getting around Tokyo and other regions of Japan is very easy with all the JR and Metro lines serving the station.If you're coming from Narita airport, the bus to Yaesu is a good option. Yaesu is the last stop of the itinerary, and you'll be just a 3 minutes walk away from the hotel, without having to deal with the escalators or elevators that you would have to face if you take the train (a hustle if you have a suitcase). There is a Keisei bus line that departs to Narita airport right from the hotel entrance too. Very convenient!It is true that you may find cheaper hotels in Tokyo, but at Ryumeikan you are paying for the location-quality combo that is hard to match.

Stayed only one night before catching the Shinkansen the next day, and it was wonderful. Hotel staff was friendly and professional, they even hanged candy on our door because it was Christmas Eve. The room amenities was the best I've ever seen in small properties. Will definitely recommend a stay here if you want to be close to Tokyo station.

Really exexcellent and convenient hotelOnly downside was got a smoking room when I booked a non smokingbut really we couldn't detect any differencewill stay again probably will recommend it to friends

Spent 8 nights in this wonderful hotel. Others have mentioned about the wonderful location with a bus stop bound for Narita airport, which may only be 20 steps from the entrance of the hotel. I will talk a bit about the wonderful service of the hotel, not only did they book several restaurants for us, they also helped me to confirm with restaurant which I booked it myself! I was shopping at Shibuya and the store provided delivery service of my purchased items to the hotel, was worried that they might not accept the delivery as what I bought included a big suitcase with a lot of other stuff. Hotel staff happily told me they would accept my delivery and delivered it to my room! And the washing machine plus dryer are life savers! Would definitely stay in this hotel again!

We had a nice stay and can't beat the location as it's right outside Tokyo station and right beside a local Metro Stop (Nihonbashi). Excellent sleep quality and ameneties in the bathroom. Staff were very welcoming and very helpful, even helped us secure reservations for restaurants where we wanted to dine. Make sure you rent out the foot massager when you check in. For 500 JPY a night, it really does help soothe tired feet after a whole day of walking the streets of Tokyo.

It was a 3 night stay in Ryemeikan Hotel. The hotel has a terrific location with only 3-5 mins walk from Tokyo station where Daimaru Department store locates. The hotel service is remarkable, and the staffs speak good english with no problem in communication. The room facility is great. They even provide facial cleansing and facial lotion for man. I will definitely stay in this hotel again if available!!

Pros:-close to tokyo station, about 5-10mins walk along the main road-polite staff as always in Japan-easy checkin, clean and spacious rooms for japan standards-nice bathroom with bathtub-free WIFI-many nearby restaurants within 5 mins walk-Nihombashi metro station nearby if needed, or Tokyo station is fine too!-I saw a busstop with buses straight to Narita airport(thought i didnt need it as I went haneda)Cons:-nothing really. maybe if it was slightly cheaper, it will be PERFECT.

Stayed for 3 nights during new year's period in Tokyo. Hotel location, service, facilities are excellent, yet the room is small (which is actually not a defect since it has already beyond the average standard). Will recommend to friends.

This hotel is conveniently located next to Tokyo station. There's a Tokyo shuttle bus stop right outside the hotel so travelling to and from airport will be a breeze. This proves to be a cheaper option since N'EX is 4500 Yen for a return ticket while the shuttle bus is 1000 Yen each way ( 900 Yen each way if you reserve online). If you do take the train from airport, it's still relatively easy to get to the hotel. Look for the Yaesu North Exit. Walk towards the direction of Daimaru -> turn right once you reach Daimaru -> head towards the main road -> cross at the traffic lights -> turn left and walk for about 100m and you will see the hotel (you will walk pass the Tokyo shuttle bus stop).There's a family mart next to the hotel and if you go behind the hotel, there's Lawson, 7-11 and a few eateries for you to choose from.

First off position next to JR Tokyo is brilliant for travellers. The rooms are huge for Tokyo, with Forus A really large, and the Forus C for the 2 kids more than enough even with 2 suitcases and ski gear. Rooms are super modern, clean, and as good as it gets including auto lighting, and music, including vibrating foot of bed for sleep and wake up. Shower is superb, side blast, huge overhead, plus hand. All products supplied are 1st.Class, including mini shaving foam. Pod coffee and a mini fridge that you can put food and bottles in is also so handy ( not a fridge stuffed with auto charge bottles). Reception excellent, terrific people. Highly recommend this Hotel, and is better than photos suggest.

We stayed at this hotel in March 2014. The location was excellent with Tokyo station and Daimaru department store across the road. Ginza district is a 10-15 minute easy walk and the metro stations are nearby. We chose a corner deluxe room so we had no issues with space. The advice here is to make sure that you book a room suitable for you. The hotel has guest laundries on 2 floors and staff were helpful. We loved this hotel because of the location and the fact that the Keisei bus from Narita airport to Tokyo station stopped 2 minutes walk away. There is no shortage of places to eat. We chose to eat a light breakfast at some of the local coffee shops a short walk from the hotel. We would definitely stay at this hotel again.

If I could I would give this hotel 4.5 stars because we had a great stay here. The Forus Rooms we booked for us and our 2 teenagers were very small, but that is really the only reason why I couldn't give it 5 stars. The location, the atmosphere, the cleanliness, amenities, friendliness of staff, food and service were very memorable. The shower was one of the best I've ever had! If we ever go back to Tokyo we would definitely stay here again. Highly recommended!

Its a Hotel which offers convenience, cleanliness and Service at an affordable price. Feeling is New and Contemporary. Staff are courteous. Location is Excellent at 5 Mins walk from Tokyo Station. Book early to avoid disappointment and to get best rates. I will be back for sure.

This hotel is only minutes walk from the Tokyo Station North Yaesu Gate. The hotel is easy to find despite the reception being on the 15th floor. Check-in is efficient and welcoming, with a hot towel at the reception a standard offering. The rooms are very new and although small have good design features. The windows open, the air-con/heater is adequate and the room with windows closed is very quiet despite the bustle of Tokyo outside.The bed and other furnishings are excellent. The bathroom is clean and well appointed. A circular window between the bathroom and the main room is a nice touch and adds light to the bathroom. It also help the room feel bigger.There is a restaurant in the reception level. I did not have the opportunity to eat there but the menu seemed quite nice with good variety.I would definitely recommend the hotel as an excellent stay near Tokyo JR Train station.

People are super friendly, rooms are lovely, with many little nicknacks,very Close to Tokyo Station, but without the noise, very good value, especially if you book 2 weeks ahead.Check in only after 2pm

Stayed there for 5 nights and it was my first time to Tokyo. I am truly glad that I picked this hotel. Before I even arrived, they helped me to arrange my dinner reservation (requested by me) at 2 of the really remarkable Japanese restaurants in Tokyo. They even sent a reminder prior my arrival as well as reminded me verbally when I was checking in. I am really fond of all these small actions and really appreciate it. I would like to thank the staffs who helped me with the dinner reservation. I chose the forus A room and it was really decent for a japanese hotel. I really enjoyed the bed systems as well as the coffee machine. However, the only minus point for the forus room is the lack of bath tub which can be useful after a long day out but it's nothing major at all. The air purifier made readily available in the room is also another big plus. Staffs are helpful and polite all the time, I really enjoyed my stay in hotel Ryumeikan and it will definitely be my choice when I am going to Tokyo next time. Thank you.

Convenient. Tokyo station is just across the road. The airport shuttle also stops just outside the hotel. Room is rather small but nicely done. Staff is attentive and speak good English. Definitely one of the hotels I will stay at.

It was probably my 7th or 8th stay here, I've lost count.Main reasons I always chose this place:1. It's just next to Tokyo Station, convenient for shinkansen (bullet train) riders. Plenty of restaurants, convenient stores and a Takashimaya store nearby.2. Nice clean modern rooms with stylish amenities.3. Very friendly and helpful staff. They can organize pretty much anything for you.My next stay will be Jan 2015!

The hotel has a very good location it's near a lot of the major shopping centers which is only within 15-20 minutes walk. It's also located near the high speed train and also the limo bus going to the airport which is a plus points. The hotel is well priced given the area is surrounded by high end expensive hotels. The room is very small but the shower is excellent and a good size desk space. The bed is very comfortable and the internet is very fast. The only downsized is the in room entertainment is very poor and choice of english channels on the TV is very limited. This hotel is an excellent hotel for business and leisure travellers who are looking for good but affordable hotel. But if you have a big family the rooms will fit no more than 2 people and with 2 people it's already tight. If you need more amenities this hotel will not fit the bill.

My husband and I stayed here for about a week. While it is one of the smallest hotel rooms we've ever stayed in, Hotel Ryumeikan makes up for the size in a big way. Staff is very friendly and, thankfully for us, English speaking. The bed is comfortable and the bathroom is more than adequate. It has the fancy Japanese toilet with heated seat, deodorizer, built-in bidet with two settings. The shower has great water pressure; nice and hot immediately. Provided for you is also a tray of all the bathroom amenities one could ask for including bath salts, sanitizing wipes, and a hair band. In addition, laid out on your bed are two sets of pajamas (which my husband loved) and two beautiful turquoise kimonos with yellow obis (which we both loved). Although the room seemed to have everything you could need, we quickly noticed that there was no ironing board or iron. After breakfast one morning we left a comment card in the suggestion box in the hallway asking for an iron. Much to our happy surprise, the iron and board were waiting in our made-up room when we returned to freshen for dinner. What service! The hotel offers all kinds of extras like this such as nightlights, footbaths, and massagers which will be delivered to you upon request, free of charge. Laundry is also available for a mere 100 yen a load.The location of this hotel is spectacular. It is a short walk to the Ginzu area with lots of shopping and dining and it is basically across the street from Toyko Train station which is very convenient. There are also tons of restaurants to choose from because this busy business district caters to all of the hungry suits that have to take a meal before returning home. You could probably go to a different place to eat each night for a year and still miss a few. It is amazing. Everything is pretty much a short train ride away if you want to go to another district.Hotel Ryumeikan is highly recommended. We would certainly stay here again!

I stayed at the Hotel Ryumeikan Tokyo in October. The hotel has an excellent access to metro and all the trains. Easy access to places. The room is small but there aren't that many big rooms in Tokyo anyway. Excellent bathroom too. I will definitely stay there again.

My wife and I recently went into Tokyo to see an evening performance at the Kabukiza Theater and decided at the last minute to stay overnight rather than fighting our way all the way back home afterwards.We booked a room at the Hotel Ryumeikan, the only non-smoking room left when we called was a corner deluxe twin. We found it to be a good size room for a downtown hotel in Tokyo. Clean, adequate in all respects, a bit expensive but so is everything else in the city.The location at the corner of Soto Bori Dori and Etai Dori is about 1 1/2 blocks north of the Yaseu entrance to Tokyo Station so easy to reach without a taxi even if you have quite a bit of luggage. We did not eat breakfast there and opted instead for a very light breakfast at a coffee shop two doors south of the hotel. From what I could see the dining facilities looked to be good and at 2,500 yen for a Japanese breakfast buffet the price would be reasonable.If you are looking for a far better than average business hotel in the vicinity of Tokyo station I can recommend this hotel highly.

Stay in Ryumeikan for three nights and everything was great but...hopefully the hotel management can consider to improve the room fixtures such as...add on wall hanger at the entrance or inside the bathroom. Thanks

We stayed here for several nights on a recent trip to Tokyo. This hotel is in an excellent location -- close to the subway lines and a major shopping area. It is an easy walk (not wok) to many interesting areas. The service, cleanliness, amenities and design of the hotel are all outstanding. Helpful, efficient staff and spacious rooms are two particular highlights. We will stay here again on our next trip. This is a gem of a hotel that you'd tell your friends about.

This hotel is perfect.We had a room with a view straight down Tokyo station's Central Yaesu street.The hotel is stylish, modern and the staff are fantastic.It has a sense of tradition and history that is lacking amongst the luxury 5 star hotels and hotel chains, yet it has all the luxury features you would hope for.Thank you hotel Ryumeikan - we are so glad to have met you !

Stayed 4 nights at this hotel Mid November.Chose Ryumeikan based on the many positive reviews, and our wish to be close to Tokyo Station area.YES - all the positive reviews are TRUE.Got a room on the 9th floor - even by european standard it was a BIG room - double twin.The standard of the hotel is excellent, nice, clean, wifi, friendly 'english speaking' staff etc.etc.Location unbeatable. Close to Tokyo Station with all the shops and restaurants.5 min. walk from the drop off point for the Airport Shuttle.AND - only 100 m from Nihombashi subway station with several different subwaylines, makes it possible to get in almost all directions within minutes.Highly recommended if Tokyo Station area is your preferred area.

We loved our stay at this hotel. We found the room clean and very comfortable. Our room had a view towards the station as well which was nice. The convenience of the location was fantastic after a long day of walking around the city. Tokyo Station has a lot of shops and restaurants as well as being connected to may train lines.

Amazing hotel. Everything provided in room that could possibly be needed. A short work from the Tokyo rail station. Reception is on 15th floor - take hotel elevator just inside the office building. Felt like a 5 star experience.

I made the reservation after TA research, but I didn't notice the room was a "semi-double": so I was shocked to find a double bed placed near the wall on one side ! however, the "wall side" had several buttons which proved to do interesting things (like a pleasant wake-up including gradual ceiling lighting and gradual intensity music, etc: DO try it, if you're there).Although on the small side (not very expensive), the room had unique features for a European.Among them the blue Kimonos (apart from the bathrobes !) and the exceptional shower toilet chair (again: DO try such toilet seats when in Japan, even in public places !).As one of our Japanese guides said: when in Japan you need to enjoy "the smallness".

This hotel is located right across the street from Tokyo Station within an easy walk from shopping district Ginza. Oddly, the reception is on the 15th floor, above all the rooms, so don't expect a lobby when you walk in. Take the elevator. The rooms are not cheap, but actually not that expensive when compared to other hotels that might not be as centrally located. The room was spacious and the bed wonderful. The room was also clean. Unfortunately, there was only one comfortable chair, which is always awkward when you're a couple in a room. Staff was very helpful and polite. Finally, from all the fancy automated toilet seats we saw in Japan, Hotel Ryumeikan certainly had the fanciest.

We stayed in a junior suite that was just fantastic. A huge room, complete with tea room and balcony. The hotel staff were all very friendly and helpful, assisting us in securing bookings at restaurants.The only downside was some construction noise from the building across the street, and the fact we had 2 large single beds instead of 1 larger one.We'd definitely stay here again on our next trip to Tokyo.

Can't say enough of how much I enjoyed staying in this place, everything was top notch, the room was spotless, not to mention the service, staff even helped me to make dinner reservation in one of the top sushi restaurants before my arrival. Highly recommended.

Had a corner room that is large for Japan & was comfortable. Very near Tokyo station, so many restaurants & good transportation. Loved the toilet that opened for you as you entered the bathroom & was heated. Many amenities in room, like snacks, coffee, & tea restocked everyday. Our room was quiet, very clean ( which is normal for Japan), & they came up to help us with using the air purifier & bring extra pillows quickly & as is true everywhere in Japan, politely. We reserved months ahead of time & got a good deal for Tokyo. In the train station on the lower level, there are many restaurants, including some with American food in case you get tired of Japanese cuisine, though there are also many good Japanese ones within a few square blocks of the hotel. Compared to our hotel rooms in Kyoto & at the airport in Narita, this was the biggest & best.

We stayed there for 2 weeks in a Standard Double room. The room was small but cozy, the way it was designed didn't make it feel cramped. We found it very comfortable. They had a lot of amenity in the room, and everyday they would replace it for you. We stayed on the 14th floor with excellent view. The hotel was very close to the station, and close to ramen street which we frequented. There wasn't alot to do in the immediate area, there is a lot of JR lines that service Tokyo station which made it all very convenient. Close to keisei bus to Narita airport, literally outside (it's opposite the yakinuki place).The staff are very nice, sometimes its hard to communicate as they don't have fluent English. However, they do try their best to help you which makes up for it. Overall, we would come back in the future

We travelled as a family and stayed in this hotel for 3 nights. It's very hard to find a hotel in Tokyo that allows a family of four to stay in the same room. This hotel is no exception as all the rooms are very small and one queen bed already takes up half of the space. But the amenities for each room are amazing including all your necessities. You could see why Japanese are clean, neat, and in order when you stay in this hotel. The staff is very professional and helpful. Check in and check out is a breeze. We didn't know there is a bus directly to the airport and took the subway express. We will try the bus next time.

I stayed for 3 nights at the hotel. Two nights before I left for Kyoto and then my last night before leaving Japan. I also stayed in another hotel for my first 2 nights but I preferred this hotel. Make your reservation ahead of time to get the discount. It's also worth it stay pay a little more and stay in the FORUS A room. The hotel is located across the street from Tokyo Station. I took the train from the airport. They had a special (about half price) to Tokyo (not offered the other way). I decided to take the bus back to the airport. It was cheaper and super convenient (the bus stop is right outside of the hotel). They helped me make a reservation and secure my seat. The transportation (all types are reliable and frequent). They staff is fantastic. They are very helpful in helping you with your excursions (they provided maps and provided and instructions on how to get there). I did not get the breakfast but there was a Starbucks down the street. There are also tons of places to eat nearby and/or bring home with you. There is a fridge in the room which was very convenient. I will DEFINITELY stay here during my next time in Japan.

As others have mentioned, this hotel is close to the Tokyo train station, the Ginza line, and is generally very accessible. However, it is not a very suitable place fr tourists as there isn't much around locally and the views from the room are negligible. It's more business oriented. Our room was TINY, in fact, the tiniest hotel room we've ever stayed in in the world (including New York). Our window had a nice view of a the wall of the adjacent building. You literally open your blind and see a wall - nothing else. There's construction work taking place across the road.The good things were definitely the excellent customer service upon check-in/out. Staff were notably warm, welcoming and went out of their way to be helpful and kind. The shower was amazing, as were the Shiseido beauty products provided. We got complementary bottled water and there was a coffee machine in the room which we appreciated. Also appreciated were the English TV channels. To be honest though, we would probably choose somewhere else next time. The extremely small room size and a view of a wall were massive turn-offs.

Our floor had a room with vending machines that also had a washer and a dryer. The washer was 200 yen, detergent included, and the dryer was 200 yen for an hour. Our room was large, compared to other hotels in Japan; the bathroom area is also large, with separate rooms for (1) toilet, (2) shower and tub, and (3) vanity sink with mirror. The hotel is easy to find from Tokyo Station. Everything seemed new and clean. The TV has BBC and CNN in English. The LAN internet worked very well, with no connection problems. The staff spoke English, and were friendly and helpful. On the day we checked out, we left our luggage until 6 p.m. at no charge. There is a Family Mart right next door, for drinks and snacks. I rarely rate hotels "Excellent" but could find no fault with the Ryumeikan.

This was a very good hotel with a great location near Tokyo Station and the Ginza. Its location also makes it convenient to all public transportation and makes it very convenient to get around the city. It is also only steps away from the Tokyo Shuttle stop from Narita. The rooms were clean and roomy, by Tokyo standards. We would definitely recommend this hotel.One of us also loved the Toto toilet!

I stayed at Ryumeikan for a week while on business in Tokyo. As mentioned by other reviewers, the location is excellent, a stone's throw from Tokyo station and the business district of Marunouchi.The hotel itself is clean and modern. The room I had was normally sized by Tokyo standards (ie. small) but intelligently designed so it didn't feel too cramped. It didn't have a view though - the window was right on the wall of the neighbouring building, 2m away. That won't be a problem if you are outside during the day...I stayed in a handful of other hotels in Tokyo and Japan, and can definitely rate the Ryumeikan above average.

Across the street from Tokyo train station is a big plus. Our room was not large but the modern hi-tech facilities more than made up for the room size. My wife and I wanted to take the shower an toilet home with us. Staff went out of their way to help us. The hotel breakfast for 5 dollars was a real bargain. Rail, subway and buses were all very close. There is a bus stop to Narita airport only a half a block from the front door and the price is only 10 dollars. We will certainly stay at this hotel when return to Tokyo.

We recently stayed at this hotel for our base in Tokyo and were impressed. Already familiar with the glowing reviews on TripAdvisor that helped us choose our accommodation, the hotel went beyond and exceeded our expectations! We stayed in a Double Room and it was very comfortable for the three of us (me, hubby and our 3 year old son) with lots of natural sunlight. It is a three minute walk from Tokyo Station, there is a Familymart convenience store right next door and lots of affordable restaurants nearby. We encountered Typhoon Phanfone during our stay there and the train to Disneyland wasn’t working and all the buses had gone for the day. This was a problem because we had pre bought fixed day tickets. The staff at Hotel Ryumeikan called up Disneyland for us to confirm whether they were open and we ended up taking a taxi to Disneyland, which was not very crowded due to the trains being closed so the longest we had to wait for the rides was 15 minutes. We are very grateful to Hotel Ryumeikan for their help with this! Lots of other nice touches – we returned back to the hotel for our last night in Japan and found they had kept the drink and food we left in the room because we couldn’t pack it with us, and they had refridgerated the goods so they were nice and cold! This was beyond our expectations. It was our 4th wedding anniversary and they provided a small bottle of complimentary champagne, which was very nice as having a 3 year old, it’s hard to celebrate or be romantic anymore. They helped us book a transfer back to the airport. After the first night, housekeeping were perceptive enough to pick up that there were three of us so amenities were provided for three rather than two and my little one was very pleased with his slippers with a picture of a whale on them, complimentary of the hotel! Their toilets are spectacular and hubby is looking to remodel our bathroom after the Japanese design. We will definitely be coming back to Hotel Ryumeikan as our base for Tokyo and will be recommending this hotel to all our friends!

the staff couldn't have been nicer or more efficient. the location was great, we used the bus located in front of the hotel to go to the airport, so you don't have to drag you suitcases to the train station only 900 yen

The hotel is an easy walk from the Tokyo train station, a metro stop is just around the corner and there are great neighborhood restaurant and shopping options within easy walking distance. The staff were very helpful and friendly, we will definitely return to this hotel on our next visit to Tokyo!

I love everything about this hotel! The location, the service superb! Hotel room is very clean and romantic! Was there for a couple of nights for my honeymoon and it was the best hotel that we stayed in during our stay in Tokyo. Will def go back!!

Hotel is just right opposite to Tokyo 八重洲北口 station. You won't miss it! Hotel staffs are well train with polite and gentle manner! They will try their best to fulfill your needs. If you have a lot of suitcases, no worries cause airport shuttle bus just 100 meters away from hotel. Rooms are spacious and with all details inside your room. Super value for money! No doubt to spend your time with this hotel! It is spotless!

We stayed two nights at this comfortable and well located hotel. If being close to Tokyo Station is important, this hotel is for you. The station is only a short walk away. There's also a taxi rank located not too far away so you can make it to the Tsukiji Fish Market fish markets bright and early!The room was comfortable and spacious enough for the two of us. It was easily the best hotel we stayed at during the trip.The room was well equipped. It even had a Nespresso Coffee machine and free water.

Close to train station. Staff were extremely nice and helpful. Great restaurant within property. Incredible view of night lights. Rooms were very clean and modern. Imperial Palace close enough to walk to.

We go to Tokyo a lot, and used to stay here every time when we wanted good access to Tokyo station. The location is excellent, rooms are nice and we always appreciated the little welcome packets you get with tokyo map etc. Service was always professional and good as well. However, the last trip i was dissapointed with the service of the front desk. I was waiting in the lobby in the evening, where they have some free tea to try, and noticed the watercooler was empty. I asked the front desk if i could make some tea, and staff seemed reluctant to help. Eventually a guy showed up to replace the water and i thanked him nicely since it seemed heavy but he just looked at me blankly and left. So it felt like this was a great nuisance to him, and that was unpleasant. Not a big deal maybe but since there are so many nice hotels in the area there´s no need to stay at one where some staff don´t care to make an effort.

Previously stated that Hotel Ryumeikan Tokyo was my favorite and what I consider the best hotel of hundreds I've stayed at throughout the world based on location, price, comfort, and quietness. Recently stayed nine nights and my opinion of the hotel is still the same. Great location within a short walk from Tokyo Station, the Tokyo Metro, and excellent museums, restaurants, and department stores. Great comfort in a perfect room for a single traveler, with a great bathroom and all room light switches within reach from the very comfortable bed. Very quiet despite building construction going on continuously around the hotel. This is a great, great hotel!

I would highly recommend this hotel for its location, service and amenities. I will definetely stay there again. I stayed in both the double corner room with a firend and then later in trip i was alone and stayed in the single Forus room. Both were a great experience. The restaurant has very delicious food too! The service was perfect. I dont have one complaint except that I couldnt stay longer.

The hotel is in a great location, steps from Tokyo Station.However, our room was really tiny and we had a view of a concrete wall, about 1m away from our window.Check-in was painless and polite, the room was well equipped and the WiFi pretty fast. Definitely did the job for one night before flying home, but would have been disappointed if our whole visit to Tokyo had been spent here. I've posted a review of another hotel in the city on TripAdvisor, which for a very similar cost is way better.

We booked our reservation about 8 months in advance from Booking.com and got a 40% discount. In addition, the yen/$ exchange rate was more favorable that I anticipated. The Hotel is a 5 minute walk from the Yaesu North exit of Tokyo Station (you can also use the Yaesu Central or Nihonbashi exits as well). The Hotel is very clean and a perfect location to explore Tokyo from. The Tokyo Metro is very close to the hotel so most everything in Tokyo is about 30 minutes away. We ended up using the Ginza Line station (exit A3) on Etai dori most of the time.The staff of the Hotel is very nice and helpful. We expected a small room so it did not bother us that much. The bathroom was excellent with great water pressure and amenities. We loved out time at this hotel and recommend it a lot.

The location is so convinient and staffs are quite helpful. Will definitely come again.Breakfast in the hotel is a good choice to try the Japanese food. Stay in a single room and it was quite and comfortable.

The hotel has an excellent location (situated near Nihombashi and Tokyo stations). Basically with the subway and JR, famous attractions such as Disney, tsukiji or asakusa are all less than 30 minutes away from the Hotel.I stayed at the double room and it was spacious, clean and well-equipped with all necessary amenities. The front-desk staff was very helpful for making ticket reservations for our return bus trip to the airport. Since we've been out all day, so we saw no need to clean up the room every day. The hotel was thoughtful enough to leave a message at our room door, offering to empty our trash or give us new towels even if we did not ask for room cleaning. Given the above, it was rather a bargain for our stay at the Hotel since we've booked way in advance and could enjoy the early bird discount. Overall speaking, it was a truly enjoyable experience.

Excellent location...quiet comfortable room..helpful staff.Good value when booked ahead for 30% discountEasy access for first time visitor as across the street in walking distance from main reason station...non-stop on Narita express.

We went the last week for a few days, and the hotel have a crear location, wonderful views, good rooms and a very helpfull employees. We are so happy with the sevice that we will repeat the next week!

Directly across the street from Tokyo Station, one of the most convenient stations of all for both getting around the city and to/from the airport. Beds are comfortable, rooms are large, and the entire hotel is immaculately clean. Many great restaurants in the neighborhood. This hotel helped to make our first trip to Japan better than we could have expected. We would definitely stay again.

I was traveling in a group of three adults, and it's usually quite tricky to find accommodation. This hotel has a triple room (three separate beds) for this purpose. The room was very spacious for Japan. The amenities were fantastic - they provided Shiseido toiletries and a choice of four Nespresso capsules for each person every day, and a lovely sleep shirt and yukata for lounging around int he room. Everything was spic and span, and despite being right in the center of town the room had absolute silence, making for very restful sleep. The front desk spoke excellent English and were very accommodating and kind. The food at the in-house restaurant was lovely, but there are almost no western options so if you are someone who needs toast and eggs for breakfast, I advise you to walk to nearby Tokyo station. The location can't be beat - the Keisei bus from Narita drops you off literally half a block away from the hotel (1,000 Yen each way), and both the subway and the JR train stations are very, very close by. The hotel is within walking distance to the Imperial Gardens, and right across the street from a Daimaru department store.When I made my reservation I mistakenly booked only three nights, rather than the four I needed. When I called the front desk to extend my reservation, they were very accommodating about the extension, sent me a very detailed English email in confirmation, and even extended the original discount I had from booking to the 4th night, which I had neither expected nor asked for, so I was very, very happy about that.I will be sure to book this hotel on any return trips to Tokyo.

After a 14 hour flight, getting this hotel right next to the main Tokyo station was a great decision. Everybody there spoke great English. The room was cozy, but very nice. It had the in-room amenities, that I normally don't get for below $400/night. The one reason that I can't give this place a 5 out 5 rating is the view from the room. It was disappointing, ie a wall.Overall this was a great place!

This hotel is very close to JR Tokyo Station, subway station, and Hato- bus station (Tokyo's most famous tour bus company). The room has free wifi and complementary bottles of water. To my surprise, the room had a Nepresso machine with varieties of free espresso pods. There are numerous restaurants, cafés, convenient stores right downstairs. Daimaru department store is across the street. I recommend this hotel to someone who comes to Tokyo for the first time.
user_name:
Yoshi_KIX
New York City, New York

review_body: Went with my sister- we had a great time! Friendly staff and extremely clean! Modern amenities and plenty of space! Super comfy beds! Big shower and a American style toilet! They have umbrellas for you to borrow at no cost and free post cards to send home! Elevator moves fast and great great location! A few minute walk from station! They have American style robes and traditional Japanese robes! We enjoyed ourselves! As in trip of a lifetime! Hope to go back again soon!

Hotel Ryumeikan is in a great location for exploring the city since it is right outside Tokyo Station. Great wifi everywhere. Coffee, tea and toiletries in rooms he room was very nice. It included a fancy Japanese toilet with heated seat and sprayers. Staff was extremely polite and helpful. The English of the staff was fine.

I join TripAdvisor reviewers with high positive impression on Hotel Ryumeikan Tokyo (Tokyo Station). The hotel's location is perfect, clean rooms and the size is considered "BIG" for Tokyo standard. Staffs are very helpful and courteous. Honestly, I cannot say any thing negative but rather to say the least I'm very satisfied with my stay in the hotel which makes my trip, together with my wife and son to Tokyo, very pleasant and enjoyable.

This was a great hotel. I highly recommend this hotel if it is your first trip to Japan. It is very attentive to foreign travelers. For example, there is a pamphlet that explains how to wear the Yukata and slippers and all kinds of other helpful advice I wish I had known earlier in our trip. The check in is on the 15th floor. The staff was super attentive and all we dealt with could speak English. They had excellent maps of the city and were helpful to tell us how to get to the subway station and other parts of Tokyo. Grab the foldout map of Tokyo they provide, there are good and easy Japanese words to help you on your trip. The room we had was very spacious even with three people. We had several hours of relaxing in the hotel before our flight and it was very comfortable. There was a nespresso maker with many choices of coffee pods. The amenities were nice products. This was my favorite hotel to stay in out of the 4 hotels we stayed while in Japan. I will definitely stay there again.

I have stayed in this hotel before, and returned back last month July for 3 nights.It had construction around, not a pretty sight, but very quiet inside the room. I reserved the corner twin room, plenty of room and there are laundry machines oncertain floors, which is very convenience and money saver compare to dry cleaning.Price is still very reasonable, and walking distance to Imperial Palace, Ginza, Fish market,Ninhonbashi. One more nice point to bring up is when you ready to go to airport, justget down to ground floor, on the left side is a bus stop, cost 900 Yen to Narita. Nothing can beat that.

I stayed there cause of the location just across the Tokyo Station, few steps from Shinkansen and other trains to take you around Japan. Located in the highest floors of a skyscraper offers great views, a bit tiny, yet still comfortable rooms equipped with all you need - including a handy torch attached to the bed in case of an earth quake that turns on automatically. As usual in Japan, a great, convenient bathroom. Very good place to stay - also to visit the Royal Palace in Tokyo, shopping in the nearby trendy districts

They have their own soap champoo etc brand 'Triple C' which is perfect. I would like to be there again. The rooms are very nice and comfortsble. The hotel is situated at the heart of Tokyo. Close to the train station, Ginza fistrict and the Imperisl palace.

Room is small, but not unusual for Japan. This is basically a business hotel.  The amenities were excellent the hotel really thought of everything you might need. Staff can speak enough English to answer basic questions. My only complaints are the the bed and pillows. The bed was hard and the pillows didnt give enough support. In my opinion a hotel should offer 2 pillows per guest. This is a personal preference others might like the harder bed.  The hotel is across from Tokyo Station and very near shuttle bus service to Haneda and Narita airports. There are 2 large department stores Daimaru and Takashimaya for shopping.

I stayed there for one night before i leave to Chiba it close to Tokyo station Which is why i chose it very convenient a lot of restaurants close by coin laundry is good in every floor But the reception and lobby in 15 floor which was confusing it excellent if you are in Tokyo for business room are acceptable size but you can fit one big bag and hand bag other wise it will become too cramped

This is my second stay at Hotel Ryumeikan and I am thoroughly pleased by the thoughtfulness of the hotel staff. The hotel is very clean and very maintained. Will be back on my next trip in November!!!

I stayed here with my parents in September, 2013. Our room was comfortable, quiet and peaceful. The hotel location couldn't be beat, right across the street from Tokyo Station and just a few minutes walk to the historic Nihonbashi bridge. The people who worked there were great. Super helpful. Loved everything about it.

I had very high expectations of this hotel considering the the recent awards this hotel had received, however i was not entirely satisfied. I was staying there for 6 nights and i found the room was too small for comfort. Whilst i understand the small rooms in Japan, only being able to get out of bed one way was getting a little hard and found me constantly crawling over my significant other. I was also disappointed that their was no western buffet option which made it a bit hard and had us having to go out in search of food every morning. On the flip side the staff were very friendly and location very centralized.

Best Tokyo hotel we have stayed at. Stayed 3 nights and loved it. The rooms are very well appointed. Super clean and quiet. Rooms are small which is typical of Tokyo. Good service and conveniently located to Tokyo Station. If you like ramen explore Ramen Street underneath Tokyo Station.

it was really pleasant living here and the service was really good as well, people were super helpful. Ordering a taxi would not have been possible if not for the helpful gentleman at the desk. The rooms were spacious and nice, everything was super clean. It was just all really nice.

I am using it as a business hotel and is evaluating it from a business hotel prospective instead of a vacation hotel. It is a luxury business hotel. just across the road from Tokyo Station Yaesu North Exit. Airport bus stops from both Narita and Haneda are within walking distance (manageable distance for those with big luggage). The hotel smells lovely with traditional incense burning at their first floor lift lobby, Room are big enough for me to spread my luggage on the carpeted floor. Toiletries & Amenities are more than sufficient. They also provide lovely bath salt! The hotel lobby is also tastefully decorated with some interesting books on Japan (in English) and there are free water and tea for you to pass time while waiting to meet up with friends. There is a convenience store right next door and plenty of restaurants, izakayas, fast foods and shops within walking distance in the Yaesu area, not to forget the maze-like underground shopping/restaurant areas in Tokyo station. It is also within walking distance from Kyoto and Hokkaido specialty stores (stores selling products from that prefecture) so you can get things from Kyoto and Hokkaido without actually going there (Unfortunately for fans of Rokkatei, the Hokkaido specially store don't normally carry Rokkatei stuffs).I was also able to walk to Ginza from the hotel without over-exhausting myself. So location is really really good!Wifi should be free, ask for the password at the counter.

Central location (near Tokyo Station) for a short stay (3 days) in Tokyo! The front desk was very useful with direction and maps. They also watched our luggage while we went shopping on check-out day. Thank you!

We stayed here for a couple of nights during our first visit in Tokyo. It's been an excellent choice indeed. First, The hotel is very close to Tokyo Station (hence, if you come from the Airport or if you arrive by train, this is very comfortable). Second, the rooms, although very small (but hey, it's Tokyo!), are modern if not new. Third, the staff at the reception is very helpful, their English is quite good, and the views from our room or the lobby on the top floor were excellent. And finally, since centrally located (two subway lines around the corner), the hotel is a great base to explore the different neighborhoods of this amazing city. The only downside: The hotel restaurant offers Japanese breakfast only. However, there is a Starbucks nearby (which helped us out in this respect). In any case, we'll probably return soon!

For the price the hotel was unbeatable. Close location to Central Tokyo Station and very classy looking lobby on the top floor. Less than a minute to subway. Room was immaculate. Slightly on the small side, but that was to be expected. Plenty of in-room amenities, overall great experience.

LOCATION----------------5-10 minute walk from two different subway lines that we used during our 7-day trip (Nihonbashi station and Tokyo station).15 minute walk to the Imperial Palace Gardens (west).30 minute walk to Hamarikyu Gardens to the (south. takes longer if you get slightly tired/lost like we did).HOTEL & ROOM----------------------We got the FORUS-C "Create" (http://www.ryumeikan-tokyo.jp/english/guestroom02_07.html). There was no view - just building walls. The room was otherwise extremely comfortable for our stay. The shower was particularly spectacular, with very nice hair and body care products. Came with a wide array of facial products and toiletries. Room also came with extremely comfortable and easy-to-clean slippers that they encourage you to take with you.One-time pay-to-watch system with a decent variety of movies and "couples movies". Vending machines on each floor and detergent-inclusive laundry/drier machines on a few select floors (at a reasonable price).Restaurant on the lobby floor, but they were booked for two days ahead. Plenty of casual eats at the Tokyo Station shopping area, however, and more on the street behind Ryumeikan.The beds were extremely comfortable as well. And the extra sofa-area was nice for meals. One note would be that you can't really see the TV from the sofa without moving the sofa, which we did not try. We also did not try moving the TV, which from the site's layout, looks like could have been a possibility.They also have interesting literature ranging from modern architecture to modern furniture. You can also buy the yukata, robe, hair products and other goods directly through the hotel.CONCLUSION-------------------Very relaxing stay and friendly staff, would highly recommend for young traveling couples.
user_name:
Sophie C
New York City, New York

review_body: Ideal location beside TOkyo Station. Smart room lay-out for the size, clean, thoughtful amenities. The FORUS bed lulls you to sleep with sound and vibration and wakes you up gently in the mornings. Reception is sincerely helpful. Highly recommendable in spite of having no outside view from the room.

Pros:-The Ryumeikan is close to both Tokyo train Station and a couple of subway stations, very convenient location-Excellent shower and bathroom-Clean and pleasant impression overall -Friendly staffCons:-Smallish room and bed, almost no pegs to hang towels and/or clothes and no view whatsoever

Room is small but well equipped and clean. Hotel staff is very friendly and helpful. The hotel is near to tokyo station about 5 minutes work from hotel. A lot of restaurant & bar surrounding the hotel.

I'm a regular visitor to Tokyo, mostly for business. Last weekend my regular business hotel was full, and the one I use as a backup was full too. I looked around a bit and saw that the Ryumeikan had consistently high reviews on Tripadvisor,Great place. Rooms are spotless and room size well above average for Tokyo. Decent English spoken at the Reception (on the 15th floor!), and a 3-minute walk to Tokyo station, which is the core of Public transportation in Tokyo, both local, Airport and long-distance bullet trains (Shinkansen).Lots of wine and dine places in the streets around the hotel, and great internet speed (free). Only hiccupt for foreigners might be that brakfast is japanese style only (Fish, rice, vegetables) with just some croissants, jam and coffee. Plenty of places around the hotel to have a western-style breakfast, though.There's a convenience store next door, and an English Pub adjacent to the hotel entrance too.Views from the rooms are urban grey, but a nicer view (Shangri-La hotel is accross the street) will easily cost you x2 to x3 more.All in all, highly recommended. You cannot go wrong with this place.

We had a good stay at Hotel Ryumeikan Tokyo. We love this hotel very much.We booked a Japanese suite at this hotel, everything is fine except for the the sound. I can hear the footsteps from next door.

Spent our last night in this hotel in Tokyo before flying out. As many have mentioned, close to Tokyo central station (i.e easy train ride to Narita or Haneda). Also a subway station just right outside the hotel, which makes it convenient to catch other subway lines and visit scenic spots even it's located in a business area. Hotel staff was very helpful when we asked for restaurant recommendation. Not sure what she did or say, but the Kobe beef restaurant they recommended somehow didn't charge us for our wine that evening! We couldn't hear very well what the waiter had to say about our booking through the hotel, but in any case, thank you! We would recommend this hotel as it also offers very good value. I originally thought we would get a capsule plus size room for the price we paid, but it was a pleasant surprise it was more spacious with very good amenities (rain shower, expresso maker!)
user_name:
AHA2006
New York City, New York

review_body: Considerably cheaper than similar establishments, this is a great quality hotel at an excellent location (next to Tokyo station). The staff are eager to help, and are very accommodating. Nice and comfortable room, and great bathroom supplies (not just shaving cream and razor, but after shave lotion and night creams as well!). Free wifi. This will be my top choice for future visits to Tokyo.

Can't fault this hotels location. Short walk to central Tokyo station We had the hotels only suite and it was really nice with a separate lounge which is very handy if you have jet lag and don't want to disturb your partner with your middle of the night wonderings. Also a nice view of the Ginza strip.Little grocery store right next door with lots of sandwiches etc if you don't feel like a heavy meal.Good value especially if you book ahead on their website. Much cheaper than the surrounding central Tokyo hotels.

This is my 4th time staying here. The price for Tokyo is very good. The Hotel is conveniently located just outside the Tokyo train station. It is an easy walk to trains and subways. The room is spacious and the beds are comfortable. The staff is extremely helpful. I left my alarm clock and they sent it back to me and only charged a modest cost for the shipping. Whenever I have emailed about arrangements I have received a prompt and helpful reply. I will stay there next time I am in Tokyo.

We stayed at this hotel for 2 nights at the end of a 12day trip to japan, and it was just perfect. We stayed in a forus c type room which was fabulous. This hotel has all the mod cons, and some great extra touches like a nespresso coffee machine in our room, being coffee lovers this was great. The super comfy bed literally vibrates you to sleep. And the shower has 3 different massaging shower heads. The only minor downfall was our window view was straight into the concrete wall of the next building, would of been nice to have a nice view of the city. The location is also perfect, you can see the hotel as soon as you exit the Tokyo station, so it's a perfect base to travel anywhere you want to go in Tokyo and japan. We found this to be much convenient than shinjuku where we stayed previously. Will definitely stay at this hotel next time in Tokyo

We stayed in the junior suite B (the A suite is a smoking room). We are a family of 5. 2 adults and 3 kids aged 10,8 and 5. They let us all stay in the suite which is for 4 normally as the 3rd child was only 5 so went free. I think this changes at aged 6. Anyway after hours internet searching many other hotels in Tokyo there was no other hotel that did this and I paid the same for the suite that other hotels were charging for one room with max 2-3 occupants. The hotel was in an ideal location. We flew into Narita and got the train to the main station. Short walk to hotel with clear directions. We travelled around mostly using the underground trains. Station round the corner from hotel. We went to imperial palace and did open top bus tour. All walking distance from hotel. The room was very clean and comfortable. With kimonos for us all to wear which was good fun and a pair wooden slippers for the little outside deck which was a nice place to have breakfast. They gave us a little welcome pack for the 5 year old with tiny slippers and toothbrush in which was a nice touch. In the reception on the 15th floor with great views the kids loved making us adults pots of tea which you weighed out the tea on little scales. The staff were lovely and helpful. Their English wasn't always great but with patience and cultural understanding on a guests part, you couldn't fail to get good service as they were very thorough in helping us with all our sightseeing requests. We didn't eat there so can't comment on that. It was a great base for us and we had a great time. Next time we go to Japan we will definitely stay there again.

Located in a very convenient, central part of the city, providing easy access to all the highlights of Tokyo. The hotel was extremely clean and well maintained, and all the staff very helpful and courteous. Highly recomended!

Stayed 5 nights at the hotel during holiday. Location was fantastic...walking distance to Tokyo station, imperial palace and you can catch a direct bus right in front of the hotel, which is very convenient. Family mart is also just a stone throw away.The hotel service is excellent. Although there are only about 2 - 3 staff at the receptionist (no concierge), they are all very helpful and speak good English. They helped me to book restaurants and the tickets for the bus transfer to airport.The hotel provides all the essential amenities and more, such as kimono. It also has laundry machine and vending machine for drinks, which can be very handy.Room though is a bit small.

We stayed in this hotel for four nights while seeing the sights in and around Tokyo. We booked a basic room which was a great value for the Tokyo Station area. Our only compliants were the minuscule size of the room which barely accommodated 2 average large Americans and the fact that the room lacked a closet or any type of drawers which made it necessary to live out of our suitcases, not an easy task given the size of the room. I may have had a smaller room once in a hotel on the Left Bank in Paris many years ago but I really think this one was smaller. Otherwise, what the other reviews say about the positives of this hotel are pretty much reflected in our experience. A 10 minute walk from Tokyo Station where you can get the JR Rail circle line around the city to connect to any subway line in the city (buy tickets based on the fare to your destination at the automated ticket machines which have a large map in English and Japanese above the machines), a bullet train, or the express train ( reserved seating train or unreserved seating train, but tickets at the JR Rail office in the station) to Narita. There is also an express bus to Narita right in front of the hotel ( buy tickets in the Family Mart store). The streets across from the station and adjacent to the hotel are full of cafes,, a Starbucks, bars, and Karaoke places. It was bustling after work and during the dinner hour. On the other side of Tokyo Station (Marunouchi side) you can see the architecture of this beautiful but mammoth brick building and there are several upscale shopping malls with great places to dine. the hotel room was spotless, had a firm but comfortable bed, a high tech bathroom, slippers, robes, all the nice little touches. The front desk staff mostly were partially English speaking and were wonderful in helping us make dinner reservations, book a tour to Mt Fuji, get a cab at 3am to the tuna auction, or recommend places to visit. We used the coin laundry which was handy. Did not eat in the hotel restaurant on the top floor but there is an English pub on the first floor which was a nice happy hour place. I woul certainly stay here again but I would request a larger room for more than an overnight stay.

We stayed at Hotel Ryumeikan for the last night of our honeymoon through Japan during cherry blossom season.Staff were incredibly helpful and friendly with directions and suggestions.The room was clean and comfortable, although small and with no view, but as it was for one night we didn't mind. As mentioned by many other reviewers, the hotel is incredibly close to public transport and all the main tourist areas. If I was ever to stay again in Tokyo for a short period of time, I would happily stay here.

I stayed here for my first night ever in Japan. The location was fantastic, right near Tokyo Central Station. The staff was very helpful and friendly. I speak only English, and that did not get in the way. The room itself was also extremely clean and in fantastic working order. Even the bathroom mirror seemed to have a de-fog section where after a shower I could see my face in it.The room was also well sound insulated, and had a great view at the same time.

This hotel is just across the road from Tokyo Station and is extremely good value for money. My room was smallish (normal for Japan) but very clean and had everything you would expect including free WiFi. The staff were very helpful.

It is most convenient as it is just across the road from the Shinkansen Tokyo Station, and just beside the Metro subway (via A3 exit by stairs or A7 exit by escalator). Better still, you can hop onto a Narita-bound express bus just below the hotel.

I decided to splurge my first night in Tokyo and have absolutely no regrets! (That being said, the price I paid was very decent.) I was very pleased with this business class hotel. The room was full of unexpected things - fluffy slippers (not those cheap cotton ones that are more common), two bottles of water, an ipod auxiliary plug in with speakers, and a kimono to lounge in. My room was spacious with a large entry way, and enough room to repack my suitcase. Loved the large shower too! Helpful staff. Plus location is great - across from Tokyo station, and an airport bus stop. Highly recommended.

Excellent hotel in a great location. The bed was comfy, and the walk-in shower was great. My only disappointment was to have a room with no view (walls of other buildings), which was a shame for a eight-day stay. Nevertheless, I will definitely stay there again.

Before travelling to Tokyo, I search through trip advisor database to find the most suitable hotel for my family trip. I choose this hotel after reading most of the good review. And what did I find there ? It didn't disappoint one bit...I have to say that the reviewer know what they're talking about. We stay at japanese suite B with a tatami room and a garden balcony. Spacious room, good bathroom with all the amenities, nespresso machine, it is so complete include a free minibar. The staff at the reception speaks English and always ready with a map to point you to your needs. The hotel is near Tokyo Station, Daimaru, Takashimaya and a limousine keisei bus stop very near it so accessibility is also very good. I must also mention the house keeping because every time we get back from our sightseeing our room is like new again. Good job Ryumeikan. Keep it up.

Easy to find. Staff are friendly and speak English easily to understand and provided a welcome gift. Good location right next to Tokyo station. Location is why we chose for our stay .... And we arrived at 2200. The staff had no issues with this. Only activities close by are the famed fish market and many eateries. No issues with out stay.

We stayed for one night after a flight from the UK and loved it. It had all we could have wanted, with a lot of small extra touches, and the service was excellent. We didn't get a chance to eat in the restaurant but the food looked good.The beds were very firm which we loved, and you could ask from a selection of pillows (we just used the usual bean/rice type ones which were great).The location was handy, althought the train station is a bit of a nightmare to get your head (and yourself) around.

We could not have been happier with our experience with the Hotel Ryumeikan. The staff was super nice, the rooms were immaculate and high tech, and the location was perfect!! My daughter especially liked the humane waking system in the bed and the very complicated toilets. It happened to be my daughter's birthday while we were there. We did not inform the hotel, but they must have noticed when they took photocopies of our passports. They left a very nice message and a bag of candies for her on the day of her birthday. They also had a lovely and well-stocked tea lounge on the 15th floor, which we would have been happy to use if we had stayed a little longer.We will certainly stay there again if we return to Tokyo.

I have nothing bad to say about this place. The best parts of the stay: pillow and breakfast! Absolutely superb. Friendly and helpful staffs. Location is very strategic. Ginza line metro just next block.

I stayed in this hotel for a total of 5 nights in April-2014.
