They got a promotion in their English website which provides quite a substantial discount for booking the room earlier.The Room which i stayed in the Forus A (20m2) is fairly big compared to most Business Hotels.The unique points that i found about this room are- The Bed got vibration function (Their Sleep system, very interesting)- The Shower is the rain system (I don't miss the bathtub)- Nespresso Machine with 4x capsules everyday inside the roomThis hotel is also located extremely close (A few mins walk) from the Tokyo Station which makes it very convenient to explore the whole of Tokyo and other parts of Japan by Shinkansen.However, There are no view of the city through the windows of the room (That is fine for me because city view rooms are relatively expensive in Tokyo)I would stay in this Hotel for my next visit in Tokyo.

I booked directly with the hotel 8 months prior, and email communications in English were quick and helpful. When I wanted to add an extra night later on because my plans had changed, that was no problem. I arrived at the hotel at 9pm somewhat out of sorts due to difficulties in getting from Haneda to Tokyo, so the moist hand-towel provided at check-in and the friendly welcome from the reception staff were much appreciated! My double room was spacious, well-appointed, comfortable and quiet. It had a "pod" coffee-maker and large flatscreen TV. There was a bit of a city view somewhat obstructed by other buildings (I was on a middle-level floor). The hotel elevator has transparent walls on the street side so you get a nice view travelling up and down in it. A security feature is that the guest room floors are only accessible using your room keycard. The location is great, only about a block and across the road from the Yaesu North exit of Tokyo Station (not sure why other reviewers have mentioned two or three blocks, unless they're counting walking within the station, a huge place of course) and within walking distance of Ginza and other places worth exploring near the station. There's a range of restaurants and cafes nearby (as well as at the station) and a 24 hour convenience store a few minutes away. I thought the cost of the room (3 nights) was great value considering the quality, service from the staff and location. Would definitely stay again!

This is the first hotel in Japan that we checked in and by the end of our trip, my husband and i still talked about how wonderful this hotel is compared to other hotels that we stayed. First the location is close to jr tokyo station (jr line trains, shinkansen and narita express) and metro nihombashi station ( to asakusa, ueno station) Lots of restaurants and other convenience stores just few steps from the hotels. The room has everything you need, from the snacks, tea, coffee and they even has nespresso machine inside the room. My husband loved the nespresso machine so much.The check in and out process was fast. They even let us to check into our room early (11 am). The receptionist speak good english and they also helped us with the baggage delivery service to our next hotel at shinjuku. She even called the hotel to confirm our reservation and also making sure that our luggage will be there by the next morning.We used one of the computer and printer facilities there by paying 100 yen for every 10 minutes. Unfortunately the printer gotroblem in printing our documents and it took more than 10 minutes to be fixed so i need to put another 100 yen coin to make the computer kept running. The receptionist helped us to print out in their office since it cant be fixed and what surprised me was that they even returned us 100 yen and said that it was their fault. Thank you so much ryumeikan hotel for the great service. We will definitely recommend this hotel to others and we will come back again.

( I swear that this is based on my true experiment and I've stay there for about 4 days at Tokyo )Tokyo, a big big city. Also, the capital of Japan. Every thing is Green. Even a greenhouse. But, there are one hotel for me is the best. It is 41/2 stars on Booking.com. It's the Ryumeikan Hotel Tokyo. From the hotel walked to the JR line ( Tokyo Station ) it's just 5 - 10 minutes. So anyway, the receptionist is very kindly and helpful and very enthusiasm. The room is clean and neat. Ok. From floor 15, you can sightseeing the Tokyo. But be careful. In the elevator they have a key card sensor. We can only go to floor 15 or go down to floor 1 without using card. When you have the key card, it just from floor 8 to floor 15 and floor 1. Floor 2,3,4,5,6,7 is the office. You must know that what room is your floor is floor 8 or 9 or 10 or 11 or 12 or 13 or 14. It is automatic. Now, let's talk about the bathroom. Very nice. The toilet is automatically too, you know. The shampoo, Conditioner, Body Soap is green tea flavored. The bed is also comfortable. Ok. Let's talk a bout the review others write. There is a person named ' suncityga ' . His review is ' Great location to sightsee in Tokyo '. The first thing is that hotel is not for sightsee. It just a nice view. Not that can see all of the Tokyo. So anyway, this is a wonderful hotel.
user_name:
iamnicholasphan
Ho Chi Minh City, Vietnam

review_body: The location is great, close to the Tokyo station but also has many nice restaurants within a 5 minute walk in a neighborhood I felt was safe. The staff was friendly and the room was fantastic. We did not order the most cheap room but neither the most expensive one. This room had lots of space, very clean, more amenities than I have seen before and great coffee. If I ever go again to Tokyo, this would be the first place I would look up.

We really enjoyed our stay at the Ryumeikan. Our travel experience in Europe and Asia has been that hotel rooms tend to be smaller than the typical size rooms we normally see in USA and that was the case at the Ryumeikan, however, my wife and I stayed in a Standard Small Double room and the room size was well suited for our needs. Great amenities and very helpful staff.We loved the location of the Ryumeikan... it is about 3 blocks from Tokyo Central Station. We walked to the hotel after riding the Narita Express train from the airport on our arrival and walked to the train station on our departure to Yokohama. There many restaurants and convenience stores nearby, as well as many attractions (Imperial Palace and Gardens) as well a nearby metro train station.

I am very impressed by this hotel. The place is clean, rooms are big, the staff is super nice and friendly. The room was big enough and quiete. You can walk to the Ginza station and shopping centers, it is a walking distance to the Tokyo station.

Here is a hotel located on the upper floors of a Tokyo skyscraper , conveniently located only two blocks from the main train station, with some modern features most Americans have never experienced. If I could have found a way to pack the bathroom into my luggage I would have. It did everything but talk to me. It lit up as I approached it at night, the seat warmed, it flushed by itself,etc. The we get to the wake up call. Gradually the room lights start to brighten, heavenly music starts softly and becomes louder, and you waken ever so gently. Then we get to the room coffee maker----just the best fresh hotel coffee I have ever had. The staff were friendly, dinner was good, view from lobby was great. On the con side we got the Fourus room which is small( bed plus an extra 10 square feet) with a window opening to a wall 3 feet away. Since we spent little time in the room these were not major inconveniences.If you have the extra cash, upgrade to a larger room with a window onto the city

We stayed only one night and that was the only problem. I wanted to stay longer! The staff were very kind and helpful. Beds were extremely comfortable, the room was beautiful with top class amenities included. A great location with station and Daimaru across the road and bus to airport almost outside hotel (need to book 2 days in advance though! $9. per person, but would have been much easier than the overcrowded train). I will definitely stay again if in the area, but for at least a few days next time!

Other reviewers have mentioned the pros and cons. I just would like to add that-washer/dryer service is available on 12 and 10 floors. - excellent buffet breakfast for about $20.- in room Nescafé machine. - there IS closet space. Some reviewers said there isn't. We stayed in 2 different rooms and both had closet. - Just the fact that the subway is around the corner makes it your best option!!- the area has excellent shopping and restaurants!- it is allways better to call them to make reservations. Their website said they didn't have space, but when I called they did have space.

We really enjoyed our stay here. It’s just a short walk from Tokyo Station. Take the Yaesu north exit. Once outside, cross the street and turn left. It’s several buildings down the block - a light tan colour. Once inside, the hotel entrance/elevator is actually through more sliding doors to the left. The reception is on the 15th floor. The hotel is also close to subway lines. We travelled a lot via the Nihonbashi Station. Turn right when you exit the hotel. Go to the end of the block and turn right. Walk a short ways and you’ll see the subway entrance (A3).Pros:- Modern, stylish decor- Very clean- In-room safe- Electronic air purifier/filter available in the room- Free Wi-Fi- Free travel slippers- Fridge and free bottled water- Secure - you have to scan your key card to access your floor- Reception was friendly and great service - we were given hot hand towels when we arrived- We arrived early and were able to leave our luggage with them until check-in time- When we checked in, we were informed that our luggage was already delivered to our room- 12th floor (where we stayed) had coin laundry and vending machines for drinks at reasonable prices- Convenient to Tokyo Station and subway linesCons:- Small room (but was acceptable considering we were in Japan)- No closet or wardrobe to hang clothes- Not really a con for us but may be for some: this is more of a business area so no bustling nightlife around the hotelOverall, we highly recommend this hotel and would definately stay here again.

About six months before I planned to go to Japan again, I began reading Tripadvisor hotel reviews again. For what I needed my last trip, Tripadvisor recommended just the right hotel in Shibuya. This trip I was bringing my son with me and I wanted the best hotel I could find near Tokyo Station and we wanted to stay fifteen nights. Clearly, from reading many reviews, the Hotel Ryumeikan was the best hotel in the area and the most reasonably priced. I was not disappointed! We were more than comfortable in our large room for two weeks!I emailed the Hotel Ryumeikan directly to make my reservations about five months before I planned to stay in April 2014. I received excellent service when I requested a Corner Deluxe Twin room on the 12th floor (to be near the laundry, because we would be there two weeks). I think I was able to get this room easier because I made my reservations quite early and the staff was quite helpful. The Hotel Ryumeikan email correspondence with me exceeded my expectations and enhanced my enthusiasm for the trip. During the last few weeks before we planned to travel, I wrote the staff at the Hotel Ryumeikan and requested that they order two cell phones. I also asked for information regarding a nearby driving range for my son. I received an email back recommending four driving ranges (2 with English websites and 2 Japanese only websites). I neglected to write back and say thank you as I should have done, and when we checked in at the front desk the hotel staff handed me printouts of the webpages I needed for the closest driving ranges. They also gave me the two cell phones I ordered and explained how to use them. The driving range was quite close by Tokyo standards, and so high tech that it was a lot of fun for us. We stayed in room 1203, which looked exactly as pictured on the Hotel Ryumeikan website. The room was immaculate when we arrived (and kept that way by the hotel staff each day). It was the perfect room for our long stay. The closet was large enough to hold my clothes on one side and my son’s clothes on the other. We used the hotel dry cleaning service two or three times and also the laundry which was right down the hall. The service provided by the Hotel Ryumeikan staff was outstanding in every possible way. We also ate some evening meals in the Hotel Ryumeikan dining room on the fifteenth floor and received excellent meals and service. They even accommodated some special diet needs a couple of nights. When we asked at the front desk about how to go someplace in Tokyo, they always were able to pull a map out of a drawer and show and tell us the best trains or subways to take to our destination. Because we did not always understand how to do something, a few times I know they did far more for us than we deserved, and they solved every concern that I had about anything. We were able to print out our boarding passes for our airline at the computer at the front desk with some help from the staff. And, the hotel staff helped us buy our tickets for the bus to return to the airport (the place to board the bus is a very short walk from the Hotel Ryumeikan entrance). Having taken the Narita Express, I prefer the bus to the Narita Express because I like to see the scenery from the bus better than from the train. The staff knew we had a language barrier with regard to our very limited Japanese, so they made an extra effort to help us feel comfortable by helping us do some things we could not do by ourselves; such as, read the directions for printing out our boarding passes and buying our bus tickets.I have stayed in other hotels in Tokyo and other places in Japan, and just as other Tripadvisor reviewers have stated, the Hotel Ryumeikan is one of the best, if not the best, hotel in Tokyo. I highly recommend the Hotel Ryumeikan to travelers of any age, from young adults to senior citizens (we saw people of all ages and nationalities at the hotel). The nearby Tokyo Station makes travel easy to almost anywhere inside or outside of Tokyo, and the Hotel Ryumeikan staff could answer every question and meet every reasonable need we had. If I ever need to be in Shibuya again, I will only stay in the Hotel Ryumeikan and take the train. To summarize, I believe the Hotel Ryumeikan is worth a 10 star rating!

i chose the hotel because of its central location within walking distance to Tokyo station so that going to the airport and around Tokyo via Yamanote line will be convenient. Pleasantly surprised to find out that there was a subway station for Ginza/Oedo lines a couple of minutes walk and going to he Ginza and Tsukiji areas were a breeze as well. The hotel room was larger the other hotels i had stayed in Shinjuku and Ginza for the same price. Room was immaculately clean spacious and quiet with more than usual amenities eg toe pads and foot massager. Check in was fast and staff was helpful. There are nearby restaurants failing which Daimaru is just a short walk away. We ate at the hotel restaurant which was pretty good if you are short for time.

Great home base to explore Tokyo! My husband and I stayed here May 2014, the rooms are clean, free wifi, great service. The hotel is across the street from Tokyo Station where you can jump on/off the subway, get a subway map from the hotel reception - it has more details and makes it easier to navigate. There are many restaurants and shops in the station and in walking distance from the hotel. We found Japan easy to navigate and safe, there was always someone at the station to help.

I only have good things to say about this hotel. The service is excellent. We arrived earlier than the check in time, so we dropped our luggage first. Later on when we returned to the hotel for check in, our luggage was already in the room. The first time we stayed here, we stayed in the Forus room. It’s so AWESOME. Upon entering our room , I spent the first half hour admiring the room and-particularly-the bathroom. The room is quite spacious, and very nicely designed. The location is also very good-a short walk from the Tokyo station. Shuttle bus to/from the airport is also within short walking distance. The staff also speaks english very well-so there’s no communication problems here.It’s actually the best hotel I’ve ever stayed in Tokyo. I will definitely return to this hotel and will recommend it to everyone visiting Tokyo.

Stayed 3 nights, the hotel is very close Central Metro station (direct express from Narita Airport), follow north gate exit and turn left, walk about 150 m, and the hotel is on the other side of the street. Very clean (with is not a surprise in Tokyo), small rooms but very well equipped, water supply, free Nespresso coffee in the room, internet fast and easy access, nice English speaking front desk, very helpful. Lots of restaurant in the streets nearby, and breakfast 20m on the left when exiting the hotel. Reception on 15th floor. There is a lot of foreigners, so an already well known address. No fitness center but if you like you can run around the Royal Palace within a stone's throw of the hotel

Stayed here for 4 nights at the beginning of our tour of Japan. Great location, clean, comfy, modern and very quiet room. It was also much bigger than we were expecting. Front desk were very helpful. Even though they supply free bottles of water there is a vending machine with water, fizzy drinks etc . There is also a laundry room which we found very handy.

We just loved the hotel!!!Location,location, location! everything new, excelent room, wonderful and helpful staff, wi fi...If we come back to Japan, we will stay again for sure!!Alexandre and Renata Gomes, Brasil

We chose Hotel Ryumeikan because it was #1 in Chuo, Tokyo. And the hotel didn't disappoint us at all. The location was great, right across the street from the Tokyo train station. The front desk staff were very pleasant and professional. The room is small but acceptable for 'Tokyo'. Interior is clean and very modern. All cute Japanese style toilettries were provided along with yukata (Japanese robes). We stayed one night, checked out and left a baggage at the hotel while traveling to other locations for two days before coming back back and staying one more night. The front desk staff were helpful and nice all around.

I really enjoyed my stay here, and was very pleased with the convenience of the location; the staff were very helpful & knowledgeable ... the coin laundry on floor 12 was a welcome feature and the room was just the right size for a solo traveller.

My husband and I stayed here for 10 days this April. Super clean comfortable hotel. Great location right across from Tokyo station and also the airport limo bus drops you off right in front of the hotel. It's perfect. Hotel staff is fantastic as well. Nice quiet rooms, and they even give you some origami paper with instructions for folding. Cute touch. Would definitely stay there again.

The Hotel is just a 5 minutes walk from the Yaesu exit of Tokyo station and 1 minute from the next subway station entrance (3 lines). The staff is as friendly as it is helpful; the rooms are spotless and large in comparison to other hotels we know in Tokyo (important for guests from abroad: there is enough room for your peronal belongings). We did not try the hotel restaurant, but we are sure that it is very good, too. Warmly recommended!

We stayed 6 nights in the Forus Discovery room. There is nothing special about the room. As expected.....small and no opening of the windows. Our room window faces a concrete wall from the next building which blocks out most of the sunlight. The bed is longer than normal....which is good and bad. The Forus system with music and vibrating feet area isn't quite useful for us. The bathroom is good in size and has all the necessary amenities. The only bad thing is that there is no place to hang your clothes in the bathroom. Well there is also extremely little space to hang your clothing in the room. Therefore, there is no place to hang your laundry after washing. Thumbs up on the bathing system! The water pressure is so strong, making bathing time shorter and very enjoyable. There is more than enough space to move around in the bath area. Providing a seat in the bath area is very thoughtful.The staffs at the concierge provides passive services. They did not recommend us places to go or eat around the area. You have to ask them everything from laundry, laundry detergent, and airport bus bookings. Well....at least they always try their best to help find answers to our questions and their English is quite good for Japanese concierge staff.The Check-out time is at 11am which is the normal check out time for most hotels in Tokyo. However, some hotels are nice enough to allow free an hour or two later checkout time (if they have enough rooms before the next guest check in). This hotel only allows late checkouts if you are willing to pay for it. They charge 2,200JPY for 2 guests per room/ per hour.The bus to Narita airport is just a few steps away from hotel lobby and the bus ride takes a little more than an hour to get to the airport. The hotel only accepts 2 days advance booking for the airport bus. So, make sure you do book it in advance otherwise you many not be able to get a seat.Overall, this hotel is above average but not excellent. Would love stay here again next time but it will not be our 1st choice hotel in Tokyo.

As a first timer to Tokyo I was unsure of an ideal location to base my wife and myself. From other tripadvisor reviews, I decided to choose Hotel Ryumeikan based on the positive reviews from other travelers. Without expecting much, the entire duration of my stay at Hotel Rymeikan was one that has left me of fond memories of Tokyo, a place to recommend to others and stay for future visits. The rooms may be small but that's expected of Tokyo but they had everything we needed and was comfortable and clean. Even the amenities were of high standard and was always fully stocked. The laundry facilities (both washer and dryer, no need to buy detergent either) were a lifesaver, while there were vending machines on every level. The hotel had free wifi which was a great bonus and there was even a smoking room by reception so you didn't have to go outside or find a 'smoking area' (Japan has strict laws on smoking and it can only be done in designated areas). As for location, the hotel is less than a 5 minute walk to Tokyo station. From here you can pretty much get anywhere and was helpful when we took the Shinkansen to Kyoto and Hiroshima. If you needed to shop, you could pretty much find what you needed at Tokyo station and if not, it was only a short walk or train ride away. But what stands out at this hotel is the customer service. From the moment we checked in the customary Japanese hospitality was evident and throughout the whole stay there was nothing the staff would not go above and beyond to help us with. I praise them as well for their ability to liaise with us in English fluently and for making us feel at home. Keep up the great work Hotel Ryumeikan and we'll definitely be back!

This is a great hotel - right next to Tokyo station so with excellent transport links - within walking distance of the Imperial Palace Gardens. Plenty of food/drink places nearby.The hotel reception is on the 15th floor which seems strange but it has amazing views so why not? The staff were friendly and welcoming and very efficient. We had a bag shipped out ahead of us and it was waiting for us in our room when we arrived. Our room was small but Japanese hotel rooms are small so no surprise there - it was very clean and comfortable and had everything we needed. It would be my first choice if we're in Tokyo again.

This hotel was the first hotel we stayed on our honeymoon trip to Japan.The hotel is conveniently located near the Tokyo train station and you have a 24hr convenience store nearby. Ginza is also within walking distance.Room was also kept clean and immaculateThe only 'minor' complaint I have is that the rooms is a but small compared to your standard hotel

Modern hotel located within walking distance (less than 10mins) to Tokyo station. Stayed one night as part of holiday as close to station after a long flight in before jumping on shinkasnen early the next morning. Rooms are small (typical for japan however) yet modern, clean and quiet.Lots of japan style quick order machine type food places nearby. A Cafe and Lawsons are basically down stairs. Area is mostly geared for business but im sure you could base yourself here to see tokyo. Recpetion extremely helpful and spoke english well.Overall: recommend as modern, clean hotel located close to tokyo station. Served our purpose as stopover hotel.P.s no nespresso machine as advertised.

This was my first trip to Tokyo and first stay in a hotel in Japan. This hotel is 5 minute walk from Tokyo station. There are nearby shops and places to eat including a nice cafe a block away. The reception is on the 15th floor. Staff were beyond helpful with anything we asked. They looked after our luggage when we arrived at 11am until check in at 2. We stayed in a double superior room. We didn't want for anything! it had a hair dryer, shampoo conditioner shower gel comb hair and toothbrush and paste moisturisers cleansers cotton buds...I could go on. Oh and don't forget the kimonos and slippers! It really was so comfortable. And quiet too. I didn't want to leave! Would definitely recommend to anyone staying in Tokyo.

We knew we would be staying here again if we ever came back to Tokyo. This time we stayed 2 nights and then headed off to Osaka for a few days and then returned back for another 5 nights. The hotel staff took care of our luggage when we headed to Osaka and had them all in our new room when we returned. That was great because I was exhausted from that side-trip with our family. what can i say that others have not or that i have in my 1st review?Great place. Great location. Very comfortable room. Laundry facilities. It's all there. The one thing that i would say is that the female staff seem to be more warm and friendlier if you need to speak to someone more fluent in English. Otherwise. Another great stay. We'll be back again!For anyone who cares: The McDonalds that was in the Yaseu underground has closed. The one person helping me at the front desk told me there was no McDonalds anywhere near the hotel and just circled near by areas with restaurants. This was more for my little girl who wanted her Mcdonalds breakfast. There actually is a McDonalds at the south exit of Tokyo station. It's not that far of a walk if there is a crave for McDonalds.

Stayed in 2 rooms as we were a family of 4. Both rooms were exceptionally clean and had amenities you normally will not find in other business hotels. When you book, they will ask if guests are male or female. I did not understand the need for this until we were in our room. The triple room had Shiseido facial kit while my brother's room had amenities for men -- a proper coat rack, toiletries for men, etc. Both rooms even had traditional Japanese foot massager (complete with instructions and benefits of it) that has proven to be a life saver after a long day of walking. The triple room also had a Nespresso machine with enough coffee capsules to keep us up round the clock! Traditional Japanese rice crackers were also provided. The triple room had a good view of the Tokyo Station which was a plus. Its location is hard to beat. At the price you pay while staying a mere 5 minutes from the biggest station in Japan is hard to beat. Their website offers 30% discount when booked at least 1 month in advance. I booked mine 6 months ahead which is just the right thing to do especially when travelling during peak periods of Spring, Summer and Autumn. By the time I booked my 2nd room 2 months before my check-in date, they only had 2 single rooms available. There are numerous restaurants within walking distance of the hotel. Tokyo Ramen Street in Tokyo Station will always be an option. There is a very cheap neighborhood place that serves decent enough Tonkatsu and Ramen a street away from the hotel entrance (as you walk towards the station). This is at the corner of the street lined with Cherry Blossom trees. They serve a big bowl of ramen for Y300 which is the cheapest meal I have had during our 14-day trip. The tonkatsu I think cost Y450. During our visit, the sakura was in bloom and the street looked amazing. Everything is accessible from Ryumeikan. There is also an option to take the Airport Limousine Bus and the station is maybe 10 steps away from the hotel entrance. I cannot comment on the food served at the hotel as we did not have the chance to try them. ALthough I did notice that they have complimentary tea and coffee making facilities at the lobby which was a nice touch when waiting for check-in or waiting for departure after check-out.We will definitely stay here again the next time we are in Tokyo.

I stayed here during the first week and a half of April, 2014. The hotel is conveniently located right next to Tokyo station, plus there is a bus stop just a block away, which can take you to and from Narita airport for a very reasonable price. The hotel staff is very friendly, and the rooms are clean and modern. I will be staying here again during my next trip to Tokyo.

Near with station, lots of food around hotel, easy to found, comfort bed, clean, room need bigger size but its oke. International breakfast with variant choice. Good service, we love this hotel. Will be come back soon

I stayed at the Hotel Ryumeikan for two nights recently. As with most Tokyo hotels, you have to book weeks in advance sometimes, or else the hotel will be sold out. As word gets out this hotel will sell out even faster.The only complaint I have is that they don't have a free business center, and my room didn't have a view. The list of positives is much more extensive: Comfortable room, quite large compared to average Japanese hotel. Free specialty coffee in the room. Nice restaurant at reasonable prices. Great service. Location is minutes away from Tokyo Station, so even if you have luggage you can walk to the hotel. Bidet with heated seat. Bed with built in foot massager. Nice lounge on 15th floor. And, and, and...I've stayed at a lot of hotels, and this is the best value I've experienced, especially considering how expensive Tokyo can be. Highly recommended

We stayed only for one night. We experienced comfortable room and outstanding service. The hotel is very conveniently located near Tokyo station. For any future travels to Tokyo we would definitely stay here.

Was my second time stayed at Ryumeikan (Jan 6, 2014), although the room was much smaller compared to the previous time, then again so was the overnight rate paid for this time. Overall I would rate it a 5 out of 5, definitely had some buzz over that forus music massage bed. And what really set this business hotel apart from the rest of mediocre hotels around the area besides its well trained staff and excellent in room amenities, is that I had recently tried another new hotel around the area(Courtyard Marriot Tokyo Station) between April 10-13, I would rate courtyard as overpriced with below average standard compare to Ryumeikan, Keep it up Ryumeikan!!

The location is great - right next to Tokyo Station. The rooms are on the small side, but are very clean and well appointed. The hotel certainly delivers value for money compared to what you could pay elsewhere.I didn't have many conversations with the hotel staff, but when I did they were helpful, polite and able to switch to English to rescue me when my Japanese floundered.
user_name:
Maxxash
Newcastle upon Tyne, United Kingdom

review_body: Stayed two nights at the start of January. The room was a Standard Small Double. A little small but Ok by Tokyo standards. The room was very modern and spotless, with comfortable bed. The Hotel is just across the road from Tokyo Station so close to all transport, including airport train and bus. The staff were very friendly and helpful. Although we did not order breakfast there were plenty of places to each, including department stores. Quiet part of the city so not much action at night, but remember in Tokyo it is only a subway ride away. Overall would stay there again.

We stayed here 3 nights in recent vacation. It was only a few minutes from Tokyo station which was perfect for day trips and leaving for next destination. The staff was very quick and kind when fulfilling request such as extra pillow. I also loved the extras that they provided such as kimono to wear and all the toiletries you could ever want. Highly recommend this place.

As many have commented, the location (right next to Tokyo station) is fantastic from a logistical point of view.The hotel itself is modest, but makes the most of what it has. The rooms are very compact but every gap is filled with something useful - for the size, there are a lot of facilities. The hotel staff are polite and helpful whilst the onsite restaurant is pleasant but perhaps lacking a bit of atmosphere.The only real negatives were that the bed wasn't particularly comfortable and though well used, the rooms could be bigger.It isn't a luxury kind of place and I wouldn't recommend for the entire of somebody's holiday. But for commuters, business travellers or (as we did) for people looking to just settle one or two nights before moving on, it makes a great choice. Really it is a fairly basic hotel, but it does it well and for that reason I've given it a better than average score.

Hotel is very clean and comfortable. Very close to the Tokyo Train stationA lot of restaurants around the areaA convenience store and quaint cafe very near the hotelStaff are very friendlyWould definitely stay here if given a chance.

We found this hotel to be the perfect location for Tokyo station and a JR railpass; we could have easily spent a week here! It is very comfortable for the price (middle bracket) We did not try the restaurant but there are plenty of choices within a few hundred meters.Our only issue was the variability of the air conditioner. It would be cool enough for the doona on retiring but the room became very hot disturbing our sleep. Does the air conditioner shut off at night? Who wants to fiddle with controls at 3 am? Otherwise perfect.

Everything was absolutely great. I arrived by subway to Tokyo Station, and from the Yaesu North exit it's just a matter of crossing the street and turning left to the hotel entrance. There are two elevators available and the reception is located on the 15th floor. It took a matter of minutes to check in - during which time I received a refreshingly hot towel. In the reception area there are newspapers available, and there is an adjoining restaurant. I was given a Forus Single-A "Discovery" room on the 9th floor. To access the guest room floors it's necessary to swipe the room card in the elevator.The hallways are very nice and tidy. There is a room with a vending machine for beverages and an ice-cube machine. Two of the floors have vending machines selling beer. They even have washing and drying machines available for guests. Also in the hallway they have a table with suggestion cards for improvement ideas. These guys are seriously interested in taking care of the guests.The room was quite spacious, very nicely decorated and very clean. It had all the equipment listed on the hotel's web page such as refrigerator, Nespresso coffee maker and air purification system with humidifier. The AC was excellent. There was free Wi-fi available, and I received the password when checking in. The bed was quite large and very comfortable. It had three nice pillows. Next to the bed were perfectly located electric outlets and an advanced wake-up system. The TV had mostly Japanese channels, but BBC News and CNN were available. The desk and the chair were nice.The bathroom was quite small, but unusually well equipped with a fantastic shower and a *very* advanced toilet. There was a number of amenities available and the body soap, the shampoo and the conditioner were of the highest quality. Be advised that the bathroom door is a sliding glass door.I didn't have a view, though. Outside the window there was a concrete wall, so I just kept the curtains closed.One of the information folders had a long list of things that could be requested free of charge, and a list of available services such as massage. On the desk, there was a postcard that could be delivered to the reception, and they would mail it free of charge.There was no audible noise from the streets or from the adjoining rooms.The area outside the hotel is easy to navigate. There are several convenience stores and coffee shops nearby. There are also plenty of small and interesting restaurants in the street just east of the hotel.The gigantic Tokyo station with an abundance of quality shopping opportunities and lots of restaurants are just a short walk away. And Nihombashi metro station's exit A3 is just around the corner, so it's really easy to get to wherever you want to go without getting lost.In summary - it doesn't get better than this.I'll definitely stay here next time I'm in Tokyo.

One day, when I search hotel in Tokyo station by chance on a business trip, hotel style feel the money because it was open, immediate booking. It is and has been involved in the hotel in early Tokyo station, and take care of the hotel staff, the hotel is free or tea in the lobby, feel the hospitality of the abundance of total comfort , everywhere. 3 minute walk, access to the urban area and a minute walk from the metro station to station Tokyo Nihonbashi perfect, I recommend it to a colleague! Hotels can catch from now on! ?

A really good location if you want to spend a few days in Tokyo. It's a 45 minutes bus ride from Narita airport which costs just 900 Yen. The bus drops you off within 100 metres of the hotel. Get off the bus at ' Tokyo station' Ask for this destination when you buy the bus ticket at Narita. Turn to your left and walk the 100 metres. The hotel entrance is part of a business complex. Reception is on the 15th floor. All rooms are on the 12th to 14th floors. There is a great breakfast area on the 15th floor. Lots of restaurants nearby and the main Tokyo rail station is 300 metres on the other side of the road. You can't miss it due to its architecture. I stayed here 3 times and rate it a five star. Rooms are modern with a super shower and very comfortable bed. TV. Coffee maker etc. Enjoy the wake up facility by the bed.

We stayed 3 nights in April in a corner room. This hotel is part of an office building having reception at the 15th floor and a bit understaffed. Our room was on the 6th floor and quite spacious for a Japanese hotel and having all details considered. Room amenities were great. Only Japanese breakfast available. The greatest aspect of this hotel is its location. It is just of the Tokyo station. The staff at the reception is friendly and can speak English well.

Good location, nice service, good wifi, near Tokyo station, very easy to shopping, near bus stop, so we can easy transfer to airport. It is good for carry more baggage. I will suggest my friends to stay there. Near 皇居

Stayed for 11 nights total here, and I wholeheartedly recommend this hotel to everyone.The staff are courteous, friendly, and go out of their way to make your stay a very pleasant one. It's a relatively small hotel, only about 7 floors of a 15 storey building (the top floor is their lobby/reception and restaurant). Very clean and well maintained. The location is very very good. Just beside the building is a Family Mart convenience store. A couple of minutes walk across the street takes you to MASSIVE Tokyo Station, where you can lose yourself in their numerous shops and restaurants (don't forget to try the ramen shops in Ramen Street!). And the area is central to anywhere you might want to visit in Tokyo.In the immediate area (around 3 to 10 minutes walk) are numerous small shops and restaurants, including department stores like Coredo, Takashimaya, and Daimaru.If you're up for it, a 15 to 20 minute walk along Sotobori Dori will take you to Ginza (Sony Building, Printemps, etc).I'm very glad we stayed here for our Tokyo trip. I would not consider anywhere else when we return.If I had to pick a problem, it's that their clothes washer and dryer were pretty small.
user_name:
John Christophe... B
Quezon City, Philippines

review_body: This was our 3rd stay at the Ryumeikan Hotel in Tokyo. It is definitely our favourite hotel in Japan and always exceeds our expectations. We stayed in a double room which was perfect. The king size bed was exceptionally comfortable, the room very clean and functional. The bathroom and amenities are brilliant. Above all the staff are extremely helpful and go out of their way to help with extras such as packaging and sending luggage, recommending and making a hair appointment. The location is fantastic and very close to Tokyo Station. This is a huge bonus if you are arriving with luggage as it avoids the need to catch a taxi from Tokyo Station to your hotel. In the past, before we discovered the Ryumeikan Hotel, we use to struggle to get our luggage (suitcases and ski/snowboard gear) into a taxi from Tokyo Station to travel to a hotel. Being able to walk a couple of minutes straight to the Ryumeikan Hotel (Yaesu North exit) is great. Another great feature of this hotel is the coin operated laundry which is always a very welcome find for travellers who wish to do their own laundry. We will definitely be returning to this hotel next time we pass through Tokyo.

Very convenient location to get anywhere via JR line, subway, bus or to join tours. Few minutes walk from Tokyo Yaesu North Exit. Standard rooms are small but every need is ingeniously and generously met - Nespresso, tea, automated toilet, top quality shower & toiletries. Don't hesitate to ask staff for directions, recommendations - any help to get oriented. Plenty of restaurants in the lanes nearby and the choice at Tokyo station is truly mind-blowing. Book as soon as you can.

Well located, Ryumeikan Tokyo hotel is a wonderful place to stay in Tokyo, as it's close to Tokyo Station and Nihombashi Station. A Keisei Limousine Bus stop in the next quarter made easier my return to Narita Aiport.The staff is awesome and will make you feel at home. Rooms are very comfy and clean!Really recommend this hotel for everybody.
user_name:
Carlos H
Rio de Janeiro, Brazil

review_body: We really enjoyed the comfort and luxury of this hotel. 2 adults + 2 young children stayed very confortably. Room was huge with King bed and bathroom was exceptional with the robot toilet and unique shower area located in a separate room. Reception is on the 15th floor and rooms on lower floors. Downside is there were not enough towel racks for wet towels. Very close to Tokyo station, although there are several flights of stairs to cross at the station which can be challenging with 2 huge suitcases + stroller - look for Daimaru exit (Yesu North Exit). The keiser bus to narita airport is just at hotel doorstep 900 yen one-way, but we already bought the limo bus return ticket (it's a short easy straight walk from the hotel to bus stop) 3000 yen one-way. We got reception to reserve seats for us. Family mart and starbuck just at hotel entrance. area around tokyo station is not very interesting compared to Shinjuku which we stayed a few nights too.

Relying on my fellow Trip Advisees for guidance when I needed to find a hotel in Tokyo I booked two nights at the Hotel Ryumeikan on line. I am very glad I did. The hotel is a 3 minute walk from Tokyo Station (where I arrived from Kyoto) and from the moment I checked in until the moment I checked out I had an excellent experience. My room was large, fully appointed, and very comfortable. The front-desk staff (reception is on Floor 15 and the rooms are below) was welcoming and helpful. They have all the maps, timetables, information you might need. The hotel is right around the corner from a Ginza Line subway stop and, because you are near Tokyo Station, there is no problem finding a cab - even on a rainy evening in rush hour. The 'Japanese Feast' breakfast is tasty, though very much a Japanese-centric buffet, and nicely located next to the reception area. I will definitely stay here when next I visit Tokyo.

So that I can keep the place to myself and ensure that it doesn't get spoiled!Everything about the Ryumeikan is understated elegance: the uniformed reception clerks, the carpeting and lighting in the hallways, the Nespresso machines in the rooms, the vending machines selling beer and Suntory highballs, the reading lights around the bed. I cannot think of anything that would have made the experience more pleasant and comfortable except a view: I looked out on the wall of the neighboring building. But, honestly, it did not matter. I could also have used a few more square meters of floor space, although I must say, to be fair, that the bed was the largest one I ever had in Tokyo. The mattress and pillows were wonderful.The rain forest shower-head deserves a special mention. Then there was the built-in bidet and spray on the toilet...but then again, this is one of the many things I love about Tokyo.The location of Ryumeikan cannot be beat: you are five minutes by foot from the Yaesu North entrance of Tokyo Station (walk out alongside Daimaru Department Store, turn left and cross the street with the rest of humanity and keep walking to the left). The Nihombashi stop on the Ginza, Tokai and Marunouchi lines of the Tokyo Metro is just around the corner (turn out of the hotel to the right, turn right at the corner and keep walking until you see the entrance). Maruzen, the premier bookstore, stationery and pen emporium, is just down the street from the subway stop, as is the great department store Takashimaya. If you go down into the subway, you can be at Ginza Crossing in a few minutes. The Tsukiji Fish Market requires a transfer at Monzen-nakacho, but the whole trip can be done in a jiffy.The restaurant on the 15th floor across from reception is good for a typical businessman's lunch buffet (very reasonable at 1,500 yen). I did not eat breakfast here, opting instead for sushi at Tsukiji Market every day.This was my third trip to Tokyo, but my first stay at Ryumeikan. I will never stay anywhere else in Tokyo.

My family and I stayed in the room of Japanese junior suite for one night. The room was spacious and provided everything we needed! (We love the Nespresso and also the small yard next to the tatami room!) The hotel is very near from Tokyo main station, 3 minutes by walk. You can find many different restaurants and shopping malls around it. We will definitely come back when we visit Tokyo next time!

Excellent location, close to subway stations and the train station - which is also a great last minute go-to place for a meal. Staff was awesome, rooms small but great. The breakfast was ok, not amazing, but good traditional food.

The location is prime and just a few minute walk from Tokyo station. It is especially good if you need to travel via bullet train to elsewhere of Japan. You can enjoy a variety of choices of restaurants at the surrounding area. The staff is helpful and fluent in English. As we stayed there for one night and headed to othe cities in Japan the next day, the hotel staff was so helpful to store our luggages and placed them back to our room before we check-in again after two nights later.

The location and amenities at the Hotel Ryumeikan are impossible to beat for the price. Being right next to Tokyo Station makes exploring almost all areas of the city extremely convenient, not to mention being able to walk to many fantastic attractions nearby. Tokyo Station itself is a great resource as well - Ramen "street" alone provided several amazing meals, along with other food and shopping options that we found quite useful and fun. (Side note - get a JR rail pass if you're traveling anywhere else in Japan like Kyoto, because in addition to paying for itself with that one trip, you get unlimited use of the JR subway lines in Tokyo, which significantly reduces the stress of trying to get around the city).Because of cost/availability, my wife and I ended up in a room with two double beds (a little odd for us, but maybe good for others), but the room had plenty of space for us and our luggage - not necessarily all that easy to find in Japan. The shower/bath setup is a little awkward, though the water pressure was amazing. The staff couldn't have been nicer, though they weren't exempt from the language/cultural communications barriers that exist everywhere in Japan for westerners (maybe especially Americans).All of that said, it's not a luxury hotel. It's very nice, clean, and quiet (despite being in a business/downtown area with construction right across the street), but it's not fancy. We were happy to come back to relax after our days of wandering the city, but it wasn't a place we wanted to hang out.Overall - if you want a very comfortable place to use as a home base while exploring Tokyo, Hotel Ryumeikan is perfect.

The hotel is located most strategically at Tokyo/ Marunounchi & Nihonbashi stations. The room (Forus-C) is not exactly large, but very comfortable. The bed and pillows allowed us to drift into deep slumbers which is well-welcome. Excellent location and helpful staff members although they are very strict on check-in/ check-out times. If anything, if the ability to accommodate early check-in and later check-outs is available, that would be most perfect!

Small room for two but has the most luxury equipments such us massage shower head, humidifier and small cosmetics kids for different gender! Only 5 min. walking distance from Tokyo station and easily to commute from hotel to Haneda and Narita airport! Staff are very nice and helpful!

Hotel Ryumeikan Tokyo -new hotel, small room but outstanding location (near shopping & train stations -bullet train Shinkanzen, railway & subway, and airport bus, and bar, and convenience store), a lot of amenities, very good customer service, good breakfast at a very reasonable room rate.

Nice accommodations, near Tokyo rail station. Very quiet, no street noise. Rooms are clean and staff is helpful. Only a few at desk can speak English, but not very good. The bathroom is fully equiped with amenities even the toilet has a seat warmer andsprays the underside with warm water! Wewere able to plug in all of our electronic with no issues.

This is a great hotel just a few minutes walk from Tokyo Station. Nice new rooms and friendly staff. I booked a small single room as I wanted the cheapest room available however there was 2 of us staying. Although the bed was small, it was still a double bed so good enough for two people. I would stay there again!

i stayed there for 4 days with my family of 3 small kids. it was a good experience for us. great hotel, very clean and tidy. near to Daimaru supermarket where we can get our food easily and also the train station. the staff were very helpful. I would certainly stay there again
user_name:
Syed Kamaruddin F
Kuala Lumpur Malaysia

review_body: Stayed in the hotel for business and it is minuttes away from Tokyo station - unfortunatly does the airport limosine bus not stop in front of the hotel. The room is small - which is Tokyo standard. But the room is comfortable with a good bed and even a nepresso coffee machine. The breakfast in the hotel is not recommended - but find a better place outside the hotel. For the price and comfortable room it is a good choice in Tokyo.

Just a few minutes walk to the Tokyo Station. Very convenient location. The staff were very helpful. The room was in an excellent condition. I especially like the comfortable slippers they provided. I have stayed in this hotel twice. Sure will come back again.

This hotel is clean and efficient. We spent a few nights here. The rooms were clean and modern. Wi Fi worked. The location is great with easy access to the central train station, bus stops and lots of places to eat. It is a short taxi ride to the amazing tuna auction at the fish market. I highly recommend this hotel if you plan some time in Tokyo.

Nice business hotel close to Tokyo station, about 500 meters from the Yaesu North exit.The rooms are very well decorated although small. We had room 1313 which neither had daylight nor a view because it was facing directly the wall of the next building. It felt claustrophobic. You might want to consider taking a bigger room in another corridor.We had a very nice bathroom and a Nespresso coffee machine with several Grand Crus (cups) of coffee, which is a real plus :)Sleeping quality of the beds was great.

Booked 2 rooms for 5 nights with them. One of them was a forus room. Its small but yet comfortable and decked out with modern gadgets you wouldn't see in any other hotels. Location is around 5 minutes walk off the Tokyo Station Yaesu North exit. Lots of restaurants nearby with cheap and luxury options for you to choose from. There is a family mart store just downstairs. Staff were a pleasure to deal with and I would definitely book this hotel again.

Excellent property, very friendly and helpful staff. The hotel rooms are clean, comfortable and come up with a few extras that would sure leave you feeling happy. The location of the hotel is very convenient, right opp the Tokyo station. There's tons of places to eat around and a convenient Starbucks just on the corner.

Large well-appointed room with close proximity to Nihombashi Tokyo Metro station and JR lines/Shinkansen/NEX one block away at Tokyo Station. Helpful staff, reception assisted with posting mail from hotel. Walking distance to Ginza business & shopping districts. Free wifi was fast and easily accessed throughout the room and lobby/restaurant.

Almost everything is in this hotel's favour, from good size rooms, location to Tokyo station, courteous and English speaking staff, free newspaper on 15th floor (reception), coffee making facilities (& crackers), comfortable (firm) beds, good clothes storage.The only down sides are the bathroom is a little cramped (but functional), the cost of accommodation is a bit pricy, the nearby Family Mart is ok for variety just not a huge desert range (heh I have a sweet tooth). Still these negatives are only minor as there are Lawson's, Starbucks and a wide variety of restaurants to choose from in close proximity. I'll stay here again.

Excellent hotel, would definitely stay here again. Great location directly across from Tokyo Station. Helpful front desk, very clean & extremely comfortable. Modern bathroom with amazing steam shower. Love the sleep system, what better way to adjust to a large time change? Feels like a 2nd home, will be staying here again. :)

My daughter and I visited Tokyo last week and stayed here for 3 nights. It is a terrific hotel with a wonderful staff! Spotless with great amenities very near Tokyo Station. We had a double room which was more than enough for 2 Americans. And talk about going the extra mile...when we came back from sightseeing the staff had placed a small bag of candy and a Happy Birthday card in the room to help me celebrate mine!Highly recommend to anyone visiting Tokyo!

We stayed here for 4 nights in February. The weather was cold and wet but the hotel was fantastic. The location is right near Tokyo Station and accessible by foot (even with 2 children and our bags).The rooms are very generous by Tokyo standards and good value. There are many places to eat nearby and the proximity to Tokyo Station makes getting around easy.

We chose this hotel because of its location, close to tokyo station. Walking distance 10 mins. The staff spoke good English, and was helpful.Room was average size and full of amenities. Yakuta provided and also tiny bedroom slippers for my toddler son. There is also a nespresso machine.Good location if you have an early morning shinkasen to catch.

One of the best things about this hotel is it’s location (about 5-10 minutes walk to Tokyo Station). Very convenient if you take the train from Narita Airport. The second thing would be the price, of about $150 USD per night, for Tokyo this is a bargain. The room we had (Forus) had no view, but we felt like visiting Tokyo non stop, so it didn’t matter at all. The room amenities are great, there’s pretty much everything you need even some Kimonos to wear at bedtime. My main issue, was the bed, I didn’t find it to be comfortable and didn’t get such a good night sleep the first night. The bed is small (double bed) and rock hard. So if you’re two sharing the room, it might be a little uncomfortable, but you get for what you pay for. In Tokyo hotels are very expensive, so this fits the criteria if you’re looking for location, cleanliness, and bargain price. This isn’t a luxury hotel, so I had low expectation in terms of design and overall quality but I was pleasantly surprised.

This hotel has a great location, easy access just two blocks from Tokyo station for the Shinkansen and Narita Express train to the airport and 50 metres from the bus stop for the Keisei express bus to the airport which is quicker and cheaper than the train. One block from Nihombashi station for the Tokyo Metro line. There was a small general store nearby and lots of restaurants.The rooms were very comfortable and fitted with every amenity, bar fridge, capsule coffee maker, safety deposit box, hairdryer, TV , snacks and water bottles. Some rooms had excellent views.The staff were helpful and spoke English

I stayed at his hotel for 4 nights in Oct-13. It is located a few minutes walk from Tokyo Station which make it very convenient to explore the whole Tokyo by trains and also other parts of Japan by Shinkansen.The rooms are fairly standard by Tokyo standard. I stayed in the Forus Single-A Discovery and booked it early through their English website to enjoy 30% discount from the normal rates.There is an Espresso with free capsules per day which i find it very useful for breakfast coffee.The bed got vibrating function which is some "Sleep Function" which i find it very amazing.

Perfect location for exploring and getting in and out of the city. Really friendly and helpful staff. Nice clean rooms. The price was very good for 3 of us sharing and comparable with other hotels in Japan.

We selected the Ryumeikan because of its location right opposite the Tokyo station and we were not disappointed. We had two rooms, a double and a deluxe corner twin. Rooms were spacious and well equipped with nice extras like a coffee machine, some snacks and bottles of drinking water. Beds were very comfortable and rooms were clean and well tended to. They are very generous with their toiletries and they do try to provide everything which they think you might need. Staff at Reception were polite, friendly and efficient. Can't ask for anything more actually. Will definitely stay here again if we are lucky enough to find ourselves back in Tokyo.

Stopped over in Tokyo for a night on my way back to the US from Beijing. Chose this hotel as I wanted to make sure I would be in a convenient location that is easy to find considering I did not speak the language. Took Narita Express to Tokyo Station and had about a 5-10 minutes walk to the hotel. This choice was perfect for the price and location. Double room was on the smaller side as expected, but it was very clean and luxurious. The location also had easy access to food and shopping and the subway was located about a block away to take you anywhere in Tokyo. Staff was very polite and spoke good english. Good wifi available in room but there was no english on TV. The few english channels were dubbed over in japanese making them impossible to watch. Surprised at this, but I survived with the good wifi.
user_name:
KAG G
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: It's so great service and cleanliness hotel. The location is very good and easy to find. My family love this hotel very much. The hotel staff can speak very well English. We made the reservation through internet directly but had some mistake during the processing. The staff help me to settle it promptly without any charges. Frankly speaking it's a excellent hotel.

Great location near the central train station - rooms very neat and with a few exceptional touches - entire hotel very modern without giving it an impersonal feeling - great value for money. Concur with other reviews.

We stayed here for two nights and I cannot recommend this place highly enough. The hotel is situated very close to Tokyo train station and is an ideal place to rest for a while, the hotel, not the station. We had a corner twin room which was huge by Japanese standards with a fantastic bathroom which had a separate Japanese style shower. The bed was comfortable and you get the choice of pillows. Overall a pleasant experience and well worth the cost.

This was a perfect choice for our last days in Japan. You can walk easily from Tokyo station-which links the JR and metro lines easily. There is a department store nearby with very good, cheap food options in the basement. The choice of renting options was also impressive and we appreciated the laundry options. The free tea in the lobby was lovely and although we did not ask the lobby many questions, they were happy to keep items for us in storage, 20 days before we actually checked in. The hotel restaurant had great food and reasonable prices (much better that the well known chain hotel that we had stayed in Tokyo at the start of the trip).The beds, like most in Japan were quite hard but apart from that, we found no issue with the hotel and were very happy of our choice of the Ryumeikan hotel.

Silent, clean, near Tokyo Station a really good choice to stay in Tokyo. Excellent service and very good rate if you book through web. I would reccomend to everybody who wants to visit the amazing Tokyo!!!

The room is very clean and big . The location is good to access the airports and local. The food is good and service is great . The lunch is cheap . There is a convenience store next to the hotel . If you book earlier , the hotel price will be low . Highly recommend for anyone who wants to visit Tokyo .

I primarily picked this hotel because of the TripAdvisor reviews along with the proximity to the Tokyo train station. The hotel is within a couple of blocks of the Tokyo Train Station and you can reach multiple JR lines here, including the bullet trains which was key for us since we were coming in from Kyoto. If you're coming from Tokyo Station just find the Yaesu North exit and go left. You'll find the hotel across the street a few blocks done. It's pretty easy to find since the name of the hotel is on top of the building so you can see it from far away. The lobby is on the 15th floor so once we got up there we were greeted and got our room key, we were there around 5pm. The room was a pretty good size and had a shower/tub, toilet with controls, and stuff in the bathroom in case you forgot something like your toothbrush. Overall the price is great, the hotel is nice, and the convenience is great. I'd highly recommend taking the Narita Express to and from the airport, especially if you have JR East Rail passes. It's so convenient and the trains are super fast, comfortable, and clean. There are even monitors that show you flight updates and info on the terminal in English.Only complaint I'd have is check out is fairly early - at 11. We were 10 minutes late and they were calling us about it...

Stayed at Hotel Ryumeikan 3 nights prior to going to Hakuba for a ski trip.The service, position and value for money is excellent.Staff are always available to help with any enquiries, bookings or transport arrangements. Rooms are large well equipped and comfortable.I can truly say Hotel Ryumeikan is Perfect.Will definitely stay there again next time I am in Tokyo.

Great place to stay. We had corner deluxe room and it was sufficiently roomy for us and 2 small children. We had twin beds so shared with the children. Room very well supplied and very clean and comfortable. View of building site which was a little noisy till surprisingly late in the evenings but not intolerable. Building site very entertaining for 4 year old.

We had a whirlwind 36 hours in Tokyo in transit home from a trip to Indonesia, so we wanted a place on the train line from the airport (check, walking distance from Tokyo station), reasonably priced (check), convenient to the short sightseeing we would be doing (check). Most high tech bathroom I have ever seen. Decent space in the room for Tokyo at the price. Helpful desk staff.

Hotel Ryumeikan Tokyo was a pleasant surprise the room was awesome. We had a triple room and there was more then enough room for the three of us. It was a couple of minutes from the Tokyo main station which made it easy getting around. The staff spoke English and were very helpful, nearby there were a selection of places to eat as well.

Stayed here with the family in January 2014. Can't speak highly enough about this hotel. Few minutes walk to JR Tokyo Station, the subway trains and Daimaru Shopping Centre. Was lucky enough to stay in a beautiful Japanese Suite for the week we were there. Check-in was a breeze, provided us with everything we had requested from our email booking including a non-smoking room on a non-smoking floor. The hotel restaurant was fantastic as we had most of our dinners there. My son is vegetarian and they prepared a great dinner for him each night. Nothing was too much trouble. When we left they treated us like old friends and came out from the restaurant to see us off. The hotel staff also provided us with help in getting around the big city of Tokyo. Would definitely stay here again if we ever come back to Tokyo. Highly recommended.

Our family stayed at this hotel after returning from a couple of weeks skiing, we stepped off the Shinkansen at Tokyo station and after a five minute walk we were at reception. It was a great hotel, very centrally located and the facilities were excellent. Touring around Tokyo we could easily orientate ourselves as our hotel was adjacent to Tokyo Station.The staff all spoke english and were extremely accommodating and helpful, I had some problems printing out some on-line documents and they went out of their way to assist.We booked an advanced rate through the hotel website and took advantage of a very good discount. For what we paid the rooms were excellent value, spacious with great amenities. All in all the hotel was excellent and very deserving of all the glowing reviews, as a family we will certainly recommend and will return here on our next visit to Tokyo.

This hotel is aesthetically pleasing but not the least bit interested in catering to families and particularly Australians - will change currencies from US, some other Asian countries and Euros but not Australian dollars. Children over 6 are charged a daily fee, the website is extremely difficult to use and requests for a family to have 2 rooms at least on the same floor not able to be accommodated despite the booking being made 5 months in advance. And to top it off it is has a strong odour of cigarette smoke in hallways etc and DON'T accidentally get a smoking room if a non smoker - putrid! I would avoid this hotel if ever in Tokyo again.

Good location. Tokyo JR station and the Tokyo metro and tons of restaurants and stros within minutes from the hotel. Room was super clean (as I suspect every room in Japan is) and to my suprise very spacious. This was my first trip to Japan, so I was expecting a very small room in this price range. This was not the case. Only tiny little minor issue I have is the view from my room was a brick wall. I probably will stay here next also.

I stay in many hotels, and Hotel Ryumeikan was one of the best I have every stayed in. Ideal location -- 3 min walk from Tokyo Station and 1 min walk from the airport shuttle bus stop. Room facilities were excellent, including a Nespresso coffee maker AND a kettle, and a 'sleep system' to lull you to sleep and wake you up gently. I would have no hesitation in recommending it to anyone.

You will be welcome in this hotel. Everything is clean and in order. The location is perfect if you have to use public ground transportation system inside or outside (like the high speed train network) Tokyo. The main railway station is at a walking of five minutes.

This hotel is located 5 min (if that) from Tokyo station (Yaesu side). It is surrounded by cages, restaurants, convenience stores and the underground Yaesu shopping street. It is an excellent Tokyo city stay with comfortable rooms in pristine condition with super awesome showers. The beds are small (as are most in Japanese hotels), so if you want a big bed opt for the largest room. The staff though are faultless. They are super friendly, speak excellent English and were amazingly helpful. For example, my baby had a cold and I asked for the location of a pharmacy. They not only directed me to the closest pharmacy using two maps, but they called ahead to get the right medicine and wrote a note for the pharmacist in Japanese to ensure I got the correct product. Amazing customer service.I highly recommend this hotel for its location, cleanliness and the staff. Reasonably priced too.

The hotel is located 2 minutes walking distance from the exit of Tokyo JR station, and also close to Metro lines. The location is great, and Tokyo station has a lot of stores for shopping and ramen street that open till 11pm. A convenient store right at the corner. The district seem very safe, even walking out pass midnight there are still people out walking. The hotel room is modernly decorated with looks very nice. The size is small, but that's standard in Japan. Service is great, rental of a DVD player was free and they even brought it into my room for me. Areas for improvement: No free breakfast included, and the restaurant seem slightly pricey. The dryer is not powerful enough and takes a very long time to actually dry your laundry; it took me 3 cycles to have my 4 days clothing (mostly short sleeve T-shirts) fully dried. The currency exchange rate offered at hotel counter seem to be worse than airport or location shops.Despite the minor things, this is a really excellent hotel. Will definitely stay here again!

Close to Tokyo station. The rooms have everything to make your stay comfortable - sound system, toiletries with anti aging cream, fancy toilet and shower, ionizer, humidifier, shoe stretcher, Japanese and English TV channels, good size work desk, high speed Internet, Room layout good. Great value.

Stayed here on new year's eve. Room was above average, equipped with nespresso machine and toiletries for the guests. Location is good, just a short walk from Tokyo station. Only con is that no breakfast was provided.

We stayed 4 nights here and had a great stay. Really close to Tokyo station and metro so we were able to do,lots with an infant. We had two rooms...one was really economical with space but one was a larger double which could accommodate a cot. The en suites were great with good quality soaps and accessories. The coffee in the room was top notch and nothing was too much trouble for the staff including luggage forwarding. There are lots of restaurants in the area and lots to see and do. Excellent hotel in Central Tokyo for a good price.
user_name:
Anorexic_Lobster
Bandar Seri Begawan, Brunei Darussalam

review_body: Staff was very attentive to detail and easy to communicate with. We requested a dinner booking through the concierge 2 months ahead and it was done within the same day when the request was made. The room and bathroom was clean and cosy. The hotel is very easy to locate and is only a few minutes walk from Tokyo Station, a perfect hub to start the journey around Japan. Loved the complimentary teas at the reception area and nespresso coffees in the room.

The location is great, 2 min from Tokio Station and 5 to 10 min to Ginza (walking). The rooms are superb, although they are small they have everything you need and the quality of everything in it is great, from the bed to the shower (and of course the technological japanese toilet). Staff is friendly. Can be a little bit expensive, but I can assure you that for this kind of hotel you will pay 50% more in any european capital.

I plan to visit japan and decide to stay in this hotel. My mum and me were staying for 7 nights since christmas to New year. The room is very clean and well-organized. Also the staffs are very friendly and helpful. This hotel provided us free champagne for my mum birthday party. This hotel located in great location. It is close to Tokyo station and Nihombashi underground train. It is easy for me to plan my trip. We went all the way to Hakone, Gala Yuzawa and Nikko by Riding Shinkasen. This hotel is the best in term of location. Also Daimaru department and Family mart are nearby, we can easily buy food and anything we need.The staffs also recommeded us many japanese shrine and temple that japanese ppl will visit during New year. They provides us with a map and direction too. 7 nights in Ryumeikan hotel was very comfortable and we will definitely stay in this hotel again.

We stayed there for 2 nights as a family of three.We initially booked a twin room as we had a kid in our family.The room was quite big for a japanese modern hotel with a nespresso coffee maker to our delight.Location was great as it was only a 10 minute walk from Tokyo Station's Yaesu north exit and not far from the airport Limousine bus station.In conclusion,it was a clean and good hotel with a splendid location.

Stayed 2 nights here... After the first two hotels in Kyoto and Osaka, the room here seemed soooo tiny! However, recounting my previous stays in Tokyo hotels, Ryumeikan was... ok in comparison.Location - Perfect. From Tokyo station, look for the Yaesu North exit (as the hotel website instructed). Get out to the main road, look across the road, to your left and look for a letter "R" at the top of the buildings. Easy to find. If you get out at Nihonbashi station, go out by exit A3 (no elevator here though). Go straight and turn left. The hotel is just around the corner. Family mart is just next door. Location wise, two thumbs up. Staff - very friendly, very helpful, excellent English. Faultless.Room - sigh... so small! Difficult to find space to open two pieces of luggage. But as I mentioned earlier, that's how Tokyo hotels seem to be like (for this price range, that is). Nonetheless, room has well connected wi-fi, and vending machines are situated on most floors, in case you need that drink real quick... Very thoughtful. Shower is really good and toilet is stocked with amenity kits.

Only a couple of blocks walk from Tokyo Station, this is a very comfortable and quiet hotel. The room was spacious, which is unusual in Japan, and nicely furnished, with a good view. Internet was free. There was a small fridge, which I like for drinks and snacks. A Japanese breakfast is available, and there are numerous restaurants within easy walking distance of the hotel.

Stayed here on the last leg of a ski holiday in Japan.we arrived late, check in was a breeze, we were actually quite amazed with the condition of the hotel, they were great. I've stayed on some of the big 5 star hotel in tokyo for biz trip and this hotel is not far from their standard less the bathroom and size. Room service was great, the room went back to original state after we arrive from our daily trip out which is great as we really need to sleep.Staff service was also great. Big thanks for the front office staff who helped us with our luggage and taxi at 4 am in the morning. I definitely highly recommended this hotel for anyone looking to stay around Tokyo station.

This does not feel like a budget hotel - though that seems to be the category it is put in. It is double the price of places like the Toyoko Inn chain and it is up to you as to whether it is worth the money. Location: Easy walking distance of Tokyo JR station (turn left out of the Yaesu North Exit and it is a short way on the other side of the road near a Family Mart) and B5 (and other exits) from Otemachi subway station. The lobby is on the 15th floor and the rooms below that. It was easy to walk to Ginza and the Imperial Palace from the hotel. Overall: great style and good quality of decor throughout - it feels like someone actually thought about this design as a simple modern hotel. The security seems to have been thought out somewhat as you need to place your key card against the panel to access any floor except the lobby / restaurant.Check In: efficient and in reasonable English although they seemed phased by the fact my friend was arriving later. They would not issue two keys until he had presented himself at reception. The room was not ready at the check in time of 2pm and they were very apologetic but it was by 2:10 - so who is to complain.Room: small but bigger than Tokyo budget standard - window was facing another building about 10 feet away but again usual for this class of hotel. Modern, clean room and well furnished. Outstanding points (for me): a Nespresso machine in the room with 8 capsules to use for 2 people and a great, powerful shower. Downside: no bath (my partner is Japanese and loves to have that). Weird: the bed. They talk about this sleep system. You push in your wake up time and then press start - soft music plays and the bed vibrates in time to the music. You don't have to do this but what the heck - I gave it a go. The wake up is the lights coming on gently with bird song playing. Restaurant: don't know because at 2,500 yen for a buffet I didn't pay for it. There is a chain coffee shop near the front door that does a set breakfast for 450 yen. Nice for a kind of half romantic stay just before Christmas - not sure I would pay the money for this to stay alone.

Hotel Ryumeikan in Tokyo should be commended for it is convenience. It’s located very near the Tokyo Central Station and a local 24/7 convenience store. This is one of the best business hotels in the area. The rooms are clean and with very good wifi services. I also noticed that the bed was very conveniently positioned to accommodate a table for breakfast. And the best part was that they had a modern bathroom. I was there for business and I noticed that their writing table has a different architectural feel to it because of the unique curve shaped directing its way to the television. I enjoyed my stay here because of the peace and quiet that I got and not to mention the best located hotel in the city.

Fantastic hotel and 5mins walk to Tokyo station. Very comfortable bed and pillows. Close to restaurants and local amenities. 15mins walk to Tokyo imperial palace. Staffs are very friendly and helpful.

Very good location, just a few steps from Tokyo Station Yaesu North Exit..... The room we stayed is very small, but very clean. Friendly staff and modern hotel! Recommend!We stayed in Ryumeikan twice during our trip to Japan. The first time we spent just one night as the other day we were heading to Kyoto. As we had 3 luggages, we asked the hotel if they could keep 2 pieces of our luggage until the next check in and they did not complain about it...
